options.title: _module.args
options.note:
Additional arguments passed to each module in addition to ones
like lib, config,
and pkgs, modulesPath.
options.type: lazy attribute set of raw value

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts
options.note: List of calendars.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable khal access.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.color
options.note: Color in which events in this calendar are displayed.
options.type: null or one of “black”, “white”, “brown”, “yellow”, “dark gray”, “dark green”, “dark blue”, “light gray”, “light green”, “light blue”, “dark magenta”, “dark cyan”, “dark red”, “light magenta”, “light cyan”, “light red”

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.glob
options.note:
The glob expansion to be searched for events or birthdays when
type is set to discover.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.priority
options.note: Priority of a calendar used for coloring.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.readOnly
options.note: Keep khal from making any changes to this account.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.khal.type
options.note: Either a single calendar (calendar which is the default) or a directory with multiple calendars (discover).

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.local
options.note: Local configuration for the calendar.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.local.encoding
options.note:
File encoding for items, both content and file name.
Defaults to UTF-8.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.local.fileExt
options.note: The file extension to use.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.local.path
options.note: The path of the storage.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.local.type
options.note: The type of the storage.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.name
options.note:
Unique identifier of the calendar. This is set to the
attribute name of the calendar configuration.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.primary
options.note:
Whether this is the primary account. Only one account may be
set as primary.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.primaryCollection
options.note:
The primary collection of the account. Required when an
account has multiple collections.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.qcal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable qcal access.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.remote
options.note: Remote configuration for the calendar.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.remote.passwordCommand
options.note: A command that prints the password to standard output.
options.example: [ "pass" "caldav" ]

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.remote.type
options.note: The type of the storage.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.remote.url
options.note: The URL of the storage.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.remote.userName
options.note: User name for authentication.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable synchronization using vdirsyncer.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.auth
options.note: Authentication settings. The default is basic.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.authCert
options.note:
Either a path to a certificate with a client certificate and
the key or a list of paths to the files with them.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.clientIdCommand
options.note:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.
options.example: [ "pass" "client_id" ]

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.clientSecretCommand
options.note:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.
options.example: [ "pass" "client_secret" ]

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.collections
options.note: The collections to synchronize between the storages.
options.type: null or (list of (string or list of string))

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.conflictResolution
options.note:
What to do in case of a conflict between the storages. Either
remote wins or
local wins or
a list that contains a command to run. By default, an error
message is printed.
options.type: null or one of “remote wins”, “local wins” or list of string

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.itemTypes
options.note:
Kinds of items to show. The default is to show everything.
This depends on particular features of the server, the results
are not validated.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.metadata
options.note:
Metadata keys that should be synchronized when vdirsyncer
metasync is executed.
options.example: [ "color" "displayname" ]

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.partialSync
options.note:
What should happen if synchronization in one direction
is impossible due to one storage being read-only.
Defaults to revert.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.postHook
options.note:
Command to call for each item creation and modification.
The command will be called with the path of the new/updated
file.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange
options.note:
A time range to synchronize. start and end can be any Python
expression that returns a datetime.datetime
object.
options.example: { end = "datetime.now() + timedelta(days=365)"; start = "datetime.now() - timedelta(days=365)"; }

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange.end
options.note: End of time range to show.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange.start
options.note: Start of time range to show.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.tokenFile
options.note: A file path where access tokens are stored.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.userAgent
options.note:
The user agent to report to the server. Defaults to
vdirsyncer.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.verify
options.note: Verify SSL certificate.

options.title: accounts.calendar.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.verifyFingerprint
options.note: Optional. SHA1 or MD5 fingerprint of the expected server certificate.

options.title: accounts.calendar.basePath
options.note:
The base directory in which to save calendars. May be a
relative path, in which case it is relative the home
directory.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts
options.note: List of contacts.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.khal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable khal access.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.khal.readOnly
options.note: Keep khal from making any changes to this account.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.khard.enable
options.note: Whether to enable khard access.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.local
options.note: Local configuration for the contacts.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.local.encoding
options.note:
File encoding for items, both content and file name.
Defaults to UTF-8.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.local.fileExt
options.note: The file extension to use.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.local.path
options.note: The path of the storage.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.local.type
options.note: The type of the storage.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.name
options.note:
Unique identifier of the contact account. This is set to the
attribute name of the contact configuration.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.remote
options.note: Remote configuration for the contacts.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.remote.passwordCommand
options.note: A command that prints the password to standard output.
options.example: [ "pass" "caldav" ]

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.remote.type
options.note: The type of the storage.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.remote.url
options.note: The URL of the storage.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.remote.userName
options.note: User name for authentication.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable synchronization using vdirsyncer.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.auth
options.note: Authentication settings. The default is basic.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.authCert
options.note:
Either a path to a certificate with a client certificate and
the key or a list of paths to the files with them.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.clientIdCommand
options.note:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.
options.example: [ "pass" "client_id" ]

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.clientSecretCommand
options.note:
A command that prints the OAuth credentials to standard
output.
options.example: [ "pass" "client_secret" ]

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.collections
options.note: The collections to synchronize between the storages.
options.type: null or (list of (string or list of string))

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.conflictResolution
options.note:
What to do in case of a conflict between the storages. Either
remote wins or
local wins or
a list that contains a command to run. By default, an error
message is printed.
options.type: null or one of “remote wins”, “local wins” or list of string

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.itemTypes
options.note:
Kinds of items to show. The default is to show everything.
This depends on particular features of the server, the results
are not validated.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.metadata
options.note:
Metadata keys that should be synchronized when vdirsyncer
metasync is executed.
options.example: [ "color" "displayname" ]

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.partialSync
options.note:
What should happen if synchronization in one direction
is impossible due to one storage being read-only.
Defaults to revert.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.postHook
options.note:
Command to call for each item creation and modification.
The command will be called with the path of the new/updated
file.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange
options.note:
A time range to synchronize. start and end can be any Python
expression that returns a datetime.datetime
object.
options.example: { end = "datetime.now() + timedelta(days=365)"; start = "datetime.now() - timedelta(days=365)"; }

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange.end
options.note: End of time range to show.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.timeRange.start
options.note: Start of time range to show.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.tokenFile
options.note: A file path where access tokens are stored.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.userAgent
options.note:
The user agent to report to the server. Defaults to
vdirsyncer.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.verify
options.note: Verify SSL certificate.

options.title: accounts.contact.accounts.<name>.vdirsyncer.verifyFingerprint
options.note: Optional. SHA1 or MD5 fingerprint of the expected server certificate.

options.title: accounts.contact.basePath
options.note:
The base directory in which to save contacts. May be a
relative path, in which case it is relative the home
directory.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts
options.note: List of email accounts.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.address
options.note: The email address of this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable aerc.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraAccounts
options.note:
Extra config added to the configuration section for this account in
$HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf.
See aerc-accounts(5).
options.type: attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraBinds
options.note:
Extra bindings specific to this account, added to
$HOME/.config/aerc/binds.conf.
See aerc-binds(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.extraConfig
options.note:
Config specific to this account, added to $HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf.
Aerc only supports per-account UI configuration.
For other sections of $HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf,
use programs.aerc.extraConfig.
See aerc-config(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapAuth
options.note:
Sets the authentication mechanism if imap is used as the incoming
method.
See aerc-imap(5).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params
options.note:
Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See aerc-imap(5).
options.example: { token_endpoint = "<token_endpoint>"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params.client_id
options.note: The OAuth2 client identifier.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params.client_secret
options.note: The OAuth2 client secret.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params.scope
options.note: The OAuth2 requested scope.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.imapOauth2Params.token_endpoint
options.note: The OAuth2 token endpoint.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpAuth
options.note:
Sets the authentication mechanism if smtp is used as the outgoing
method.
See aerc-smtp(5).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params
options.note:
Sets the oauth2 params if authentication mechanism oauthbearer or
xoauth2 is used.
See aerc-imap(5).
options.example: { token_endpoint = "<token_endpoint>"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.client_id
options.note: The OAuth2 client identifier.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.client_secret
options.note: The OAuth2 client secret.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.scope
options.note: The OAuth2 requested scope.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aerc.smtpOauth2Params.token_endpoint
options.note: The OAuth2 token endpoint.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.aliases
options.note: Alternative email addresses of this account.
options.type: list of string matching the pattern .*@.*
options.example: [ "webmaster@example.org" "admin@example.org" ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.contactCompletion
options.note:
Contact completion configuration as expected per alot.
See alot’s wiki for
explanation about possible values.
options.example: { type = "shellcommand"; command = "abook --mutt-query"; regexp = "'^(?P<email>[^@]+@[^\t]+)\t+(?P<name>[^\t]+)'"; ignorecase = "True"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings to add to this Alot account configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.alot.sendMailCommand
options.note:
Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Astroid.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings to add to this astroid account configuration.
options.example: { select_query = ""; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.astroid.sendMailCommand
options.note:
Command to send a mail. If msmtp is enabled for the account,
then this is set to
msmtpq --read-envelope-from --read-recipients.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.flavor
options.note:
Some email providers have peculiar behavior that require
special treatment. This option is therefore intended to
indicate the nature of the provider.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders
options.note: Standard email folders.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.drafts
options.note: Relative path of the drafts mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.inbox
options.note: Relative path of the inbox mail.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.sent
options.note: Relative path of the sent mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.folders.trash
options.note: Relative path of the deleted mail folder.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the getmail mail retriever for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.delete
options.note:
Enable if you want to delete read messages from the server. Most
users should either enable delete or disable
readAll.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.destinationCommand
options.note: Specify a command delivering the incoming mail to your maildir.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.mailboxes
options.note:
A non-empty list of mailboxes. To download all mail you can
use the ALL mailbox.
options.example: [ "INBOX" "INBOX.spam" ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.getmail.readAll
options.note:
Enable if you want to fetch all, even the read messages from the
server. Most users should either enable delete or
disable readAll.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg
options.note: GPG configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.encryptByDefault
options.note: Encrypt outgoing messages by default.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.key
options.note: The key to use as listed in gpg --list-keys.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.gpg.signByDefault
options.note: Sign messages by default.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the email client Himalaya CLI for this email account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.himalaya.settings
options.note:
Himalaya CLI configuration for this email account.
See https://pimalaya.org/himalaya/cli/latest/configuration/index.html#account-configuration for supported values.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap
options.note: The IMAP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.host
options.note: Hostname of IMAP server.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.port
options.note:
The port on which the IMAP server listens. If
null then the default port is used.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls
options.note: Configuration for secure connections.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.enable
options.note: Whether to enable TLS/SSL.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.certificatesFile
options.note:
Path to file containing certificate authorities that should
be used to validate the connection authenticity. If
null then the system default is used.
Note, if set then the system default may still be accepted.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imap.tls.useStartTls
options.note: Whether to use STARTTLS.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.enable
options.note: Whether to enable imapnotify.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.boxes
options.note: IMAP folders to watch.
options.example: [ "Inbox" "[Gmail]/MyLabel" ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add for this account.
options.example: { wait = 10; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotify
options.note: Shell commands to run on any event.
options.type: string or attribute set of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.imapnotify.onNotifyPost
options.note: Shell commands to run after onNotify event.
options.type: string or attribute set of string
options.example: { mail = "\${pkgs.notmuch}/bin/notmuch new && \${pkgs.libnotify}/bin/notify-send 'New mail arrived'"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap
options.note: The JMAP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.host
options.note: Hostname of JMAP server.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.jmap.sessionUrl
options.note: URL for the JMAP Session resource.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.notmuchSetupWarning
options.note: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings
options.note:
Settings which are applied to .gmailieer.json
for the account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.drop_non_existing_label
options.note: Allow missing labels on the Gmail side to be dropped.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.file_extension
options.note:
Extension to include in local file names, which can be useful
for indexing with third-party programs.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_empty_history
options.note:
Work around a Gmail API quirk where an empty change history
is sometimes returned.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_remote_labels
options.note:
Set Gmail labels to ignore when syncing from remote labels to
local tags (before translations).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.ignore_tags
options.note:
Set labels to ignore when syncing from local tags to
remote labels (after translations).

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.local_trash_tag
options.note: Local tag to which the remote Gmail ‘TRASH’ label is translated.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.remove_local_messages
options.note: Remove local messages that have been deleted on the remote.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.replace_slash_with_dot
options.note: Replace ‘/’ with ‘.’ in Gmail labels.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.settings.timeout
options.note: HTTP timeout in seconds. 0 means forever or system timeout.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lieer synchronization service.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.lieer.sync.frequency
options.note: How often to synchronize the account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir
options.note: Maildir configuration for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.maildir.path
options.note:
Path to maildir directory where mail for this account is
stored. This is relative to the base maildir path.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable synchronization using mbsync.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.create
options.note:
Automatically create missing mailboxes within the
given mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.expunge
options.note:
Permanently remove messages marked for deletion from
the given mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.account
options.note: Account section extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.example: { PipelineDepth = 10; Timeout = 60; };

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.channel
options.note: Per channel extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.example: { MaxMessages = 10000; MaxSize = "1m"; };

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.local
options.note: Local store extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.extraConfig.remote
options.note: Remote store extra configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.flatten
options.note:
If set, flattens the hierarchy within the maildir by
substituting the canonical hierarchy delimiter
/ with this value.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups
options.note:
Some email providers (Gmail) have a different directory hierarchy for
synchronized email messages. Namely, when using mbsync without specifying
a set of channels into a group, all synchronized directories end up beneath
the [Gmail]/ directory.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels
options.note:
List of channels that should be grouped together into this group. When
performing a synchronization, the groups are synchronized, rather than
the individual channels.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to THIS channel’s
configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string)
options.example: { Create = "both"; CopyArrivalDate = "yes"; MaxMessages = 10000; MaxSize = "1m"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.farPattern
options.note:
IMAP4 patterns for which mailboxes on the remote mail server to sync.
If Patterns are specified, farPattern
is interpreted as a prefix which is not matched against the patterns,
and is not affected by mailbox list overrides.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.name
options.note:
The unique name for THIS channel in THIS group. The group will refer to
this channel by this name.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.nearPattern
options.note:
Name for where mail coming from the remote (far) mail server will end up
locally. The mailbox specified by the far pattern will be placed in
this directory.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.channels.<name>.patterns
options.note:
Instead of synchronizing just the mailboxes that
match the farPattern, use it as a prefix which is
not matched against the patterns, and is not affected by mailbox list
overrides.
options.example: [ "INBOX" ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.groups.<name>.name
options.note:
The name of this group for this account. These names are different than
some others, because they will hide channel names that are the same.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.patterns
options.note: Pattern of mailboxes to synchronize.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.remove
options.note: Propagate mailbox deletions to the given mail store.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mbsync.subFolders
options.note:
The on-disk folder naming style. This option has no
effect when flatten is used.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.enable
options.note: Whether to enable msmtp.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to ~/.msmtprc.
See https://marlam.de/msmtp/msmtprc.txt for
examples.
options.example: { auth = "login"; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.msmtp.tls.fingerprint
options.note:
Fingerprint of a trusted TLS certificate.
The fingerprint can be obtained by executing
msmtp --serverinfo --tls --tls-certcheck=off.
options.type: null or string matching the pattern ([[:alnum:]]{2}:)+[[:alnum:]]{2}

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mu.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mu indexing.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mujmap JMAP synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.notmuchSetupWarning
options.note: Warn if Notmuch is not also enabled for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings
options.note:
Settings which are applied to mujmap.toml
for the account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.auto_create_new_mailboxes
options.note:
Whether to create new mailboxes automatically on the server from notmuch
tags.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.cache_dir
options.note:
The cache directory in which to store mail files while they are being
downloaded. The default is operating-system specific.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.fqdn
options.note: Fully qualified domain name of the JMAP service.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.password_command
options.note:
Shell command which will print a password to stdout for basic HTTP
authentication.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.session_url
options.note: Session URL to connect to.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags
options.note: Tag configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.deleted
options.note:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
Trash name attribute.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.directory_separator
options.note: Directory separator for mapping notmuch tags to maildirs.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.important
options.note:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
Important name attribute and/or with the $Important
keyword.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.inbox
options.note:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
Inbox name attribute.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.lowercase
options.note:
If true, translate all mailboxes to lowercase names when mapping to notmuch
tags.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.phishing
options.note: Tag for notmuch to use for the IANA $Phishing keyword.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.sent
options.note:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
Sent name attribute.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.tags.spam
options.note:
Tag for notmuch to use for messages stored in the mailbox labeled with the
Junk name attribute and/or with the $Junk keyword,
except for messages with the $NotJunk keyword.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.mujmap.settings.username
options.note: Username for basic HTTP authentication.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.name
options.note:
Unique identifier of the account. This is set to the
attribute name of the account configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable NeoMutt.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines to add to the folder hook for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.extraMailboxes
options.note: List of extra mailboxes

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.mailboxName
options.note: Use a different name as mailbox name

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.mailboxType
options.note: Whether this account uses maildir folders or IMAP mailboxes

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.neomutt.sendMailCommand
options.note: Command to send a mail. If not set, neomutt will be in charge of sending mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.enable
options.note: Whether to enable notmuch indexing.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Notmuch support in NeoMutt.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes
options.note: List of virtual mailboxes using Notmuch queries
options.example: [ { name = "My INBOX"; query = "tag:inbox"; } ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.limit
options.note: Restricts number of messages/threads in the result.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.name
options.note: Name to display

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.query
options.note: Notmuch query

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.notmuch.neomutt.virtualMailboxes.*.type
options.note: Reads all matching messages or whole-threads. The default is ‘messages’ or nm_query_type.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.enable
options.note: Whether to enable OfflineIMAP.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.account
options.note: Extra configuration options to add to the account section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { autorefresh = 20; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.local
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to the local account
section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { sync_deletes = true; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.extraConfig.remote
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to the remote account
section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { expunge = false; maxconnections = 2; }

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.offlineimap.postSyncHookCommand
options.note: Command to run after fetching new mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.passwordCommand
options.note:
A command, which when run writes the account password on
standard output.
options.type: null or string or list of string

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.primary
options.note:
Whether this is the primary account. Only one account may be
set as primary.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.realName
options.note: Name displayed when sending mails.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature
options.note: Signature configuration.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.command
options.note: A command that generates a signature.
options.example: pkgs.writeScript "signature" "echo This is my signature"

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.delimiter
options.note: The delimiter used between the document and the signature.
options.example: ~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~*~

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.showSignature
options.note: Method to communicate the signature.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.signature.text
options.note: Signature content.
options.example: '' -- Luke Skywalker May the force be with you. ''

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp
options.note: The SMTP configuration to use for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.host
options.note: Hostname of SMTP server.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.port
options.note:
The port on which the SMTP server listens. If
null then the default port is used.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls
options.note: Configuration for secure connections.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.enable
options.note: Whether to enable TLS/SSL.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.certificatesFile
options.note:
Path to file containing certificate authorities that should
be used to validate the connection authenticity. If
null then the system default is used.
Note, if set then the system default may still be accepted.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.smtp.tls.useStartTls
options.note: Whether to use STARTTLS.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Thunderbird mail client for this account.

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.perIdentitySettings
options.note:
Extra settings to add to each identity of this Thunderbird
account configuration. The id given as
argument is an automatically generated identifier.
options.type: function that evaluates to a(n) attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: id: { "mail.identity.id_${id}.protectSubject" = false; "mail.identity.id_${id}.autoEncryptDrafts" = false; };

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.profiles
options.note:
List of Thunderbird profiles for which this account should be
enabled. If this list is empty (the default), this account will
be enabled for all declared profiles.
options.example: [ "profile1" "profile2" ]

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.thunderbird.settings
options.note:
Extra settings to add to this Thunderbird account configuration.
The id given as argument is an automatically
generated account identifier.
options.type: function that evaluates to a(n) attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: id: { "mail.server.server_${id}.check_new_mail" = false; };

options.title: accounts.email.accounts.<name>.userName
options.note:
The server username of this account. This will be used as
the SMTP, IMAP, and JMAP user name.

options.title: accounts.email.certificatesFile
options.note:
Path to default file containing certificate authorities that
should be used to validate the connection authenticity. This
path may be overridden on a per-account basis.

options.title: accounts.email.maildirBasePath
options.note:
The base directory for account maildir directories. May be a
relative path, in which case it is relative the home
directory.

options.title: dconf.settings
options.note: Settings to write to the dconf configuration system.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (GVariant value)
options.example: { "org/gnome/calculator" = { button-mode = "programming"; show-thousands = true; base = 10; word-size = 64; window-position = lib.hm.gvariant.mkTuple [100 100]; }; }

options.title: editorconfig.enable
options.note: Whether to enable EditorConfig home configuration file.

options.title: editorconfig.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to $HOME/.editorconfig.
root = true is automatically added to the file,
it must not be added here.
See https://editorconfig.org for documentation.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { "*" = { charset = "utf-8"; end_of_line = "lf"; trim_trailing_whitespace = true; insert_final_newline = true; max_line_width = 78; indent_style = "space"; indent_size = 4; }; };

options.title: fonts.fontconfig.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable fontconfig configuration. This will, for
example, allow fontconfig to discover fonts and
configurations installed through
home.packages and
nix-env.

options.title: gtk.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GTK 2/3 configuration.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme
options.note: The cursor theme to use.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.package
options.note:
Package providing the cursor theme. This package will be installed
to your profile. If null then the theme
is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.name
options.note: The name of the cursor theme within the package.

options.title: gtk.cursorTheme.size
options.note: The size of the cursor.

options.title: gtk.font
options.note: The font to use in GTK+ 2/3 applications.

options.title: gtk.font.package
options.note:
Package providing the font. This package will be installed
to your profile. If null then the font
is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.font.name
options.note: The family name of the font within the package.

options.title: gtk.font.size
options.note: The size of the font.
options.type: null or signed integer or floating point number

options.title: gtk.gtk2.configLocation
options.note: The location to put the GTK configuration file.

options.title: gtk.gtk2.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to
~/.gtkrc-2.0.

options.title: gtk.gtk3.bookmarks
options.note: Bookmarks in the sidebar of the GTK file browser
options.example: [ "file:///home/jane/Documents" ]

options.title: gtk.gtk3.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-3.0/settings.ini.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { gtk-cursor-blink = false; gtk-recent-files-limit = 20; }

options.title: gtk.gtk3.extraCss
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-3.0/gtk.css.

options.title: gtk.gtk4.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-4.0/settings.ini.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { gtk-cursor-blink = false; gtk-recent-files-limit = 20; }

options.title: gtk.gtk4.extraCss
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gtk-4.0/gtk.css.

options.title: gtk.iconTheme
options.note: The icon theme to use.

options.title: gtk.iconTheme.package
options.note:
Package providing the icon theme. This package will be installed
to your profile. If null then the theme
is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.iconTheme.name
options.note: The name of the icon theme within the package.

options.title: gtk.theme
options.note: The GTK+2/3 theme to use.

options.title: gtk.theme.package
options.note:
Package providing the theme. This package will be installed
to your profile. If null then the theme
is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: gtk.theme.name
options.note: The name of the theme within the package.

options.title: home.enableDebugInfo
options.note:
Some Nix packages provide debug symbols for
gdb in the debug output.
This option ensures that those are automatically fetched from
the binary cache if available and gdb is
configured to find those symbols.

options.title: home.enableNixpkgsReleaseCheck
options.note:
Determines whether to check for release version mismatch between Home
Manager and Nixpkgs. Using mismatched versions is likely to cause errors
and unexpected behavior. It is therefore highly recommended to use a
release of Home Manager that corresponds with your chosen release of
Nixpkgs.

options.title: home.packages
options.note: The set of packages to appear in the user environment.

options.title: home.activation
options.note:
The activation scripts blocks to run when activating a Home
Manager generation. Any entry here should be idempotent,
meaning running twice or more times produces the same result
as running it once.
options.example: { myActivationAction = lib.hm.dag.entryAfter ["writeBoundary"] '' run ln -s $VERBOSE_ARG \ ${builtins.toPath ./link-me-directly} $HOME ''; }

options.description: Runs the given command on live run, otherwise prints the command to standard output.
Runs the given command on live run and sends its standard and error output to /dev/null, otherwise prints the command to standard output.

options.title: home.extraOutputsToInstall
options.note:
List of additional package outputs of the packages
home.packages that should be installed into
the user environment.
options.example: [ "doc" "info" "devdoc" ]

options.title: home.file
options.note: Attribute set of files to link into the user home.

options.title: home.file.<name>.enable
options.note:
Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific
files to be disabled.

options.title: home.file.<name>.executable
options.note:
Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the mode
of the source file or to false
for files created through the text option.

options.title: home.file.<name>.onChange
options.note:
Shell commands to run when file has changed between
generations. The script will be run
after the new files have been linked
into place.

options.title: home.file.<name>.recursive
options.note:
If the file source is a directory, then this option
determines whether the directory should be recursively
linked to the target location. This option has no effect
if the source is a file.

options.title: home.file.<name>.source
options.note:
Path of the source file or directory. If
home.file.<name>.text
is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file
containing that text.

options.title: home.file.<name>.target
options.note: Path to target file relative to HOME.

options.title: home.file.<name>.text
options.note:
Text of the file. If this option is null then
home.file.<name>.source
must be set.

options.title: home.homeDirectory
options.note: The user’s home directory. Must be an absolute path.

options.title: home.keyboard
options.note:
Keyboard configuration. Set to null to
disable Home Manager keyboard management.

options.title: home.keyboard.layout
options.note:
Keyboard layout. If null, then the system
configuration will be used.

options.title: home.keyboard.model
options.note: Keyboard model.

options.title: home.keyboard.options
options.note: X keyboard options; layout switching goes here.
options.example: [ "grp:caps_toggle" "grp_led:scroll" ]

options.title: home.keyboard.variant
options.note:
X keyboard variant. If null, then the
system configuration will be used.

options.title: home.language
options.note: Language configuration.

options.title: home.language.address
options.note: The language to use for addresses.

options.title: home.language.base
options.note: The language to use unless overridden by a more specific option.

options.title: home.language.collate
options.note: The language to use for collation (alphabetical ordering).

options.title: home.language.ctype
options.note: Character classification category.

options.title: home.language.measurement
options.note: The language to use for measurement values.

options.title: home.language.messages
options.note: The language to use for messages, application UI languages, etc.

options.title: home.language.monetary
options.note: The language to use for formatting currencies and money amounts.

options.title: home.language.name
options.note: The language to use for personal names.

options.title: home.language.numeric
options.note: The language to use for numerical values.

options.title: home.language.paper
options.note: The language to use for paper sizes.

options.title: home.language.telephone
options.note: The language to use for telephone numbers.

options.title: home.language.time
options.note: The language to use for formatting times.

options.title: home.pointerCursor
options.note: Cursor configuration. Set to null to disable.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.package
options.note: Package providing the cursor theme.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.gtk.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable gtk config generation for home.pointerCursor
.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.name
options.note: The cursor name within the package.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.size
options.note: The cursor size.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable x11 config generation for home.pointerCursor
.

options.title: home.pointerCursor.x11.defaultCursor
options.note: The default cursor file to use within the package.

options.title: home.profileDirectory
options.note: The profile directory where Home Manager generations are installed.

options.title: home.sessionPath
options.note: Extra directories to add to PATH.
options.example: [ "$HOME/.local/bin" "\${xdg.configHome}/emacs/bin" ".git/safe/../../bin" ]

options.title: home.sessionVariables
options.note: Environment variables to always set at login.
options.type: lazy attribute set of (string or path or signed integer or floating point number)
options.example: { EDITOR = "emacs"; GS_OPTIONS = "-sPAPERSIZE=a4"; }

options.title: home.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { g = "git"; "..." = "cd ../.."; }

options.title: home.stateVersion
options.note:
It is occasionally necessary for Home Manager to change
configuration defaults in a way that is incompatible with
stateful data. This could, for example, include switching the
default data format or location of a file.

options.title: home.username
options.note: The user’s username.

options.title: i18n.glibcLocales
options.note:
Customized glibcLocales package providing
the LOCALE_ARCHIVE_* environment variable.
options.example: pkgs.glibcLocales.override { allLocales = false; locales = [ "en_US.UTF-8/UTF-8" ]; }

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.enabled
options.note:
Select the enabled input method. Input methods are software to input
symbols that are not available on standard input devices.

options.description: A customizable lightweight input method. The next generation of fcitx. Addons (including engines, dictionaries, skins) can be added using i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons.
A Korean input method based on XIM. Nabi doesn’t support Qt 5.
The “universal input method” is a library with an XIM bridge. uim mainly supports Chinese, Japanese and Korean.
An extremely easy-to-use input method framework.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.fcitx5.addons
options.note: Enabled Fcitx5 addons.

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.kime.config
options.note:
kime configuration. Refer to
https://github.com/Riey/kime/blob/develop/docs/CONFIGURATION.md
for details on supported values.
options.example: { daemon = { modules = ["Xim" "Indicator"]; }; indicator = { icon_color = "White"; }; engine = { hangul = { layout = "dubeolsik"; }; }; }

options.title: i18n.inputMethod.uim.toolbar
options.note: Selected UIM toolbar.

options.title: launchd.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Home Manager to define per-user daemons by making use
of launchd’s LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents
options.note: Define LaunchAgents.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ‹name›.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config
options.note: Define a launchd job. See launchd.plist(5) for details.
options.example: { ProgramArguments = [ "/usr/bin/say" "Good afternoon" ]; StartCalendarInterval = [ { Hour = 12; Minute = 0; } ]; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.AbandonProcessGroup
options.note:
When a job dies, launchd kills any remaining processes with the same process group ID as the job. Setting
this key to true disables that behavior.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Debug
options.note:
This optional key specifies that launchd should adjust its log mask temporarily to LOG_DEBUG while
dealing with this job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Disabled
options.note:
This optional key is used as a hint to launchctl(1) that it should not submit this job to launchd when
loading a job or jobs. The value of this key does NOT reflect the current state of the job on the running
system. If you wish to know whether a job is loaded in launchd, reading this key from a configuration
file yourself is not a sufficient test. You should query launchd for the presence of the job using
the launchctl(1) list subcommand or use the ServiceManagement framework’s
SMJobCopyDictionary() method.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableGlobbing
options.note: This flag causes launchd to use the glob(3) mechanism to update the program arguments before invocation.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnableTransactions
options.note:
This flag instructs launchd that the job promises to use vproc_transaction_begin(3) and
vproc_transaction_end(3) to track outstanding transactions that need to be reconciled before the
process can safely terminate. If no outstanding transactions are in progress, then launchd is free to
send the SIGKILL signal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.EnvironmentVariables
options.note:
This optional key is used to specify additional environment variables to be set before running the
job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ExitTimeOut
options.note:
The amount of time launchd waits before sending a SIGKILL signal. The default value is 20 seconds. The
value zero is interpreted as infinity.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.GroupName
options.note:
This optional key specifies the group to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root. If UserName is set and GroupName is not, the the group will be set to the default
group of the user.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits
options.note:
Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The following
keys apply:
options.example: { NumberOfFiles = 4096; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.CPU
options.note: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Core
options.note: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Data
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.FileSize
options.note: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.note: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.note:
The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)
value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.note:
The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid
(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.HardResourceLimits.Stack
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’s
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.InitGroups
options.note:
This optional key specifies whether initgroups(3) should be called before running the job.  The default
is true in 10.5 and false in 10.4. This key will be ignored if the UserName key is not set.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.KeepAlive
options.note:
This optional key is used to control whether your job is to be kept continuously running or to let
demand and conditions control the invocation. The default is false and therefore only demand will start
the job. The value may be set to true to unconditionally keep the job alive. Alternatively, a dictionary
of conditions may be specified to selectively control whether launchd keeps a job alive or not. If
multiple keys are provided, launchd ORs them, thus providing maximum flexibility to the job to refine
the logic and stall if necessary. If launchd finds no reason to restart the job, it falls back on
demand based invocation.  Jobs that exit quickly and frequently when configured to be kept alive will
be throttled to converve system resources.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Label
options.note: This required key uniquely identifies the job to launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchEvents
options.note:
Specifies higher-level event types to be used as launch-on-demand event
sources.  Each sub-dictionary defines events for a particular event
subsystem, such as “com.apple.iokit.matching”, which can be used to
launch jobs based on the appearance of nodes in the IORegistry. Each
dictionary within the sub-dictionary specifies an event descriptor that
is specified to each event subsystem. With this key, the job promises to
use the xpc_set_event_stream_handler(3) API to consume events. See
xpc_events(3) for more details on event sources.
options.example: { "com.apple.iokit.matching" = { "com.apple.usb.device" = { IOMatchLaunchStream = true; IOProviderClass = "IOUSBDevice"; idProduct = "*"; idVendor = "*"; }; }; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LaunchOnlyOnce
options.note:
This optional key specifies whether the job can only be run once and only once.  In other words, if the
job cannot be safely respawned without a full machine reboot, then set this key to be true.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadFromHosts
options.note:
This configuration file only applies to hosts NOT listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToHosts
options.note:
This configuration file only applies to the hosts listed with this key. Note: One should set kern.hostname
in sysctl.conf(5) for this feature to work reliably.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LimitLoadToSessionType
options.note:
This configuration file only applies to sessions of the type specified. This key is used in concert
with the -S flag to launchctl.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.LowPriorityIO
options.note:
This optional key specifies whether the kernel should consider this daemon to be low priority when
doing file system I/O.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices
options.note:
This optional key is used to specify Mach services to be registered with the Mach bootstrap sub-system.
Each key in this dictionary should be the name of service to be advertised. The value of the key must
be a boolean and set to true.  Alternatively, a dictionary can be used instead of a simple true value.
options.example: { ResetAtClose = true; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.HideUntilCheckIn
options.note:
Reserve the name in the namespace, but cause bootstrap_look_up() to fail until the job has
checked in with launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.MachServices.ResetAtClose
options.note:
If this boolean is false, the port is recycled, thus leaving clients to remain oblivious to the
demand nature of job. If the value is set to true, clients receive port death notifications when
the job lets go of the receive right. The port will be recreated atomically with respect to bootstrap_look_up()
calls, so that clients can trust that after receiving a port death notification,
the new port will have already been recreated. Setting the value to true should be done with
care. Not all clients may be able to handle this behavior. The default value is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Nice
options.note: This optional key specifies what nice(3) value should be applied to the daemon.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.OnDemand
options.note:
This key was used in Mac OS X 10.4 to control whether a job was kept alive or not. The default was
true.  This key has been deprecated and replaced in Mac OS X 10.5 and later with the more powerful
KeepAlive option.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProcessType
options.note:
This optional key describes, at a high level, the intended purpose of the job.  The system will apply
resource limits based on what kind of job it is. If left unspecified, the system will apply light
resource limits to the job, throttling its CPU usage and I/O bandwidth. The following are valid values:

options.description: Background jobs are generally processes that do work that was not directly requested by the user. The resource limits applied to Background jobs are intended to prevent them from disrupting the user experience.
Standard jobs are equivalent to no ProcessType being set.
Adaptive jobs move between the Background and Interactive classifications based on activity over XPC connections. See xpc_transaction_begin(3) for details.

Interactive jobs run with the same resource limitations as apps, that is to say, none. Interactive jobs are critical to maintaining a responsive user experience, and this key should only be used if an app’s ability to be responsive depends on it, and cannot be made Adaptive.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Program
options.note:
This key maps to the first argument of execvp(3).  If this key is missing, then the first element of
the array of strings provided to the ProgramArguments will be used instead.  This key is required in
the absence of the ProgramArguments key.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ProgramArguments
options.note:
This key maps to the second argument of execvp(3).  This key is required in the absence of the Program
key. Please note: many people are confused by this key. Please read execvp(3) very carefully!

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.QueueDirectories
options.note:
Much like the WatchPaths option, this key will watch the paths for modifications. The difference being
that the job will only be started if the path is a directory and the directory is not empty.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RootDirectory
options.note: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chroot(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.RunAtLoad
options.note:
This optional key is used to control whether your job is launched once at the time the job is loaded.
The default is false.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets
options.note:
This optional key is used to specify launch on demand sockets that can be used to let launchd know when
to run the job. The job must check-in to get a copy of the file descriptors using APIs outlined in
launch(3).  The keys of the top level Sockets dictionary can be anything. They are meant for the application
developer to use to differentiate which descriptors correspond to which application level protocols
(e.g. http vs. ftp vs. DNS…).  At check-in time, the value of each Sockets dictionary key will
be an array of descriptors. Daemon/Agent writers should consider all descriptors of a given key to be
to be effectively equivalent, even though each file descriptor likely represents a different networking
protocol which conforms to the criteria specified in the job configuration file.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.Bonjour
options.note:
This optional key can be used to request that the service be registered with the
mDNSResponder(8).  If the value is boolean, the service name is inferred from the SockServiceName.
options.type: null or boolean or list of string

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.MulticastGroup
options.note:
This optional key can be used to request that the datagram socket join a multicast group.  If the
value is a hostname, then getaddrinfo(3) will be used to join the correct multicast address for a
given socket family.  If an explicit IPv4 or IPv6 address is given, it is required that the SockFamily
family also be set, otherwise the results are undefined.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SecureSocketWithKey
options.note:
This optional key is a variant of SockPathName. Instead of binding to a known path, a securely
generated socket is created and the path is assigned to the environment variable that is inherited
by all jobs spawned by launchd.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockFamily
options.note: This optional key can be used to specifically request that “IPv4” or “IPv6” socket(s) be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockNodeName
options.note: This optional key specifies the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPassive
options.note:
This optional key specifies whether listen(2) or connect(2) should be called on the created file
descriptor. The default is true (“to listen”).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathMode
options.note:
This optional key specifies the mode of the socket. Known bug: Property lists don’t support
octal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockPathName
options.note:
This optional key implies SockFamily is set to “Unix”. It specifies the path to connect(2) or
bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockProtocol
options.note:
This optional key specifies the protocol to be passed to socket(2).  The only value understood by
this key at the moment is “TCP”.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockServiceName
options.note: This optional key specifies the service on the node to connect(2) or bind(2) to.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Sockets.<name>.SockType
options.note:
This optional key tells launchctl what type of socket to create. The default is “stream” and
other valid values for this key are “dgram” and “seqpacket” respectively.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits
options.note:
Resource limits to be imposed on the job. These adjust variables set with setrlimit(2).  The following
keys apply:

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.CPU
options.note: The maximum amount of cpu time (in seconds) to be used by each process.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Core
options.note: The largest size (in bytes) core file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Data
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the data segment for a process; this defines how far a program may
extend its break with the sbrk(2) system call.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.FileSize
options.note: The largest size (in bytes) file that may be created.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.MemoryLock
options.note: The maximum size (in bytes) which a process may lock into memory using the mlock(2) function.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfFiles
options.note:
The maximum number of open files for this process.  Setting this value in a system wide daemon
will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxfiles (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxfilesperproc (HardResourceLimits)
value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.NumberOfProcesses
options.note:
The maximum number of simultaneous processes for this user id.  Setting this value in a system
wide daemon will set the sysctl(3) kern.maxproc (SoftResourceLimits) or kern.maxprocperuid
(HardResourceLimits) value in addition to the setrlimit(2) values.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.ResidentSetSize
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) to which a process’s resident set size may grow.  This imposes a
limit on the amount of physical memory to be given to a process; if memory is tight, the system
will prefer to take memory from processes that are exceeding their declared resident set size.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.SoftResourceLimits.Stack
options.note:
The maximum size (in bytes) of the stack segment for a process; this defines how far a program’s
stack segment may be extended.  Stack extension is performed automatically by the system.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardErrorPath
options.note: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stderr when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardInPath
options.note:
This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being supplied to stdin when using
stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StandardOutPath
options.note: This optional key specifies what file should be used for data being sent to stdout when using stdio(3).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval
options.note:
This optional key causes the job to be started every calendar interval as specified. Missing arguments
are considered to be wildcard. The semantics are much like crontab(5).  Unlike cron which skips job
invocations when the computer is asleep, launchd will start the job the next time the computer wakes
up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is woken, those events will be coalesced into
one event upon wake from sleep.
options.example: { Hour = 2; Minute = 30; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Day
options.note: The day on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Hour
options.note: The hour on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Minute
options.note: The minute on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Month
options.note: The month on which this job will be run.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartCalendarInterval.*.Weekday
options.note: The weekday on which this job will be run (0 and 7 are Sunday).

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartInterval
options.note:
This optional key causes the job to be started every N seconds.  If the system is asleep, the job will
be started the next time the computer wakes up.  If multiple intervals transpire before the computer is
woken, those events will be coalesced into one event upon wake from sleep.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.StartOnMount
options.note: This optional key causes the job to be started every time a filesystem is mounted.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.ThrottleInterval
options.note:
This key lets one override the default throttling policy imposed on jobs by launchd.  The value is in
seconds, and by default, jobs will not be spawned more than once every 10 seconds.  The principle
behind this is that jobs should linger around just in case they are needed again in the near future.
This not only reduces the latency of responses, but it encourages developers to amortize the cost of
program invocation.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.TimeOut
options.note:
The recommended idle time out (in seconds) to pass to the job. If no value is specified, a default time
out will be supplied by launchd for use by the job at check in time.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.Umask
options.note:
This optional key specifies what value should be passed to umask(2) before running the job. Known bug:
Property lists don’t support octal, so please convert the value to decimal.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.UserName
options.note:
This optional key specifies the user to run the job as. This key is only applicable when launchd is
running as root.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WaitForDebugger
options.note:
This optional key specifies that launchd should instruct the kernel to have the job wait for a debugger
to attach before any code in the job is executed.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WatchPaths
options.note: This optional key causes the job to be started if any one of the listed paths are modified.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.WorkingDirectory
options.note: This optional key is used to specify a directory to chdir(2) to before running the job.

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility
options.note: The presence of this key specifies that the daemon expects to be run as if it were launched from inetd.
options.example: { Wait = true; }

options.title: launchd.agents.<name>.config.inetdCompatibility.Wait
options.note:
This flag corresponds to the “wait” or “nowait” option of inetd. If true, then the listening
socket is passed via the standard in/out/error file descriptors. If false, then accept(2) is
called on behalf of the job, and the result is passed via the standard in/out/error descriptors.

options.title: lib
options.note:
This option allows modules to define helper functions,
constants, etc.

options.title: manual.html.enable
options.note:
Whether to install the HTML manual. This also installs the
home-manager-help tool, which opens a local
copy of the Home Manager manual in the system web browser.

options.title: manual.json.enable
options.note:
Whether to install a JSON formatted list of all Home Manager
options. This can be located at
<profile directory>/share/doc/home-manager/options.json,
and may be used for navigating definitions, auto-completing,
and other miscellaneous tasks.

options.title: manual.manpages.enable
options.note:
Whether to install the configuration manual page. The manual can
be reached by man home-configuration.nix.

options.title: news.display
options.note:
How unread and relevant news should be presented when
running home-manager build and
home-manager switch.

options.description: Do not print anything during build or switch. The home-manager news command still works for viewing the entries.
The number of unread and relevant news entries will be printed to standard output. The home-manager news command can later be used to view the entries.
A pager showing unread news entries is opened.

options.title: nix.package
options.note: The Nix package that the configuration should be generated for.

options.title: nix.checkConfig
options.note:
If enabled (the default), checks for data type mismatches and that Nix
can parse the generated nix.conf.

options.title: nix.extraOptions
options.note: Additional text appended to nix.conf.
options.example: '' keep-outputs = true keep-derivations = true ''

options.title: nix.gc.automatic
options.note: Automatically run the garbage collector at a specific time.

options.title: nix.gc.frequency
options.note: The frequency at which to run the garbage collector.

options.title: nix.gc.options
options.note:
Options given to nix-collect-garbage when the
garbage collector is run automatically.

options.title: nix.registry
options.note: User level flake registry.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.exact
options.note:
Whether the from reference needs to match exactly. If set,
a from reference like nixpkgs does not
match with a reference like nixpkgs/nixos-20.03.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.flake
options.note: The flake input to which from> is to be rewritten.

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.from
options.note: The flake reference to be rewritten.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)
options.example: { id = "nixpkgs"; type = "indirect"; }

options.title: nix.registry.<name>.to
options.note: The flake reference to which from> is to be rewritten.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or package)
options.example: { owner = "my-org"; repo = "my-nixpkgs"; type = "github"; }

options.title: nix.settings
options.note:
Configuration for Nix; see nix.conf(5) for available options.
The value declared here will be translated directly to the key-value pairs Nix expects.
options.type: attribute set of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package) or list of (Nix config atom (null, bool, int, float, str, path or package)))
options.example: { use-sandbox = true; show-trace = true; system-features = [ "big-parallel" "kvm" "recursive-nix" ]; }

options.title: nixpkgs.config
options.note:
The configuration of the Nix Packages collection. (For
details, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to set
package configuration options.
options.example: { allowBroken = true; }

options.title: nixpkgs.overlays
options.note:
List of overlays to use with the Nix Packages collection. (For
details, see the Nixpkgs documentation.) It allows you to
override packages globally. This is a function that takes as
an argument the original Nixpkgs. The
first argument should be used for finding dependencies, and
the second should be used for overriding recipes.
options.example: [ (final: prev: { openssh = prev.openssh.override { hpnSupport = true; withKerberos = true; kerberos = final.libkrb5; }; }) ]

options.title: pam.sessionVariables
options.note:
Environment variables that will be set for the PAM session.
The variable values must be as described in
pam_env.conf(5).
options.example: { EDITOR = "vim"; }

options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.ids
options.note:
List of authorized YubiKey token IDs. Refer to
https://developers.yubico.com/yubico-pam
for details on how to obtain the token ID of a YubiKey.

options.title: pam.yubico.authorizedYubiKeys.path
options.note:
File path to write the authorized YubiKeys,
relative to HOME.

options.title: programs.abook.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Abook.

options.title: programs.abook.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/abook/abookrc.
Available configuration options are described in the abook repository:
https://sourceforge.net/p/abook/git/ci/master/tree/sample.abookrc.
options.example: '' field pager = Pager view CONTACT = name, email set autosave=true ''

options.title: programs.aerc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable aerc.

options.title: programs.aerc.package
options.note: The aerc package to use.

options.title: programs.aerc.extraAccounts
options.note: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/accounts.conf.
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.extraBinds
options.note:
Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/binds.conf.
Global keybindings can be set in the global section.
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to $HOME/.config/aerc/aerc.conf.
