options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)

options.title: programs.aerc.stylesets
options.note: Stylesets added to $HOME/.config/aerc/stylesets/.
options.type: attribute set of ((attribute set of (values (null, bool, int, string, or float) or a list of values, that will be joined with a comma)) or strings concatenated with “\n”)
options.example: { default = { ui = { "tab.selected.reverse" = toggle; }; }; };

options.title: programs.aerc.templates
options.note: Templates added to $HOME/.config/aerc/templates/.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”
options.example: { new_message = "Hello!"; };

options.title: programs.afew.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the afew initial tagging script for Notmuch.

options.title: programs.afew.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra lines added to afew configuration file. Available
configuration options are described in the afew manual:
https://afew.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration.html.
options.example: '' [SpamFilter] [Filter.0] query = from:pointyheaded@boss.com tags = -new;+boss message = Message from above [InboxFilter] ''

options.title: programs.alacritty.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Alacritty.

options.title: programs.alacritty.package
options.note: The Alacritty package to install.

options.title: programs.alacritty.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/alacritty/alacritty.yml or
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/alacritty/alacritty.toml
(the latter being used for alacritty 0.13 and later).
See https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/tree/master#configuration
for more info.
options.example: { window.dimensions = { lines = 3; columns = 200; }; keyboard.bindings = [ { key = "K"; mods = "Control"; chars = "\\x0c"; } ]; }

options.title: programs.alot.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable the Alot mail user agent. Alot uses the
Notmuch email system and will therefore be automatically
enabled for each email account that is managed by Notmuch.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings
options.note: Keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.bufferlist
options.note: Bufferlist mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.envelope
options.note: Envelope mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.global
options.note: Global keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.search
options.note: Search mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.taglist
options.note: Taglist mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.bindings.thread
options.note: Thread mode keybindings.

options.title: programs.alot.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to alot configuration file.

options.title: programs.alot.hooks
options.note: Content of the hooks file.

options.title: programs.alot.settings
options.note: Configuration options added to alot configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number)
options.example: { auto_remove_unread = true; ask_subject = false; thread_indent_replies = 2; }

options.title: programs.alot.tags
options.note: How to display the tags.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.focus
options.note: How to display the tag when focused.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.normal
options.note:
How to display the tag when unfocused.
See https://alot.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration/theming.html#tagstring-formatting.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.translated
options.note:
Fixed string representation for this tag. The tag can be
hidden from view, if the key translated is set to
"", the empty string.

options.title: programs.alot.tags.<name>.translation
options.note:
A pair of strings that define a regular substitution to
compute the string representation on the fly using
re.sub.

options.title: programs.aria2.enable
options.note: Whether to enable aria2.

options.title: programs.aria2.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to aria2.conf file.

options.title: programs.aria2.settings
options.note:
Options to add to aria2.conf file.
See
aria2c(1)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string)
options.example: { listen-port = 60000; dht-listen-port = 60000; seed-ratio = 1.0; max-upload-limit = "50K"; ftp-pasv = true; }

options.title: programs.astroid.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Astroid.

options.title: programs.astroid.externalEditor
options.note: You can use the following variables:

options.title: programs.astroid.extraConfig
options.note: JSON config that will override the default Astroid configuration.
options.example: { poll.interval = 0; }

options.title: programs.astroid.pollScript
options.note: Script to run to fetch/update mails.

options.title: programs.atuin.enable
options.note: Whether to enable atuin.

options.title: programs.atuin.enableBashIntegration
options.note:
Whether to enable Atuin’s Bash integration. This will bind
ctrl-r to open the Atuin history.

options.title: programs.atuin.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Atuin’s Fish integration.

options.title: programs.atuin.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.atuin.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Atuin’s Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.atuin.package
options.note: The package to use for atuin.

options.title: programs.atuin.flags
options.note: Flags to append to the shell hook.
options.example: [ "--disable-up-arrow" "--disable-ctrl-r" ]

options.title: programs.atuin.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/atuin/config.toml.
options.example: { auto_sync = true; sync_frequency = "5m"; sync_address = "https://api.atuin.sh"; search_mode = "prefix"; }

options.title: programs.autojump.enable
options.note: Whether to enable autojump.

options.title: programs.autojump.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.autojump.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.autojump.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.autorandr.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Autorandr.

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks
options.note: Global hook scripts
options.example: { postswitch = { "notify-i3" = "${pkgs.i3}/bin/i3-msg restart"; "change-background" = readFile ./change-background.sh; "change-dpi" = '' case "$AUTORANDR_CURRENT_PROFILE" in default) DPI=120 ;; home) DPI=192 ;; work) DPI=144 ;; *) echo "Unknown profile: $AUTORANDR_CURRENT_PROFILE" exit 1 esac echo "Xft.dpi: $DPI" | ${pkgs.xorg.xrdb}/bin/xrdb -merge '' }; }

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.postswitch
options.note: Postswitch hook executed after mode switch.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.predetect
options.note: Predetect hook executed before autorandr attempts to run xrandr.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.hooks.preswitch
options.note: Preswitch hook executed before mode switch.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles
options.note: Autorandr profiles specification.
options.example: { "work" = { fingerprint = { eDP1 = "<EDID>"; DP1 = "<EDID>"; }; config = { eDP1.enable = false; DP1 = { enable = true; crtc = 0; primary = true; position = "0x0"; mode = "3840x2160"; gamma = "1.0:0.909:0.833"; rate = "60.00"; rotate = "left"; }; }; hooks.postswitch = readFile ./work-postswitch.sh; }; }

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config
options.note: Per output profile configuration.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the output.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.crtc
options.note: Output video display controller.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.dpi
options.note: Output DPI configuration.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.filter
options.note: Interpolation method to be used for scaling the output.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.gamma
options.note: Output gamma configuration.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.mode
options.note: Output resolution.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.position
options.note: Output position

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.primary
options.note: Whether output should be marked as primary

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.rate
options.note: Output framerate.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.rotate
options.note: Output rotate configuration.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.scale
options.note: Output scale configuration.
options.example: { x = 1.25; y = 1.25; }

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.scale.method
options.note: Output scaling method.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.scale.x
options.note: Horizontal scaling factor/pixels.
options.type: floating point number or (positive integer, meaning >0)

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.scale.y
options.note: Vertical scaling factor/pixels.
options.type: floating point number or (positive integer, meaning >0)

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.config.<name>.transform
options.note:
Refer to
xrandr(1)
for the documentation of the transform matrix.
options.type: null or (3×3 matrix of floating point numbers)
options.example: [ [ 0.6 0.0 0.0 ] [ 0.0 0.6 0.0 ] [ 0.0 0.0 1.0 ] ]

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.fingerprint
options.note:
Output name to EDID mapping.
Use autorandr --fingerprint to get current setup values.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.hooks
options.note: Profile hook scripts.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.hooks.postswitch
options.note: Postswitch hook executed after mode switch.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.hooks.predetect
options.note: Predetect hook executed before autorandr attempts to run xrandr.

options.title: programs.autorandr.profiles.<name>.hooks.preswitch
options.note: Preswitch hook executed before mode switch.

options.title: programs.awscli.enable
options.note: Whether to enable AWS CLI tool.

options.title: programs.awscli.package
options.note: Package providing aws.

options.title: programs.awscli.credentials
options.note: Configuration written to $HOME/.aws/credentials.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { "default" = { "credential_process" = "${pkgs.pass}/bin/pass show aws"; }; };

options.title: programs.awscli.settings
options.note: Configuration written to $HOME/.aws/config.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { "default" = { region = "eu-west-3"; output = "json"; }; };

options.title: programs.bacon.enable
options.note: Whether to enable bacon, a background rust code checker.

options.title: programs.bacon.settings
options.note:
Bacon configuration.
For available settings see https://dystroy.org/bacon/#global-preferences.
options.example: { jobs = { default = { command = [ "cargo" "build" "--all-features" "--color" "always" ]; need_stdout = true; }; }; }

options.title: programs.bash.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GNU Bourne-Again SHell.

options.title: programs.bash.enableCompletion
options.note: Whether to enable Bash completion for all interactive Bash shells.

options.title: programs.bash.enableVteIntegration
options.note:
Whether to enable integration with terminals using the VTE
library. This will let the terminal track the current working
directory.

options.title: programs.bash.bashrcExtra
options.note:
Extra commands that should be placed in ~/.bashrc.
Note that these commands will be run even in non-interactive shells.

options.title: programs.bash.historyControl
options.note: Controlling how commands are saved on the history list.

options.title: programs.bash.historyFile
options.note: Location of the bash history file.

options.title: programs.bash.historyFileSize
options.note: Number of history lines to keep on file.

options.title: programs.bash.historyIgnore
options.note: List of commands that should not be saved to the history list.
options.example: [ "ls" "cd" "exit" ]

options.title: programs.bash.historySize
options.note: Number of history lines to keep in memory.

options.title: programs.bash.initExtra
options.note:
Extra commands that should be run when initializing an
interactive shell.

options.title: programs.bash.logoutExtra
options.note:
Extra commands that should be run when logging out of an
interactive shell.

options.title: programs.bash.profileExtra
options.note:
Extra commands that should be run when initializing a login
shell.

options.title: programs.bash.sessionVariables
options.note: Environment variables that will be set for the Bash session.
options.example: { MAILCHECK = 30; }

options.title: programs.bash.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names in
this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { ll = "ls -l"; ".." = "cd .."; }

options.title: programs.bash.shellOptions
options.note:
Shell options to set. Prefix an option with
“-” to unset.
options.example: [ "extglob" "-cdspell" ]

options.title: programs.bashmount.enable
options.note: Whether to enable bashmount.

options.title: programs.bashmount.extraConfig
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/bashmount/config. Look at
https://github.com/jamielinux/bashmount/blob/master/bashmount.conf
for explanation about possible values.

options.title: programs.bat.enable
options.note: Whether to enable bat, a cat clone with wings.

options.title: programs.bat.config
options.note: Bat configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (string or list of string or boolean)
options.example: { map-syntax = [ "*.jenkinsfile:Groovy" "*.props:Java Properties" ]; pager = "less -FR"; theme = "TwoDark"; }

options.title: programs.bat.extraPackages
options.note: Additional bat packages to install.

options.title: programs.bat.syntaxes
options.note: Additional syntaxes to provide.
options.type: attribute set of (strings concatenated with “\n” or (submodule))
options.example: { gleam = { src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "molnarmark"; repo = "sublime-gleam"; rev = "2e761cdb1a87539d827987f997a20a35efd68aa9"; hash = "sha256-Zj2DKTcO1t9g18qsNKtpHKElbRSc9nBRE2QBzRn9+qs="; }; file = "syntax/gleam.sublime-syntax"; }; }

options.title: programs.bat.themes
options.note: Additional themes to provide.
options.type: attribute set of (strings concatenated with “\n” or (submodule))
options.example: { dracula = { src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "dracula"; repo = "sublime"; # Bat uses sublime syntax for its themes rev = "26c57ec282abcaa76e57e055f38432bd827ac34e"; sha256 = "019hfl4zbn4vm4154hh3bwk6hm7bdxbr1hdww83nabxwjn99ndhv"; }; file = "Dracula.tmTheme"; }; }

options.title: programs.beets.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable the beets music library manager. This
defaults to false for state
version ≥ 19.03. For earlier versions beets is enabled if
programs.beets.settings is non-empty.

options.title: programs.beets.package
options.note:
The beets package to use.
Can be used to specify extensions.

options.title: programs.beets.mpdIntegration.enableStats
options.note: Whether to enable mpdstats plugin and service.

options.title: programs.beets.mpdIntegration.enableUpdate
options.note: Whether to enable mpdupdate plugin.

options.title: programs.beets.mpdIntegration.host
options.note: The host that mpdstats will connect to.

options.title: programs.beets.mpdIntegration.port
options.note: The port that mpdstats will connect to.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.beets.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/beets/config.yaml

options.title: programs.bemenu.enable
options.note: Whether to enable bemenu.

options.title: programs.bemenu.package
options.note: The bemenu package to use.

options.title: programs.bemenu.settings
options.note: Configuration options for bemenu. See bemenu(1).
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or floating point number or boolean)
options.example: { line-height = 28; prompt = "open"; ignorecase = true; fb = "#1e1e2e"; ff = "#cdd6f4"; nb = "#1e1e2e"; nf = "#cdd6f4"; tb = "#1e1e2e"; hb = "#1e1e2e"; tf = "#f38ba8"; hf = "#f9e2af"; af = "#cdd6f4"; ab = "#1e1e2e"; width-factor = 0.3; }

options.title: programs.borgmatic.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Borgmatic.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.package
options.note: The borgmatic package to use.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups
options.note:
Borgmatic allows for several named backup configurations,
each with its own source directories and repositories.
options.example: { personal = { location = { sourceDirectories = [ "/home/me/personal" ]; repositories = [ "ssh://myuser@myserver.com/./personal-repo" ]; }; }; work = { location = { sourceDirectories = [ "/home/me/work" ]; repositories = [ "ssh://myuser@myserver.com/./work-repo" ]; }; }; };

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.consistency.checks
options.note: Consistency checks to run
options.example: [ { name = "repository"; frequency = "2 weeks"; } { name = "archives"; frequency = "4 weeks"; } { name = "data"; frequency = "6 weeks"; } { name = "extract"; frequency = "6 weeks"; } ];

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.consistency.checks.*.frequency
options.note: Frequency of this type of check
options.type: null or string matching the pattern ([[:digit:]]+ .*)|always

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.consistency.checks.*.name
options.note: Name of consistency check to run.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.consistency.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.hooks.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.location.excludeHomeManagerSymlinks
options.note:
Whether to exclude Home Manager generated symbolic links from
the backups. This facilitates restoring the whole home
directory when the Nix store doesn’t contain the latest
Home Manager generation.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.location.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.location.repositories
options.note: List of local or remote repositories with paths and optional labels.
options.example: [ { "path" = "ssh://myuser@myrepo.myserver.com/./repo"; "label" = "server"; } { "path" = "/var/lib/backups/local.borg"; "label" = "local"; } ]

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.location.sourceDirectories
options.note: Directories to backup.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.output.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepDaily
options.note: Number of daily archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepHourly
options.note: Number of hourly archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepMinutely
options.note: Number of minutely archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepMonthly
options.note: Number of monthly archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepSecondly
options.note: Number of secondly archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepWeekly
options.note: Number of weekly archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepWithin
options.note: Keep all archives within this time interval.
options.type: null or string matching the pattern [[:digit:]]+[Hdwmy]

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.retention.keepYearly
options.note: Number of yearly archives to keep. Use -1 for no limit.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.storage.encryptionPasscommand
options.note: Command writing the passphrase to standard output.

options.title: programs.borgmatic.backups.<name>.storage.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings.

options.title: programs.bottom.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable bottom, a cross-platform graphical process/system monitor with a
customizable interface.

options.title: programs.bottom.package
options.note: Package providing bottom.

options.title: programs.bottom.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/bottom/bottom.toml.
options.example: { flags = { avg_cpu = true; temperature_type = "c"; }; colors = { low_battery_color = "red"; }; }

options.title: programs.boxxy.enable
options.note: Whether to enable boxxy: Boxes in badly behaving applications.

options.title: programs.boxxy.package
options.note: The boxxy package to use.

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules
options.note: List of boxxy rules

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.context
options.note: Apply redirection ONLY when in a certain directory.
options.example: [ "/home/example/Projects/my-project" ]

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.env
options.note: Give certain environment variables for said match.
options.example: { MY_ENV_VAR = "my_env_var_value"; }

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.mode
options.note: Does the current path redirect a file or a directory?

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.name
options.note: Unique identifier of the boxxy rule. This can be any single-line string.

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.only
options.note: Apply redirection ONLY to specified executable names.
options.example: [ "bash" "/usr/bin/sh" ]

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.rewrite
options.note: Where that file/directory should be rewritten to.

options.title: programs.boxxy.rules.*.target
options.note: What directory/file to redirect.

options.title: programs.broot.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Broot, a better way to navigate directories.

options.title: programs.broot.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.broot.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.broot.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.broot.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.broot.package
options.note: Package providing broot

options.title: programs.broot.settings
options.note: Verbatim config entries

options.title: programs.broot.settings.modal
options.note: Whether to enable modal (vim) mode.

options.title: programs.broot.settings.skin
options.note: Color configuration.
options.example: { status_normal_fg = "grayscale(18)"; status_normal_bg = "grayscale(3)"; status_error_fg = "red"; status_error_bg = "yellow"; tree_fg = "red"; selected_line_bg = "grayscale(7)"; permissions_fg = "grayscale(12)"; size_bar_full_bg = "red"; size_bar_void_bg = "black"; directory_fg = "lightyellow"; input_fg = "cyan"; flag_value_fg = "lightyellow"; table_border_fg = "red"; code_fg = "lightyellow"; }

options.title: programs.broot.settings.verbs
options.note:
Define new verbs. For more information, see
Verb Definition Attributes
in the broot documentation.
options.type: list of attribute set of (boolean or string)
options.example: [ { invocation = "p"; execution = ":parent"; } { invocation = "edit"; shortcut = "e"; execution = "$EDITOR {file}" ; } { invocation = "create {subpath}"; execution = "$EDITOR {directory}/{subpath}"; } { invocation = "view"; execution = "less {file}"; } { invocation = "blop {name}\\.{type}"; execution = "mkdir {parent}/{type} && ${pkgs.neovim}/bin/nvim {parent}/{type}/{name}.{type}"; from_shell = true; } ]

options.description: how the verb is called by the user, with placeholders for arguments
an alternate way to call the verb (without the arguments part)
whether to quit broot on execution (default: true)
whether the verb must be executed from the parent shell (default: false)

options.title: programs.browserpass.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the browserpass extension host application.

options.title: programs.browserpass.browsers
options.note: Which browsers to install browserpass for
options.example: [ "firefox" ]

options.title: programs.btop.enable
options.note: Whether to enable btop.

options.title: programs.btop.package
options.note: The btop package to use.

options.title: programs.btop.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to the btop.conf file.

options.title: programs.btop.settings
options.note:
Options to add to btop.conf file.
See https://github.com/aristocratos/btop#configurability
for options.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string)
options.example: { color_theme = "Default"; theme_background = false; }

options.title: programs.carapace.enable
options.note: Whether to enable carapace, a multi-shell multi-command argument completer.

options.title: programs.carapace.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.carapace.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.carapace.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.carapace.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.carapace.package
options.note: The carapace package to use.

options.title: programs.cava.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Cava audio visualizer.

options.title: programs.cava.package
options.note: The cava package to use.

options.title: programs.cava.settings
options.note:
Settings to be written to the Cava configuration file. See
https://github.com/karlstav/cava/blob/master/example_files/config for
all available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { general.framerate = 60; input.method = "alsa"; smoothing.noise_reduction = 88; color = { background = "'#000000'"; foreground = "'#FFFFFF'"; }; }

options.title: programs.chromium.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Chromium.

options.title: programs.chromium.package
options.note: The Chromium package to use.

options.title: programs.chromium.commandLineArgs
options.note: List of command-line arguments to be passed to Chromium.
options.example: [ "--enable-logging=stderr" "--ignore-gpu-blocklist" ]

options.title: programs.chromium.dictionaries
options.note: List of Chromium dictionaries to install.
options.example: [ pkgs.hunspellDictsChromium.en_US ]

options.title: programs.chromium.extensions
options.note:
List of Chromium extensions to install.
To find the extension ID, check its URL on the
Chrome Web Store.
options.type: list of ((submodule) or string convertible to it)
options.example: [ { id = "cjpalhdlnbpafiamejdnhcphjbkeiagm"; } # ublock origin { id = "dcpihecpambacapedldabdbpakmachpb"; updateUrl = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/iamadamdev/bypass-paywalls-chrome/master/updates.xml"; } { id = "aaaaaaaaaabbbbbbbbbbcccccccccc"; crxPath = "/home/share/extension.crx"; version = "1.0"; } ]

options.title: programs.chromium.extensions.*.crxPath
options.note: Path to the extension’s crx file. Linux only.

options.title: programs.chromium.extensions.*.id
options.note: The extension’s ID from the Chrome Web Store url or the unpacked crx.

options.title: programs.chromium.extensions.*.updateUrl
options.note: URL of the extension’s update manifest XML file. Linux only.

options.title: programs.chromium.extensions.*.version
options.note: The extension’s version, required for local installation. Linux only.

options.title: programs.command-not-found.enable
options.note: Whether to enable command-not-found hook for interactive shell.

options.title: programs.command-not-found.dbPath
options.note:
Absolute path to programs.sqlite. By
default this file will be provided by your channel
(nixexprs.tar.xz).

options.title: programs.comodoro.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Comodoro, a CLI to manage your time.

options.title: programs.comodoro.package
options.note: The comodoro package to use.

options.title: programs.comodoro.settings
options.note:
Comodoro configuration.
See https://pimalaya.org/comodoro/cli/configuration/ for supported values.

options.title: programs.darcs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable darcs.

options.title: programs.darcs.package
options.note: The darcs package to use.

options.title: programs.darcs.author
options.note:
If this list has a single entry, it will be used as the author
when you record a patch. If there are multiple entries, Darcs
will prompt you to choose one of them.
options.example: [ "Fred Bloggs <fred@example.net>" ]

options.title: programs.darcs.boring
options.note: File patterns to ignore
options.example: [ "^.idea$" ".iml$" "^.stack-work$" ]

options.title: programs.dircolors.enable
options.note:
Whether to manage .dir_colors
and set LS_COLORS.

options.title: programs.dircolors.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.dircolors.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.dircolors.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.dircolors.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to .dir_colors file.

options.title: programs.dircolors.settings
options.note:
Options to add to .dir_colors file.
See dircolors --print-database
for options.
options.example: { OTHER_WRITABLE = "30;46"; ".sh" = "01;32"; ".csh" = "01;32"; }

options.title: programs.direnv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable direnv, the environment switcher.

options.title: programs.direnv.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.direnv.enableFishIntegration
options.note:
Whether to enable Fish integration. Note, enabling the direnv module
will always active its functionality for Fish since the direnv package
automatically gets loaded in Fish. If this is not the case try adding

options.title: programs.direnv.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.direnv.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.direnv.package
options.note: The direnv package to use.

options.title: programs.direnv.config
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/direnv/direnv.toml.

options.title: programs.direnv.nix-direnv.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable nix-direnv,
a fast, persistent use_nix implementation for direnv.

options.title: programs.direnv.nix-direnv.package
options.note: The nix-direnv package to use.

options.title: programs.direnv.stdlib
options.note:
Custom stdlib written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/direnv/direnvrc.

options.title: programs.discocss.enable
options.note: Whether to enable discocss, a tiny Discord CSS injector for Linux and MacOS.

options.title: programs.discocss.package
options.note: The discocss package to use.

options.title: programs.discocss.css
options.note: The custom CSS for discocss to use.

options.title: programs.discocss.discordAlias
options.note: Whether to alias discocss to discord.

options.title: programs.discocss.discordPackage
options.note: The discord package to use.

options.title: programs.eclipse.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Eclipse.

options.title: programs.eclipse.enableLombok
options.note:
Whether to enable the Lombok Java Agent in Eclipse. This is
necessary to use the Lombok class annotations.

options.title: programs.eclipse.package
options.note: The Eclipse package to install.

options.title: programs.eclipse.jvmArgs
options.note: JVM arguments to use for the Eclipse process.

options.title: programs.eclipse.plugins
options.note: Plugins that should be added to Eclipse.

options.title: programs.emacs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Emacs.

options.title: programs.emacs.package
options.note: The Emacs package to use.

options.title: programs.emacs.extraConfig
options.note:
Configuration to include in the Emacs default init file. See
https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/manual/html_node/elisp/Init-File.html
for more.
options.example: '' (setq standard-indent 2) ''

options.title: programs.emacs.extraPackages
options.note:
Extra packages available to Emacs. To get a list of
available packages run:
nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A emacsPackages.
options.type: Function that takes an attribute set and returns a list containing a selection of the values of the input set

options.title: programs.emacs.overrides
options.note: Allows overriding packages within the Emacs package set.
options.type: An overlay function, takes self and super and returns an attribute set overriding the desired attributes.
options.example: self: super: rec { haskell-mode = self.melpaPackages.haskell-mode; # ... };

options.title: programs.eww.enable
options.note: Whether to enable eww.

options.title: programs.eww.package
options.note: The eww package to install.

options.title: programs.eww.configDir
options.note:
The directory that gets symlinked to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/eww.

options.title: programs.eza.enable
options.note: Whether to enable eza, a modern replacement for ls.

options.title: programs.eza.enableAliases
options.note: Whether to enable recommended eza aliases (ls, ll…).

options.title: programs.eza.package
options.note: The eza package to use.

options.title: programs.eza.extraOptions
options.note: Extra command line options passed to eza.
options.example: [ "--group-directories-first" "--header" ]

options.title: programs.eza.git
options.note: List each file’s Git status if tracked or ignored (--git argument).

options.title: programs.eza.icons
options.note: Display icons next to file names (--icons argument).

options.title: programs.feh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable feh - a fast and light image viewer.

options.title: programs.feh.package
options.note: The feh package to use.

options.title: programs.feh.buttons
options.note:
Override feh’s default mouse button mapping. If you want to disable an
action, set its value to null. If you want to bind multiple buttons to
an action, set its value to a list.
See https://man.finalrewind.org/1/feh/#x425554544f4e53 for
default bindings and available commands.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or signed integer or list of (string or signed integer))
options.example: { prev_img = [ 3 "C-3" ]; zoom_in = 4; zoom_out = "C-4"; }

options.title: programs.feh.keybindings
options.note:
Override feh’s default keybindings. If you want to disable a keybinding
set its value to null. If you want to bind multiple keys to an action,
set its value to a list.
See https://man.finalrewind.org/1/feh/#x4b455953 for
default bindings and available commands.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or list of string)
options.example: { prev_img = [ "h" "Left" ]; zoom_in = "plus"; zoom_out = "minus"; }

options.title: programs.firefox.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Firefox.

options.title: programs.firefox.enableGnomeExtensions
options.note:
Whether to enable the GNOME Shell native host connector. Note, you
also need to set the NixOS option
services.gnome.gnome-browser-connector.enable to
true.

options.title: programs.firefox.package
options.note:
The Firefox package to use. If state version ≥ 19.09 then
this should be a wrapped Firefox package. For earlier state
versions it should be an unwrapped Firefox package.
Set to null to disable installing Firefox.
options.example: pkgs.firefox.override { # See nixpkgs' firefox/wrapper.nix to check which options you can use nativeMessagingHosts = [ # Gnome shell native connector pkgs.gnome-browser-connector # Tridactyl native connector pkgs.tridactyl-native ]; }

options.title: programs.firefox.finalPackage
options.note: Resulting Firefox package.

options.title: programs.firefox.nativeMessagingHosts
options.note:
Additional packages containing native messaging hosts that should be
made available to Firefox extensions.

options.title: programs.firefox.policies
options.note: See list of policies.
options.example: { BlockAboutConfig = true; DefaultDownloadDirectory = "\${home}/Downloads"; }

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles
options.note: Attribute set of Firefox profiles.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.bookmarks
options.note:
Preloaded bookmarks. Note, this may silently overwrite any
previously existing bookmarks!
options.type: (list of ((bookmark submodule) or (directory submodule))) or (attribute set of ((bookmark submodule) or (directory submodule))) convertible to it
options.example: [ { name = "wikipedia"; tags = [ "wiki" ]; keyword = "wiki"; url = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search?search=%s&go=Go"; } { name = "kernel.org"; url = "https://www.kernel.org"; } { name = "Nix sites"; toolbar = true; bookmarks = [ { name = "homepage"; url = "https://nixos.org/"; } { name = "wiki"; tags = [ "wiki" "nix" ]; url = "https://nixos.wiki/"; } ]; } ]

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers
options.note:
Attribute set of container configurations. See
Multi-Account
Containers
for more information.
options.example: { dangerous = { color = "red"; icon = "fruit"; id = 2; }; shopping = { color = "blue"; icon = "cart"; id = 1; }; }

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.color
options.note: Container color.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.icon
options.note: Container icon.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.id
options.note: Container ID. This should be set to a unique number per container in this profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.containers.<name>.name
options.note: Container name, e.g., shopping.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.extensions
options.note:
List of Firefox add-on packages to install for this profile.
Some pre-packaged add-ons are accessible from the
Nix User Repository.
Once you have NUR installed run
options.example: with pkgs.nur.repos.rycee.firefox-addons; [ privacy-badger ]

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.extraConfig
options.note: Extra preferences to add to user.js.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.id
options.note: Profile ID. This should be set to a unique number per profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.isDefault
options.note: Whether this is a default profile.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.name
options.note: Profile name.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.path
options.note: Profile path.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.default
options.note: The default search engine used in the address bar and search bar.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.engines
options.note:
Attribute set of search engine configurations. Engines
that only have metaData specified will
be treated as builtin to Firefox.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (JSON value)
options.example: { "Nix Packages" = { urls = [{ template = "https://search.nixos.org/packages"; params = [ { name = "type"; value = "packages"; } { name = "query"; value = "{searchTerms}"; } ]; }]; icon = "${pkgs.nixos-icons}/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/apps/nix-snowflake.svg"; definedAliases = [ "@np" ]; }; "NixOS Wiki" = { urls = [{ template = "https://nixos.wiki/index.php?search={searchTerms}"; }]; iconUpdateURL = "https://nixos.wiki/favicon.png"; updateInterval = 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000; # every day definedAliases = [ "@nw" ]; }; "Bing".metaData.hidden = true; "Google".metaData.alias = "@g"; # builtin engines only support specifying one additional alias }

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.force
options.note:
Whether to force replace the existing search
configuration. This is recommended since Firefox will
replace the symlink for the search configuration on every
launch, but note that you’ll lose any existing
configuration by enabling this.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.order
options.note:
The order the search engines are listed in. Any engines
that aren’t included in this list will be listed after
these in an unspecified order.
options.example: [ "DuckDuckGo" "Google" ]

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.search.privateDefault
options.note: The default search engine used in the Private Browsing.

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.settings
options.note: Attribute set of Firefox preferences.
options.type: attribute set of (Firefox preference (int, bool, string, and also attrs, list, float as a JSON string))
options.example: { "browser.startup.homepage" = "https://nixos.org"; "browser.search.region" = "GB"; "browser.search.isUS" = false; "distribution.searchplugins.defaultLocale" = "en-GB"; "general.useragent.locale" = "en-GB"; "browser.bookmarks.showMobileBookmarks" = true; "browser.newtabpage.pinned" = [{ title = "NixOS"; url = "https://nixos.org"; }]; }

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.userChrome
options.note: Custom Firefox user chrome CSS.
options.example: '' /* Hide tab bar in FF Quantum */ @-moz-document url("chrome://browser/content/browser.xul") { #TabsToolbar { visibility: collapse !important; margin-bottom: 21px !important; } #sidebar-box[sidebarcommand="treestyletab_piro_sakura_ne_jp-sidebar-action"] #sidebar-header { visibility: collapse !important; } } ''

options.title: programs.firefox.profiles.<name>.userContent
options.note: Custom Firefox user content CSS.
options.example: '' /* Hide scrollbar in FF Quantum */ *{scrollbar-width:none !important} ''

options.title: programs.fish.enable
options.note: Whether to enable fish, the friendly interactive shell.

options.title: programs.fish.package
options.note: The fish package to install. May be used to change the version.

options.title: programs.fish.functions
options.note:
Basic functions to add to fish. For more information see
https://fishshell.com/docs/current/cmds/function.html.
options.type: attribute set of (strings concatenated with “\n” or (submodule))
options.example: { __fish_command_not_found_handler = { body = "__fish_default_command_not_found_handler $argv[1]"; onEvent = "fish_command_not_found"; }; gitignore = "curl -sL https://www.gitignore.io/api/$argv"; }

options.title: programs.fish.interactiveShellInit
options.note:
Shell script code called during interactive fish shell
initialisation.

options.title: programs.fish.loginShellInit
options.note:
Shell script code called during fish login shell
initialisation.

options.title: programs.fish.plugins
options.note:
The plugins to source in
conf.d/99plugins.fish.
options.example: [ { name = "z"; src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "jethrokuan"; repo = "z"; rev = "ddeb28a7b6a1f0ec6dae40c636e5ca4908ad160a"; sha256 = "0c5i7sdrsp0q3vbziqzdyqn4fmp235ax4mn4zslrswvn8g3fvdyh"; }; } # oh-my-fish plugins are stored in their own repositories, which # makes them simple to import into home-manager. { name = "fasd"; src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "oh-my-fish"; repo = "plugin-fasd"; rev = "38a5b6b6011106092009549e52249c6d6f501fba"; sha256 = "06v37hqy5yrv5a6ssd1p3cjd9y3hnp19d3ab7dag56fs1qmgyhbs"; }; } ]

options.title: programs.fish.plugins.*.name
options.note: The name of the plugin.

options.title: programs.fish.plugins.*.src
options.note: Path to the plugin folder.

options.title: programs.fish.shellAbbrs
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to abbreviations. Abbreviations are expanded with
the longer phrase after they are entered.
options.example: { l = "less"; gco = "git checkout"; "-C" = { position = "anywhere"; expansion = "--color"; }; }

options.title: programs.fish.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { g = "git"; "..." = "cd ../.."; }

options.title: programs.fish.shellInit
options.note:
Shell script code called during fish shell
initialisation.

options.title: programs.fish.shellInitLast
options.note:
Shell script code called during interactive fish shell
initialisation, this will be the last thing executed in fish startup.

options.title: programs.foot.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Foot terminal.

options.title: programs.foot.package
options.note: The foot package to install

options.title: programs.foot.server.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Foot terminal server.

options.title: programs.foot.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/foot/foot.ini. See https://codeberg.org/dnkl/foot/src/branch/master/foot.ini
for a list of available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { main = { term = "xterm-256color"; font = "Fira Code:size=11"; dpi-aware = "yes"; }; mouse = { hide-when-typing = "yes"; }; }

options.title: programs.fuzzel.enable
options.note: Whether to enable fuzzel.

options.title: programs.fuzzel.package
options.note: The fuzzel package to use.

options.title: programs.fuzzel.settings
options.note:
Configuration for fuzzel written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/fuzzel/fuzzel.ini. See
fuzzel.ini(5) for a list of available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { main = { terminal = "${pkgs.foot}/bin/foot"; layer = "overlay"; }; colors.background = "ffffffff"; }

options.title: programs.fzf.enable
options.note: Whether to enable fzf - a command-line fuzzy finder.

options.title: programs.fzf.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.fzf.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.fzf.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.fzf.package
options.note: Package providing the fzf tool.

options.title: programs.fzf.changeDirWidgetCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the source for fzf for the
ALT-C keybinding.

options.title: programs.fzf.changeDirWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the ALT-C keybinding.
options.example: [ "--preview 'tree -C {} | head -200'" ]

options.title: programs.fzf.colors
options.note:
Color scheme options added to FZF_DEFAULT_OPTS. See
https://github.com/junegunn/fzf/wiki/Color-schemes
for documentation.
options.example: { bg = "#1e1e1e"; "bg+" = "#1e1e1e"; fg = "#d4d4d4"; "fg+" = "#d4d4d4"; }

options.title: programs.fzf.defaultCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the default source for fzf
when running.

options.title: programs.fzf.defaultOptions
options.note: Extra command line options given to fzf by default.
options.example: [ "--height 40%" "--border" ]

options.title: programs.fzf.fileWidgetCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the source for fzf for the
CTRL-T keybinding.

options.title: programs.fzf.fileWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the CTRL-T keybinding.
options.example: [ "--preview 'head {}'" ]

options.title: programs.fzf.historyWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the CTRL-R keybinding.
options.example: [ "--sort" "--exact" ]

options.title: programs.fzf.tmux.enableShellIntegration
options.note:
Whether to enable setting FZF_TMUX=1 which causes shell integration to use fzf-tmux
.

options.title: programs.fzf.tmux.shellIntegrationOptions
options.note:
If programs.fzf.tmux.enableShellIntegration is set to true,
shell integration will use these options for fzf-tmux.
See fzf-tmux --help for available options.

options.title: programs.gallery-dl.enable
options.note: Whether to enable gallery-dl.

options.title: programs.gallery-dl.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gallery-dl/config.json. See
https://github.com/mikf/gallery-dl#configuration
for supported values.
options.example: { extractor.base-directory = "~/Downloads"; }

options.title: programs.gh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GitHub CLI tool.

options.title: programs.gh.package
options.note: Package providing gh.

options.title: programs.gh.extensions
options.note: gh extensions, see https://cli.github.com/manual/gh_extension.

options.title: programs.gh.gitCredentialHelper.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the gh git credential helper.

options.title: programs.gh.gitCredentialHelper.hosts
options.note: GitHub hosts to enable the gh git credential helper for
options.example: [ "https://github.com" "https://github.example.com" ]

options.title: programs.gh.settings
options.note: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gh/config.yml.
options.example: { git_protocol = "ssh"; prompt = "enabled"; aliases = { co = "pr checkout"; pv = "pr view"; }; };

options.title: programs.gh.settings.aliases
options.note: Aliases that allow you to create nicknames for gh commands.
options.example: { co = "pr checkout"; pv = "pr view"; }

options.title: programs.gh.settings.editor
options.note:
The editor that gh should run when creating issues, pull requests, etc.
If blank, will refer to environment.

options.title: programs.gh.settings.git_protocol
options.note: The protocol to use when performing Git operations.

options.title: programs.gh-dash.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GitHub CLI dashboard plugin.

options.title: programs.gh-dash.package
options.note: The gh-dash package to use.

options.title: programs.gh-dash.settings
options.note: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gh-dash/config.yml.
options.example: { prSections = [{ title = "My Pull Requests"; filters = "is:open author:@me"; }]; }

options.title: programs.git.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Git.

options.title: programs.git.package
options.note:
Git package to install. Use pkgs.gitAndTools.gitFull
to gain access to git send-email for instance.

options.title: programs.git.aliases
options.note: Git aliases to define.
options.example: { co = "checkout"; }

options.title: programs.git.attributes
options.note: List of defining attributes set globally.
options.example: [ "*.pdf diff=pdf" ]

options.title: programs.git.delta.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable the delta syntax highlighter.
See https://github.com/dandavison/delta.

options.title: programs.git.delta.package
options.note: The delta package to use.

options.title: programs.git.delta.options
options.note: Options to configure delta.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer))
options.example: { decorations = { commit-decoration-style = "bold yellow box ul"; file-decoration-style = "none"; file-style = "bold yellow ul"; }; features = "decorations"; whitespace-error-style = "22 reverse"; }

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.enable
options.note:
Enable the diff-so-fancy diff colorizer.
See https://github.com/so-fancy/diff-so-fancy.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.changeHunkIndicators
options.note: Simplify git header chunks to a more human readable format.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.markEmptyLines
options.note: Whether the first block of an empty line should be colored.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.pagerOpts
options.note: Arguments to be passed to less.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.rulerWidth
options.note:
By default, the separator for the file header spans the full
width of the terminal. Use this setting to set the width of
the file header manually.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.stripLeadingSymbols
options.note:
Whether the + or - at
line-start should be removed.

options.title: programs.git.diff-so-fancy.useUnicodeRuler
options.note:
By default, the separator for the file header uses Unicode
line-drawing characters. If this is causing output errors on
your terminal, set this to false to use ASCII characters instead.

options.title: programs.git.difftastic.enable
options.note:
Enable the difftastic syntax highlighter.
See https://github.com/Wilfred/difftastic.

options.title: programs.git.difftastic.background
options.note:
Determines whether difftastic should use the lighter or darker colors
for syntax highlighting.

options.title: programs.git.difftastic.color
options.note: Determines when difftastic should color its output.

options.title: programs.git.difftastic.display
options.note: Determines how the output displays - in one column or two columns.

options.title: programs.git.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional configuration to add. The use of string values is
deprecated and will be removed in the future.
options.type: strings concatenated with “\n” or attribute set of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of (string or boolean or signed integer) or attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of (string or boolean or signed integer)))
options.example: { core = { whitespace = "trailing-space,space-before-tab"; }; url = { "ssh://git@host" = { insteadOf = "otherhost"; }; }; }

options.title: programs.git.hooks
options.note:
Configuration helper for Git hooks.
See https://git-scm.com/docs/githooks
for reference.
options.example: { pre-commit = ./pre-commit-script; }

options.title: programs.git.ignores
options.note: List of paths that should be globally ignored.
options.example: [ "*~" "*.swp" ]

options.title: programs.git.includes
options.note: List of configuration files to include.
options.example: [ { path = "~/path/to/config.inc"; } { path = "~/path/to/conditional.inc"; condition = "gitdir:~/src/dir"; } ]

options.title: programs.git.includes.*.condition
options.note:
Include this configuration only when condition
matches. Allowed conditions are described in
git-config(1).

options.title: programs.git.includes.*.contentSuffix
options.note:
Nix store name for the git configuration text file,
when generating the configuration text from nix options.

options.title: programs.git.includes.*.contents
options.note: Configuration to include. If empty then a path must be given.
options.example: { user = { email = "bob@work.example.com"; name = "Bob Work"; signingKey = "1A2B3C4D5E6F7G8H"; }; commit = { gpgSign = true; }; };

options.title: programs.git.includes.*.path
options.note: Path of the configuration file to include.

options.title: programs.git.lfs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Git Large File Storage.

options.title: programs.git.lfs.skipSmudge
options.note:
Skip automatic downloading of objects on clone or pull.
This requires a manual git lfs pull
every time a new commit is checked out on your repository.

options.title: programs.git.signing
options.note: Options related to signing commits using GnuPG.

options.title: programs.git.signing.gpgPath
options.note: Path to GnuPG binary to use.

options.title: programs.git.signing.key
options.note: The default GPG signing key fingerprint.

options.title: programs.git.signing.signByDefault
options.note: Whether commits and tags should be signed by default.

options.title: programs.git.userEmail
options.note: Default user email to use.

options.title: programs.git.userName
options.note: Default user name to use.

options.title: programs.git-cliff.enable
options.note: Whether to enable git-cliff changelog generator.

options.title: programs.git-cliff.package
options.note: The git-cliff package to use.

options.title: programs.git-cliff.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/git-cliff/cliff.toml. See
https://git-cliff.org/docs/configuration
for the documentation.
options.example: { header = "Changelog"; trim = true; }

options.title: programs.git-credential-oauth.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Git authentication handler for OAuth.

options.title: programs.git-credential-oauth.package
options.note: The git-credential-oauth package to use.

options.title: programs.gitui.enable
options.note: Whether to enable gitui, blazing fast terminal-ui for git written in rust.

options.title: programs.gitui.package
options.note: The package to use.

options.title: programs.gitui.keyConfig
options.note:
Key config in Ron file format. This is written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gitui/key_config.ron.
options.example: '' exit: Some(( code: Char('c'), modifiers: ( bits: 2,),)), quit: Some(( code: Char('q'), modifiers: ( bits: 0,),)), exit_popup: Some(( code: Esc, modifiers: ( bits: 0,),)), ''

options.title: programs.gitui.theme
options.note:
Theme in Ron file format. This is written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/gitui/theme.ron.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Gnome Terminal.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile
options.note:
A set of Gnome Terminal profiles. Note, the name of a profile must be
a UUID. You can generate one, for example, using uuidgen
(from util-linux).

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.allowBold
options.note:
If true, allow applications in the
terminal to make text boldface.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.audibleBell
options.note: Turn on/off the terminal’s bell.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.backspaceBinding
options.note:
Which string the terminal should send to an application when the user
presses the Backspace key.

options.description: Attempt to determine the right value from the terminal’s IO settings.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.boldIsBright
options.note: Whether bold text is shown in bright colors.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors
options.note: The terminal colors, null to use system default.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.backgroundColor
options.note: The background color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.boldColor
options.note: The bold color, null to use same as foreground.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.cursor
options.note: The color for the terminal cursor.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.cursor.background
options.note: The background color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.cursor.foreground
options.note: The foreground color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.foregroundColor
options.note: The foreground color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.highlight
options.note: The colors for the terminal’s highlighted area.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.highlight.background
options.note: The background color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.highlight.foreground
options.note: The foreground color.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.colors.palette
options.note: The terminal palette.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.cursorBlinkMode
options.note: The cursor blink mode.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.cursorShape
options.note: The cursor shape.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.customCommand
options.note: The command to use to start the shell, or null for default shell.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.default
options.note: Whether this should be the default profile.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.deleteBinding
options.note:
Which string the terminal should send to an application when the user
presses the Delete key.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.font
options.note: The font name, null to use system default.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.loginShell
options.note: Run command as a login shell.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.scrollOnOutput
options.note: Whether to scroll when output is written.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.scrollbackLines
options.note: The number of scrollback lines to keep, null for infinite.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.showScrollbar
options.note: Whether the scroll bar should be visible.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.transparencyPercent
options.note: Background transparency in percent.
options.type: null or integer between 0 and 100 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.profile.<name>.visibleName
options.note: The profile name.

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.showMenubar
options.note: Whether to show the menubar by default

options.title: programs.gnome-terminal.themeVariant
options.note: The theme variation to request

options.title: programs.go.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Go.

options.title: programs.go.package
options.note: The Go package to use.

options.title: programs.go.packages
options.note: Packages to add to GOPATH.
options.example: { "golang.org/x/text" = builtins.fetchGit "https://go.googlesource.com/text"; "golang.org/x/time" = builtins.fetchGit "https://go.googlesource.com/time"; }

options.title: programs.go.extraGoPaths
options.note:
Extra GOPATHs relative to HOME appended
after programs.go.goPath, if that option is set.
options.example: [ "extraGoPath1" "extraGoPath2" ]

options.title: programs.go.goBin
options.note: GOBIN relative to HOME

options.title: programs.go.goPath
options.note:
Primary GOPATH relative to
HOME. It will be exported first and therefore
used by default by the Go tooling.

options.title: programs.go.goPrivate
options.note:
The GOPRIVATE environment variable controls
which modules the go command considers to be private (not
available publicly) and should therefore not use the proxy
or checksum database.
options.example: [ "*.corp.example.com" "rsc.io/private" ]

options.title: programs.gpg.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GnuPG.

options.title: programs.gpg.package
options.note: The Gnupg package to use (also used by the gpg-agent service).

options.title: programs.gpg.homedir
options.note: Directory to store keychains and configuration.

options.title: programs.gpg.mutableKeys
options.note:
If set to true, you may manage your keyring as a user
using the gpg command. Upon activation, the keyring
will have managed keys added without overwriting unmanaged keys.

options.title: programs.gpg.mutableTrust
options.note:
If set to true, you may manage trust as a user using
the gpg command. Upon activation, trusted keys have
their trust set without overwriting unmanaged keys.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys
options.note:
A list of public keys to be imported into GnuPG. Note, these key files
will be copied into the world-readable Nix store.
options.example: [ { source = ./pubkeys.txt; } ]

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.source
options.note: Path of an OpenPGP public key file.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.text
options.note: Text of an OpenPGP public key.

options.title: programs.gpg.publicKeys.*.trust
options.note:
The amount of trust you have in the key ownership and the care the
owner puts into signing other keys. The available levels are

options.description: I don’t know or won’t say.

options.title: programs.gpg.scdaemonSettings
options.note:
SCdaemon configuration options. Available options are described
in

scdaemon(1)
.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or list of string)
options.example: { disable-ccid = true; }

options.title: programs.gpg.settings
options.note:
GnuPG configuration options. Available options are described
in

gpg(1)
.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or list of string)
options.example: { no-comments = false; s2k-cipher-algo = "AES128"; }

options.title: programs.gradle.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Gradle Build Tool.

options.title: programs.gradle.package
options.note: The gradle package to use.

options.title: programs.gradle.home
options.note: The Gradle home directory, relative to home.homeDirectory.

options.title: programs.gradle.initScripts
options.note: Definition of init scripts to link into the Gradle home directory.
options.example: { "maven-local.gradle".text = '' allProject { repositories { mavenLocal() } } ''; "another.init.gradle.kts".source = ./another.init.gradle.kts; }

options.title: programs.gradle.initScripts.<name>.source
options.note:
Path of the init script file. If
text is non-null then this option will automatically point
to a file containing that text.

options.title: programs.gradle.initScripts.<name>.text
options.note:
Text of the init script file. if this option is null
then source must be set.

options.title: programs.gradle.settings
options.note:
Key value pairs to write to gradle.properties in the Gradle
home directory.
options.type: attribute set of (string, package, bool, int or float)
options.example: { "org.gradle.caching" = true; "org.gradle.parallel" = true; "org.gradle.jvmargs" = "-XX:MaxMetaspaceSize=384m"; "org.gradle.home" = pkgs.jdk17; };

options.title: programs.granted.enable
options.note: Whether to enable granted.

options.title: programs.granted.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.havoc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Havoc terminal.

options.title: programs.havoc.package
options.note: The havoc package to use.

options.title: programs.havoc.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/havoc.cfg. See https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ii8/havoc/master/havoc.cfg
for a list of available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { child.program = "bash"; window.opacity = 240; window.margin = no; terminal = { rows = 80; columns = 24; scrollback = 2000; }; bind = { "C-S-c" = "copy"; "C-S-v" = "paste"; "C-S-r" = "reset"; "C-S-Delete" = "hard reset"; "C-S-j" = "scroll down"; "C-S-k" = "scroll up"; "C-S-Page_Down" = "scroll down page"; "C-S-Page_Up" = "scroll up page"; "C-S-End" = "scroll to bottom"; "C-S-Home" = "scroll to top"; }; }

options.title: programs.helix.enable
options.note: Whether to enable helix text editor.

options.title: programs.helix.package
options.note: The package to use for helix.

options.title: programs.helix.defaultEditor
options.note:
Whether to configure hx as the default
editor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.helix.extraPackages
options.note: Extra packages available to hx.

options.title: programs.helix.languages
options.note:
Language specific configuration at
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/languages.toml.
options.type: (TOML value) or (list of (TOML value)) convertible to it
options.example: { # the language-server option currently requires helix from the master branch at https://github.com/helix-editor/helix/ language-server.typescript-language-server = with pkgs.nodePackages; { command = "${typescript-language-server}/bin/typescript-language-server"; args = [ "--stdio" "--tsserver-path=${typescript}/lib/node_modules/typescript/lib" ]; }; language = [{ name = "rust"; auto-format = false; }]; }

options.title: programs.helix.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/config.toml.
options.example: { theme = "base16"; editor = { line-number = "relative"; lsp.display-messages = true; }; keys.normal = { space.space = "file_picker"; space.w = ":w"; space.q = ":q"; esc = [ "collapse_selection" "keep_primary_selection" ]; }; }

options.title: programs.helix.themes
options.note:
Each theme is written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/helix/themes/theme-name.toml.
Where the name of each attribute is the theme-name (in the example “base16”).
options.example: { base16 = let transparent = "none"; gray = "#665c54"; dark-gray = "#3c3836"; white = "#fbf1c7"; black = "#282828"; red = "#fb4934"; green = "#b8bb26"; yellow = "#fabd2f"; orange = "#fe8019"; blue = "#83a598"; magenta = "#d3869b"; cyan = "#8ec07c"; in { "ui.menu" = transparent; "ui.menu.selected" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; }; "ui.linenr" = { fg = gray; bg = dark-gray; }; "ui.popup" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; }; "ui.linenr.selected" = { fg = white; bg = black; modifiers = [ "bold" ]; }; "ui.selection" = { fg = black; bg = blue; }; "ui.selection.primary" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; }; "comment" = { fg = gray; }; "ui.statusline" = { fg = white; bg = dark-gray; }; "ui.statusline.inactive" = { fg = dark-gray; bg = white; }; "ui.help" = { fg = dark-gray; bg = white; }; "ui.cursor" = { modifiers = [ "reversed" ]; }; "variable" = red; "variable.builtin" = orange; "constant.numeric" = orange; "constant" = orange; "attributes" = yellow; "type" = yellow; "ui.cursor.match" = { fg = yellow; modifiers = [ "underlined" ]; }; "string" = green; "variable.other.member" = red; "constant.character.escape" = cyan; "function" = blue; "constructor" = blue; "special" = blue; "keyword" = magenta; "label" = magenta; "namespace" = blue; "diff.plus" = green; "diff.delta" = yellow; "diff.minus" = red; "diagnostic" = { modifiers = [ "underlined" ]; }; "ui.gutter" = { bg = black; }; "info" = blue; "hint" = dark-gray; "debug" = dark-gray; "warning" = yellow; "error" = red; }; }

options.title: programs.hexchat.enable
options.note: Whether to enable HexChat, a graphical IRC client.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels
options.note: Configures $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/hexchat/servlist.conf.
options.example: { oftc = { autojoin = [ "#home-manager" "#linux" ]; charset = "UTF-8 (Unicode)"; commands = [ "ECHO Buzz Lightyear sent you a message: 'To Infinity... and Beyond!'" ]; loginMethod = sasl; nickname = "my_nickname"; nickname2 = "my_secondchoice"; options = { acceptInvalidSSLCertificates = false; autoconnect = true; bypassProxy = true; connectToSelectedServerOnly = true; useGlobalUserInformation = false; forceSSL = false; }; password = "my_password"; realName = "my_realname"; servers = [ "irc.oftc.net" ]; userName = "my_username"; }; }

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.autojoin
options.note: Channels list to autojoin on connecting to server.
options.example: [ "#home-manager" "#linux" "#nix" ]

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.charset
options.note: Character set.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.commands
options.note: Commands to be executed on connecting to server.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.loginMethod
options.note: The login method. The allowed options are:

options.description: Use “commands” field for auth. For example
options.note: commands = [ "/msg NickServ IDENTIFY my_password" ]

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.nickname
options.note: Primary nickname.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.nickname2
options.note: Secondary nickname.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options
options.note: Channel options.
options.example: { autoconnect = true; useGlobalUserInformation = true; }

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.acceptInvalidSSLCertificates
options.note: Accept invalid SSL certificates.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.autoconnect
options.note: Autoconnect to network.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.bypassProxy
options.note: Bypass proxy.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.connectToSelectedServerOnly
options.note: Connect to selected server only.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.forceSSL
options.note: Use SSL for all servers.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.options.useGlobalUserInformation
options.note: Use global user information.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.password
options.note:
Password to use. Note this password will be readable by all user’s
in the Nix store.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.realName
options.note:
Real name. Is used to populate the real name field that appears when
someone uses the WHOIS command on your nick.

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.servers
options.note: IRC Server Address List.
options.example: [ "irc.oftc.net" ]

options.title: programs.hexchat.channels.<name>.userName
options.note:
User name. Part of your user@host hostmask that
appears to other on IRC.

options.title: programs.hexchat.overwriteConfigFiles
options.note:
Enables overwriting HexChat configuration files
(hexchat.conf, servlist.conf).
Any existing HexChat configuration will be lost. Make sure to back up
any previous configuration before enabling this.

options.title: programs.hexchat.settings
options.note:
Configuration for $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/hexchat/hexchat.conf, see
https://hexchat.readthedocs.io/en/latest/settings.html#list-of-settings
for supported values.
options.example: { irc_nick1 = "mynick"; irc_username = "bob"; irc_realname = "Bart Simpson"; text_font = "Monospace 14"; };

options.title: programs.hexchat.theme
options.note:
Theme package for HexChat. Expects a derivation containing decompressed
theme files. Note, .hct files are actually ZIP files,
as seen in example.
options.example: source = pkgs.fetchzip { url = "https://dl.hexchat.net/themes/Monokai.hct#Monokai.zip"; sha256 = "sha256-WCdgEr8PwKSZvBMs0fN7E2gOjNM0c2DscZGSKSmdID0="; stripRoot = false; };

options.title: programs.himalaya.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the email client Himalaya CLI.

options.title: programs.himalaya.package
options.note: The himalaya package to use.

options.title: programs.himalaya.settings
options.note:
Himalaya CLI global configuration.
See https://pimalaya.org/himalaya/cli/latest/configuration/index.html#global-configuration for supported values.

options.title: programs.home-manager.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Home Manager.

options.title: programs.home-manager.path
options.note:
The default path to use for Home Manager. When
null, then the home-manager
channel, $HOME/.config/nixpkgs/home-manager, and
$HOME/.nixpkgs/home-manager will be attempted.

options.title: programs.hstr.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Bash And Zsh shell history suggest box - easily view, navigate, search and
manage your command history.

options.title: programs.hstr.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.hstr.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.hstr.package
options.note: The hstr package to use.

options.title: programs.htop.enable
options.note: Whether to enable htop.

options.title: programs.htop.package
options.note: Package containing the htop program.

options.title: programs.htop.settings
options.note:
Configuration options to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/htop/htoprc.
options.example: { color_scheme = 6; cpu_count_from_one = 0; delay = 15; fields = with config.lib.htop.fields; [ PID USER PRIORITY NICE M_SIZE M_RESIDENT M_SHARE STATE PERCENT_CPU PERCENT_MEM TIME COMM ]; highlight_base_name = 1; highlight_megabytes = 1; highlight_threads = 1; } // (with config.lib.htop; leftMeters [ (bar "AllCPUs2") (bar "Memory") (bar "Swap") (text "Zram") ]) // (with config.lib.htop; rightMeters [ (text "Tasks") (text "LoadAverage") (text "Uptime") (text "Systemd") ]);

options.title: programs.hyfetch.enable
options.note: Whether to enable hyfetch.

options.title: programs.hyfetch.package
options.note: The hyfetch package to use.

options.title: programs.hyfetch.settings
options.note: JSON config for HyFetch
options.example: { preset = "rainbow"; mode = "rgb"; color_align = { mode = "horizontal"; }; }

options.title: programs.i3blocks.enable
options.note: Whether to enable i3blocks i3 status command scheduler.

options.title: programs.i3blocks.package
options.note: Package providing i3blocks.

options.title: programs.i3blocks.bars
options.note: Configuration written to i3blocks config
options.type: attribute set of (DAG of attribute set of (INI atom (null, int, bool, string, or float)))
options.example: { top = { # The title block title = { interval = "persist"; command = "xtitle -s"; }; }; bottom = { time = { command = "date +%r"; interval = 1; }; # Make sure this block comes after the time block date = lib.hm.dag.entryAfter [ "time" ] { command = "date +%d"; interval = 5; }; # And this block after the example block example = lib.hm.dag.entryAfter [ "date" ] { command = "echo hi $(date +%s)"; interval = 3; }; }; }

options.title: programs.i3status.enable
options.note: Whether to enable i3status.

options.title: programs.i3status.enableDefault
options.note:
Whether or not to enable
the default configuration.

options.title: programs.i3status.package
options.note: The i3status package to use.

options.title: programs.i3status.general
options.note:
Configuration to add to i3status config
general section.
See
i3status(1)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { colors = true; color_good = "#e0e0e0"; color_degraded = "#d7ae00"; color_bad = "#f69d6a"; interval = 1; }

options.title: programs.i3status.modules
options.note:
Modules to add to i3status config file.
See
i3status(1)
for options.
options.example: { "volume master" = { position = 1; settings = { format = "♪ %volume"; format_muted = "♪ muted (%volume)"; device = "pulse:1"; }; }; "disk /" = { position = 2; settings = { format = "/ %avail"; }; }; }

options.title: programs.i3status.modules.<name>.enable
options.note: Whether or not to enable this module.

options.title: programs.i3status.modules.<name>.position
options.note: Position of this module in i3status order.
options.type: signed integer or floating point number

options.title: programs.i3status.modules.<name>.settings
options.note:
Configuration to add to this i3status module.
See
i3status(1)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { format = "♪ %volume"; format_muted = "♪ muted (%volume)"; device = "pulse:1"; }

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.enable
options.note: Whether to enable a replacement for i3-status written in Rust.

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.package
options.note: Package providing i3status-rust

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars
options.note:
Attribute set of i3status-rust bars, each with their own configuration.
Each bar name generates a config file suffixed with
the bar’s name from the attribute set, like so:
config-${name}.toml.
options.example: bottom = { blocks = [ { block = "disk_space"; path = "/"; info_type = "available"; interval = 60; warning = 20.0; alert = 10.0; } { block = "memory"; format_mem = " $icon $mem_used_percents "; format_swap = " $icon $swap_used_percents "; } { block = "cpu"; interval = 1; } { block = "load"; interval = 1; format = " $icon $1m "; } { block = "sound"; } { block = "time"; interval = 60; format = " $timestamp.datetime(f:'%a %d/%m %R') "; } ]; settings = { theme = { theme = "solarized-dark"; overrides = { idle_bg = "#123456"; idle_fg = "#abcdef"; }; }; }; icons = "awesome5"; theme = "gruvbox-dark"; };

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.blocks
options.note:
Configuration blocks to add to i3status-rust
