config. See
https://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/blocks.md
for block options.
options.example: [ { block = "disk_space"; path = "/"; info_type = "available"; interval = 60; warning = 20.0; alert = 10.0; } { block = "sound"; format = " $icon $output_name {$volume.eng(w:2) |}"; click = [ { button = "left"; cmd = "pavucontrol --tab=3"; } ]; mappings = { "alsa_output.pci-0000_00_1f.3.analog-stereo" = ""; "bluez_sink.70_26_05_DA_27_A4.a2dp_sink" = ""; }; } ];

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.icons
options.note:
The icons set to use. See
https://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/doc/themes.md
for a list of available icon sets.

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.settings
options.note:
Any extra options to add to i3status-rust
config.
options.example: { theme = { theme = "solarized-dark"; overrides = { idle_bg = "#123456"; idle_fg = "#abcdef"; }; }; }

options.title: programs.i3status-rust.bars.<name>.theme
options.note:
The theme to use. See
https://github.com/greshake/i3status-rust/blob/master/doc/themes.md
for a list of available themes.

options.title: programs.imv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable imv: a command line image viewer intended for use with tiling window managers.

options.title: programs.imv.package
options.note: The imv package to use.

options.title: programs.imv.settings
options.note:
Configuration options for imv. See
imv(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { options.background = "ffffff"; aliases.x = "close"; }

options.title: programs.info.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GNU Info.

options.title: programs.ion.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Ion Shell. Compatible with Redox and Linux.

options.title: programs.ion.package
options.note: The ion package to install. May be used to change the version.

options.title: programs.ion.initExtra
options.note: Ion script which is called during ion initialization.

options.title: programs.ion.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { g = "git"; }

options.title: programs.irssi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Irssi chat client.

options.title: programs.irssi.aliases
options.note: An attribute set that maps aliases to commands.
options.example: { BYE = "quit"; J = "join"; }

options.title: programs.irssi.extraConfig
options.note: These lines are appended to the Irssi configuration.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks
options.note: An attribute set of chat networks.
options.example: { liberachat = { nick = "hmuser"; server = { address = "irc.libera.chat"; port = 6697; autoConnect = true; }; channels = { nixos.autoJoin = true; }; }; }

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.autoCommands
options.note: List of commands to execute on connect.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.channels
options.note: Channels for the given network.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.channels.<name>.autoJoin
options.note: Whether to join this channel on connect.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.nick
options.note: Nickname in that network.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.saslExternal
options.note:
Enable SASL external authentication. This requires setting a path in
programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.ssl.certificateFile.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.address
options.note: Address of the chat server.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.autoConnect
options.note: Whether Irssi connects to the server on launch.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.port
options.note: Port of the chat server.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.ssl.enable
options.note: Whether SSL should be used.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.ssl.certificateFile
options.note:
Path to a file containing the certificate used for
client authentication to the server.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.server.ssl.verify
options.note: Whether the SSL certificate should be verified.

options.title: programs.irssi.networks.<name>.type
options.note: Type of the network.

options.title: programs.java.enable
options.note:
Install the Java development kit and set the
JAVA_HOME variable.

options.title: programs.java.package
options.note:
Java package to install. Typical values are
pkgs.jdk or pkgs.jre.

options.title: programs.jetbrains-remote.enable
options.note: Whether to enable JetBrains remote development system.

options.title: programs.jetbrains-remote.ides
options.note: IDEs accessible to the JetBrains remote development system.
options.example: with pkgs.jetbrains; [ clion pycharm-professional ];

options.title: programs.joshuto.enable
options.note: Whether to enable joshuto file manager.

options.title: programs.joshuto.package
options.note: The package to use for joshuto.

options.title: programs.joshuto.keymap
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/joshuto/keymap.toml.

options.title: programs.joshuto.mimetype
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/joshuto/mimetype.toml.

options.title: programs.joshuto.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/joshuto/joshuto.toml.

options.title: programs.joshuto.theme
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/joshuto/theme.toml.

options.title: programs.jq.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the jq command-line JSON processor.

options.title: programs.jq.package
options.note: jq package to use.

options.title: programs.jq.colors
options.note: The colors used in colored JSON output.
options.example: { null = "1;30"; false = "0;31"; true = "0;32"; numbers = "0;36"; strings = "0;33"; arrays = "1;35"; objects = "1;37"; }

options.title: programs.jujutsu.enable
options.note: Whether to enable a Git-compatible DVCS that is both simple and powerful.

options.title: programs.jujutsu.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.jujutsu.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.jujutsu.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.jujutsu.package
options.note: The jujutsu package to use.

options.title: programs.jujutsu.settings
options.note:
Options to add to the .jjconfig.toml file. See
https://github.com/martinvonz/jj/blob/main/docs/config.md
for options.
options.example: { user = { name = "John Doe"; email = "jdoe@example.org"; }; }

options.title: programs.k9s.enable
options.note: Whether to enable k9s - Kubernetes CLI To Manage Your Clusters In Style.

options.title: programs.k9s.package
options.note: The k9s package to use.

options.title: programs.k9s.aliases
options.note:
Aliases written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/aliases.yaml. See
https://k9scli.io/topics/aliases/ for supported values.
options.example: alias = { # Use pp as an alias for Pod pp = "v1/pods"; };

options.title: programs.k9s.hotkey
options.note:
Hotkeys written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/hotkey.yaml. See
https://k9scli.io/topics/hotkeys/ for supported values.
options.example: hotkey = { # Make sure this is camel case hotKey = { shift-0 = { shortCut = "Shift-0"; description = "Viewing pods"; command = "pods"; }; }; };

options.title: programs.k9s.plugin
options.note:
Plugins written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/plugin.yaml. See
https://k9scli.io/topics/plugins/ for supported values.
options.example: plugin = { # Defines a plugin to provide a `ctrl-l` shortcut to # tail the logs while in pod view. fred = { shortCut = "Ctrl-L"; description = "Pod logs"; scopes = [ "po" ]; command = "kubectl"; background = false; args = [ "logs" "-f" "$NAME" "-n" "$NAMESPACE" "--context" "$CLUSTER" ]; }; };

options.title: programs.k9s.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/config.yaml. See
https://k9scli.io/topics/config/ for supported values.
options.example: k9s = { refreshRate = 2; };

options.title: programs.k9s.skins
options.note:
Skin files written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/skins/. See
https://k9scli.io/topics/skins/ for supported values.
options.example: my_blue_skin = { k9s = { body = { fgColor = "dodgerblue"; }; }; };

options.title: programs.k9s.views
options.note:
Resource column views written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/k9s/views.yaml.
See https://k9scli.io/topics/columns/ for supported values.
options.example: k9s = { views = { "v1/pods" = { columns = [ "AGE" "NAMESPACE" "NAME" "IP" "NODE" "STATUS" "READY" ]; }; }; };

options.title: programs.kakoune.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the kakoune text editor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.package
options.note: The kakoune-unwrapped package to use.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config
options.note: kakoune configuration options.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.alignWithTabs
options.note: Use tabs for the align command.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoComplete
options.note:
Modes in which to display possible completions.
The kakoune default is [ "insert" "prompt" ].

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoInfo
options.note:
Contexts in which to display automatic information box.
The kakoune default is [ "command" "onkey" ].
options.example: [ "command" "normal" ]

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.autoReload
options.note:
Reload buffers when an external modification is detected.
The kakoune default is "ask".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.colorScheme
options.note:
Set the color scheme. To see available schemes, enter
colorscheme at the kakoune prompt.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks
options.note:
Global hooks. For documentation, see
https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/hooks.asciidoc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.commands
options.note: Commands to run when the hook is activated.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.group
options.note: Add the hook to the named group.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.name
options.note:
The name of the hook. For a description, see
https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/hooks.asciidoc#default-hooks.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.once
options.note: Remove the hook after running it once.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.hooks.*.option
options.note: Additional option to pass to the hook.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.incrementalSearch
options.note: Execute a search as it is being typed.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.indentWidth
options.note:
The width of an indentation in spaces.
The kakoune default is 4.
If 0, a tab will be used instead.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings
options.note:
User-defined key mappings. For documentation, see
https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/mapping.asciidoc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.docstring
options.note: Optional documentation text to display in info boxes.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.effect
options.note: The sequence of keys to be mapped.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.key
options.note:
The key to be mapped. See
https://github.com/mawww/kakoune/blob/master/doc/pages/mapping.asciidoc#mappable-keys
for possible values.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.keyMappings.*.mode
options.note: The mode in which the mapping takes effect.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines
options.note: Settings for the number lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the number lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.highlightCursor
options.note: Highlight the cursor line with a separate face.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.relative
options.note: Show line numbers relative to the main cursor line.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.numberLines.separator
options.note:
String that separates the line number column from the
buffer contents. The kakoune default is
"|".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff
options.note: How many lines and columns to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff.columns
options.note: The number of columns to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.scrollOff.lines
options.note: The number of lines to keep visible around the cursor.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showMatching
options.note:
Highlight the matching char of the character under the
selections’ cursor using the MatchingChar
face.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace
options.note: Settings for the show whitespaces highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the show whitespace highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.lineFeed
options.note:
The character to display for line feeds.
The kakoune default is "¬".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.nonBreakingSpace
options.note:
The character to display for non-breaking spaces.
The kakoune default is "⍽".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.space
options.note:
The character to display for spaces.
The kakoune default is "·".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.tab
options.note:
The character to display for tabs.
The kakoune default is "→".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.showWhitespace.tabStop
options.note:
The character to append to tabs to reach the width of a tabstop.
The kakoune default is " ".

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.tabStop
options.note:
The width of a tab in spaces. The kakoune default is
6.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui
options.note: Settings for the ncurses interface.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.enableMouse
options.note: Whether to enable mouse support.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.assistant
options.note: The assistant displayed in info boxes.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.changeColors
options.note: Change color palette.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.setTitle
options.note: Change the title of the terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.shiftFunctionKeys
options.note:
Amount by which shifted function keys are offset. That
is, if the terminal sends F13 for Shift-F1, this
should be 12.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.statusLine
options.note: Where to display the status line.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.useBuiltinKeyParser
options.note: Bypass ncurses key parser and use an internal one.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.wheelDownButton
options.note: Button to send for wheel down events.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.ui.wheelUpButton
options.note: Button to send for wheel up events.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines
options.note: Settings for the wrap lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the wrap lines highlighter.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.indent
options.note: Preserve line indentation when wrapping.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.marker
options.note:
Prefix wrapped lines with marker text.
If not null,
the marker text will be displayed in the indentation if possible.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.maxWidth
options.note: Wrap text at maxWidth, even if the window is wider.

options.title: programs.kakoune.config.wrapLines.word
options.note: Wrap at word boundaries instead of codepoint boundaries.

options.title: programs.kakoune.defaultEditor
options.note:
Whether to configure kak as the default
editor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.kakoune.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/kak/kakrc.

options.title: programs.kakoune.plugins
options.note:
List of kakoune plugins to install. To get a list of
supported plugins run:
nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A kakounePlugins.

options.title: programs.keychain.enable
options.note: Whether to enable keychain.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableXsessionIntegration
options.note: Whether to run keychain from your ~/.xsession.

options.title: programs.keychain.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.keychain.package
options.note: Keychain package to install.

options.title: programs.keychain.agents
options.note: Agents to add.

options.title: programs.keychain.extraFlags
options.note: Extra flags to pass to keychain.

options.title: programs.keychain.inheritType
options.note: Inherit type to attempt from agent variables from the environment.

options.title: programs.keychain.keys
options.note: Keys to add to keychain.

options.title: programs.khal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable khal, a CLI calendar application.

options.title: programs.khal.locale
options.note: khal locale settings.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.dateformat
options.note: khal will display and understand all dates in this format.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.datetimeformat
options.note: khal will display and understand all datetimes in this format.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.default_timezone
options.note:
Default for new events or if khal does not understand the timezone
in an ical file.
If null, the timezone of your computer will be used.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.firstweekday
options.note: The first day of the week, where Monday is 0 and Sunday is 6.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.local_timezone
options.note:
khal will show all times in this timezone.
If null, the timezone of your computer will be used.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.longdateformat
options.note:
khal will display and understand all dates in this format.
It should contain a year (e.g. %Y).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.longdatetimeformat
options.note:
khal will display and understand all datetimes in this format.
It should contain a year (e.g. %Y).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.timeformat
options.note: khal will display and understand all times in this format.

options.title: programs.khal.locale.unicode_symbols
options.note:
By default khal uses some Unicode symbols (as in “non-ASCII”) as
indicators for things like repeating events.
If your font, encoding etc. does not support those symbols, set this
to false (this will enable ASCII-based replacements).

options.title: programs.khal.locale.weeknumbers
options.note:
Enable week numbers in calendar and interactive (ikhal) mode.
As those are ISO week numbers, they only work properly if
firstweekday is set to 0.

options.title: programs.khal.settings
options.note: Configuration options to add to the various sections in the configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { default = { default_calendar = "Calendar"; timedelta = "5d"; }; view = { agenda_event_format = "{calendar-color}{cancelled}{start-end-time-style} {title}{repeat-symbol}{reset}"; }; }

options.title: programs.khard.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Khard: an address book for the Unix console.

options.title: programs.khard.settings
options.note:
Khard settings. See
https://khard.readthedocs.io/en/latest/#configuration
for more information.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or string or list of string)
options.example: { general = { default_action = "list"; editor = ["vim" "-i" "NONE"]; }; "contact table" = { display = "formatted_name"; preferred_phone_number_type = ["pref" "cell" "home"]; preferred_email_address_type = ["pref" "work" "home"]; }; vcard = { private_objects = ["Jabber" "Skype" "Twitter"]; }; }

options.title: programs.khard.settings.general.default_action
options.note: The default action to execute.

options.title: programs.kitty.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Kitty terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.kitty.package
options.note: Kitty package to install.

options.title: programs.kitty.darwinLaunchOptions
options.note: Command-line options to use when launched by Mac OS GUI
options.example: [ "--single-instance" "--directory=/tmp/my-dir" "--listen-on=unix:/tmp/my-socket" ]

options.title: programs.kitty.environment
options.note: Environment variables to set or override.
options.example: { "LS_COLORS" = "1"; }

options.title: programs.kitty.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add.

options.title: programs.kitty.font
options.note: The font to use.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.package
options.note:
Package providing the font. This package will be installed
to your profile. If null then the font
is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.name
options.note: The family name of the font within the package.

options.title: programs.kitty.font.size
options.note: The size of the font.
options.type: null or signed integer or floating point number

options.title: programs.kitty.keybindings
options.note: Mapping of keybindings to actions.
options.example: { "ctrl+c" = "copy_or_interrupt"; "ctrl+f>2" = "set_font_size 20"; }

options.title: programs.kitty.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/kitty/kitty.conf. See
https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/conf.html
for the documentation.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer)
options.example: { scrollback_lines = 10000; enable_audio_bell = false; update_check_interval = 0; }

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Kitty Bash integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Kitty fish integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Kitty Z Shell integration.

options.title: programs.kitty.shellIntegration.mode
options.note:
Set the mode of the shell integration. This accepts the same options
as the shell_integration option of Kitty. Note that
no-rc is always implied. See
https://sw.kovidgoyal.net/kitty/shell-integration
for more details.

options.title: programs.kitty.theme
options.note:
Apply a Kitty color theme. This option takes the friendly name of
any theme given by the command kitty +kitten themes.
See https://github.com/kovidgoyal/kitty-themes
for more details.

options.title: programs.kodi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Kodi.

options.title: programs.kodi.package
options.note:
The kodi package to use.
Can be used to specify extensions.

options.title: programs.kodi.addonSettings
options.note:
Attribute set with the plugin namespace as toplevel key and the plugins
settings as lower level key/value pairs.
options.type: null or (attribute set of attribute set of string)
options.example: { "service.xbmc.versioncheck".versioncheck_enable = "false"; }

options.title: programs.kodi.datadir
options.note: Directory to store configuration and metadata.

options.title: programs.kodi.settings
options.note:
Configuration to write to the advancedsettings.xml
file in kodis userdata directory. Settings specified here will be
immutable from inside kodi and be hidden from the GUI settings dialog.
options.type: null or attribute sets of strings
options.example: { videolibrary.showemptytvshows = "true"; }

options.title: programs.kodi.sources
options.note:
Contents to populate the file sources.xml in kodis
userdata directory.
options.type: null or attribute sets or lists of strings
options.example: { video = { default = "movies"; source = [ { name = "videos"; path = "/path/to/videos"; allowsharing = "true"; } { name = "movies"; path = "/path/to/movies"; allowsharing = "true"; } ]; }; }

options.title: programs.lazygit.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lazygit, a simple terminal UI for git commands.

options.title: programs.lazygit.package
options.note: The lazygit package to use.

options.title: programs.lazygit.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lazygit/config.yml
on Linux or on Darwin if xdg.enable is set, otherwise
~/Library/Application Support/lazygit/config.yml.
See
https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazygit/blob/master/docs/Config.md
for supported values.
options.example: { gui.theme = { lightTheme = true; activeBorderColor = [ "blue" "bold" ]; inactiveBorderColor = [ "black" ]; selectedLineBgColor = [ "default" ]; }; }

options.title: programs.ledger.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ledger, a double-entry accounting system.

options.title: programs.ledger.package
options.note: The ledger package to use.

options.title: programs.ledger.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/ledger/ledgerrc.
options.example: --sort date --effective --date-format %Y-%m-%d

options.title: programs.ledger.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/ledger/ledgerrc.
See https://www.ledger-cli.org/3.0/doc/ledger3.html#Detailed-Option-Description
for explanation about possible values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of string)
options.example: { date-format = "%Y-%m-%d"; file = [ "~/finances/journal.ledger" "~/finances/assets.ledger" "~/finances/income.ledger" ]; sort = "date"; strict = true; }

options.title: programs.less.enable
options.note: Whether to enable less, opposite of more.

options.title: programs.less.keys
options.note:
Extra configuration for less written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lesskey.
options.example: '' s back-line t forw-line ''

options.title: programs.lesspipe.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lesspipe preprocessor for less.

options.title: programs.lf.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lf.

options.title: programs.lf.package
options.note: lf package to use.

options.title: programs.lf.cmdKeybindings
options.note:
Keys to bind to command line commands which can only be one of the
builtin commands. Keys set to null or an empty string are deleted.

options.title: programs.lf.commands
options.note:
Commands to declare. Commands set to null or an empty string are
deleted.
options.example: { get-mime-type = "%xdg-mime query filetype \"$f\""; open = "$$OPENER $f"; }

options.title: programs.lf.extraConfig
options.note: Custom lfrc lines.
options.example: '' $mkdir -p ~/.trash ''

options.title: programs.lf.keybindings
options.note: Keys to bind. Keys set to null or an empty string are deleted.
options.example: { D = "trash"; U = "!du -sh"; gg = null; gh = "cd ~"; i = "$less $f"; }

options.title: programs.lf.previewer.keybinding
options.note:
Key to bind to the script at previewer.source and
pipe through less. Setting to null will not bind any key.

options.title: programs.lf.previewer.source
options.note:
Script or executable to use to preview files. Sets lf’s
previewer option.
options.example: pkgs.writeShellScript "pv.sh" '' #!/bin/sh case "$1" in *.tar*) tar tf "$1";; *.zip) unzip -l "$1";; *.rar) unrar l "$1";; *.7z) 7z l "$1";; *.pdf) pdftotext "$1" -;; *) highlight -O ansi "$1" || cat "$1";; esac ''

options.title: programs.lf.settings
options.note:
An attribute set of lf settings. See the lf documentation for
detailed descriptions of these options. Prefer
programs.lf.previewer.* for setting lf’s previewer
option. All string options are quoted with double quotes.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or list of (string or signed integer) or boolean)
options.example: { number = true; ratios = [ 1 1 2 ]; tabstop = 4; }

options.title: programs.librewolf.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Librewolf browser, a privacy enhanced Firefox fork.

options.title: programs.librewolf.package
options.note: The LibreWolf package to use.

options.title: programs.librewolf.settings
options.note:
Attribute set of LibreWolf settings and overrides. Refer to
https://librewolf.net/docs/settings/
for details on supported values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { "webgl.disabled" = false; "privacy.resistFingerprinting" = false; }

options.title: programs.lieer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: programs.lieer.package
options.note: lieer package to use.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.enable
options.note: Whether to enable looking-glass-client.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.package
options.note: The looking-glass-client package to use.

options.title: programs.looking-glass-client.settings
options.note: looking-glass-client settings.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { app = { allowDMA = true; shmFile = "/dev/kvmfr0"; }; win = { fullScreen = true; showFPS = false; jitRender = true; }; spice = { enable = true; audio = true; }; input = { rawMouse = true; escapeKey = 62; }; }

options.title: programs.lsd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lsd.

options.title: programs.lsd.enableAliases
options.note: Whether to enable recommended lsd aliases.

options.title: programs.lsd.colors
options.note:
Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lsd/colors.yaml. See
https://github.com/lsd-rs/lsd/tree/v1.0.0#color-theme-file-content for
supported colors.
options.example: { size = { large = "dark_yellow"; none = "grey"; small = "yellow"; }; }

options.title: programs.lsd.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/lsd/config.yaml. See
https://github.com/Peltoche/lsd#config-file-content
for supported values.
options.example: { date = "relative"; ignore-globs = [ ".git" ".hg" ]; }

options.title: programs.man.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable manual pages and the man
command. This also includes “man” outputs of all
home.packages.

options.title: programs.man.package
options.note: The man package to use.

options.title: programs.man.generateCaches
options.note:
Whether to generate the manual page index caches using
mandb(8). This allows searching for a page or
keyword using utilities like apropos(1).

options.title: programs.mangohud.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Mangohud.

options.title: programs.mangohud.enableSessionWide
options.note:
Sets environment variables so that
MangoHud is started on any application that supports it.

options.title: programs.mangohud.package
options.note: The Mangohud package to install.

options.title: programs.mangohud.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/MangoHud.conf. See
https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/blob/master/data/MangoHud.conf
for the default configuration.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or path or list of (signed integer or string))
options.example: { output_folder = ~/Documents/mangohud/; full = true; }

options.title: programs.mangohud.settingsPerApplication
options.note:
Sets MangoHud settings per application.
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/MangoHud/{application_name}.conf. See
https://github.com/flightlessmango/MangoHud/blob/master/data/MangoHud.conf
for the default configuration.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or path or list of (signed integer or string))
options.example: { mpv = { no_display = true; } }

options.title: programs.matplotlib.enable
options.note: Whether to enable matplotlib, a plotting library for python.

options.title: programs.matplotlib.config
options.note:
Add terms to the matplotlibrc file to
control the default matplotlib behavior.
options.example: { backend = "Qt5Agg"; axes = { grid = true; facecolor = "black"; edgecolor = "FF9900"; }; grid.color = "FF9900"; }

options.title: programs.matplotlib.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional commands for matplotlib that will be added to the
matplotlibrc file.

options.title: programs.mbsync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mbsync IMAP4 and Maildir mailbox synchronizer.

options.title: programs.mbsync.package
options.note: The package to use for the mbsync binary.

options.title: programs.mbsync.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines to add to the mbsync configuration.

options.title: programs.mbsync.groups
options.note: Definition of groups.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of list of string
options.example: { inboxes = { account1 = [ "Inbox" ]; account2 = [ "Inbox" ]; }; }

options.title: programs.mcfly.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mcfly.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableLightTheme
options.note: Whether to enable light mode theme.

options.title: programs.mcfly.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.fuzzySearchFactor
options.note:
Whether to enable fuzzy searching.
0 is off; higher numbers weight toward shorter matches.
Values in the 2-5 range get good results so far.

options.title: programs.mcfly.fzf.enable
options.note: Whether to enable McFly fzf integration.

options.title: programs.mcfly.interfaceView
options.note: Interface view to use.

options.title: programs.mcfly.keyScheme
options.note: Key scheme to use.

options.title: programs.mercurial.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Mercurial.

options.title: programs.mercurial.package
options.note: Mercurial package to install.

options.title: programs.mercurial.aliases
options.note: Mercurial aliases to define.

options.title: programs.mercurial.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add.
options.type: (attribute set of anything) or strings concatenated with “\n”

options.title: programs.mercurial.ignores
options.note: List of globs for files to be globally ignored.
options.example: [ "*~" "*.swp" ]

options.title: programs.mercurial.ignoresRegexp
options.note: List of regular expressions for files to be globally ignored.
options.example: [ "^.*~$" "^.*\\.swp$" ]

options.title: programs.mercurial.userEmail
options.note: Default user email to use.

options.title: programs.mercurial.userName
options.note: Default user name to use.

options.title: programs.micro.enable
options.note: Whether to enable micro, a terminal-based text editor.

options.title: programs.micro.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/micro/settings.json. See
https://github.com/zyedidia/micro/blob/master/runtime/help/options.md
for supported values.
options.example: { autosu = false; cursorline = false; }

options.title: programs.mise.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mise.

options.title: programs.mise.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash Integration.

options.title: programs.mise.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish Integration.

options.title: programs.mise.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh Integration.

options.title: programs.mise.package
options.note: The mise package to use.

options.title: programs.mise.globalConfig
options.note: Config written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mise/config.toml.
options.example: tools = { node = "lts"; python = ["3.10" "3.11"]; }; aliases = { my_custom_node = "20"; };

options.title: programs.mise.settings
options.note: Settings written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mise/settings.toml.
options.example: verbose = false; experimental = false; disable_tools = ["node"];

options.title: programs.mpv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mpv.

options.title: programs.mpv.package
options.note: Package providing mpv.

options.title: programs.mpv.bindings
options.note:
Input configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/input.conf. See
mpv(1)
for the full list of options.
options.example: { WHEEL_UP = "seek 10"; WHEEL_DOWN = "seek -10"; "Alt+0" = "set window-scale 0.5"; }

options.title: programs.mpv.config
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/mpv.conf. See
mpv(1)
for the full list of options.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))
options.example: { profile = "gpu-hq"; force-window = true; ytdl-format = "bestvideo+bestaudio"; cache-default = 4000000; }

options.title: programs.mpv.defaultProfiles
options.note:
Profiles to be applied by default. Options set by them are overridden
by options set in programs.mpv.config.
options.example: [ "gpu-hq" ]

options.title: programs.mpv.profiles
options.note:
Sub-configuration options for specific profiles written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/mpv.conf. See
programs.mpv.config for more information.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))
options.example: { fast = { vo = "vdpau"; }; "protocol.dvd" = { profile-desc = "profile for dvd:// streams"; alang = "en"; }; }

options.title: programs.mpv.scriptOpts
options.note:
Script options added to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mpv/script-opts/. See
mpv(1)
for the full list of options of builtin scripts.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number))
options.example: { osc = { scalewindowed = 2.0; vidscale = false; visibility = "always"; }; }

options.title: programs.mpv.scripts
options.note: List of scripts to use with mpv.

options.title: programs.mr.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mr, a tool to manage all your version control repositories.

options.title: programs.mr.package
options.note: The mr package to use.

options.title: programs.mr.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to $HOME/.mrconfig
See https://myrepos.branchable.com/
for an example configuration.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a non-empty list of them)
options.example: { foo = { checkout = "git clone git@github.com:joeyh/foo.git"; update = "git pull --rebase"; }; ".local/share/password-store" = { checkout = "git clone git@github.com:myuser/password-store.git"; }; }

options.title: programs.msmtp.enable
options.note: Whether to enable msmtp.

options.title: programs.msmtp.package
options.note: The msmtp package to use.

options.title: programs.msmtp.extraAccounts
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to the end of ~/.msmtprc.
See https://marlam.de/msmtp/msmtprc.txt for examples.

options.title: programs.msmtp.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.msmtprc.
See https://marlam.de/msmtp/msmtprc.txt for examples.

options.title: programs.mu.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mu, a maildir indexer and searcher.

options.title: programs.mu.package
options.note: The mu package to use.

options.title: programs.mujmap.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mujmap Gmail synchronization for notmuch.

options.title: programs.mujmap.package
options.note: mujmap package to use.

options.title: programs.navi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Navi.

options.title: programs.navi.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.navi.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.navi.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.navi.package
options.note: The package to use for the navi binary.

options.title: programs.navi.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/navi/config.yaml on Linux or
$HOME/Library/Application Support/navi/config.yaml
on Darwin. See
https://github.com/denisidoro/navi/blob/master/docs/config_file.md
for more information.
options.example: { cheats = { paths = [ "~/cheats/" ]; }; }

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ncmpcpp - an ncurses Music Player Daemon (MPD) client.

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.package
options.note: Package providing the ncmpcpp command.

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.bindings
options.note: List of keybindings.
options.example: [ { key = "j"; command = "scroll_down"; } { key = "k"; command = "scroll_up"; } { key = "J"; command = [ "select_item" "scroll_down" ]; } { key = "K"; command = [ "select_item" "scroll_up" ]; } ]

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.*.command
options.note: Command or sequence of commands to be executed.

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.bindings.*.key
options.note: Key to bind.

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.mpdMusicDir
options.note:
Value of the mpd_music_dir setting. On Linux platforms the
value of services.mpd.musicDirectory is used as the
default if services.mpd.enable is
true.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: programs.ncmpcpp.settings
options.note:
Attribute set from name of a setting to its value. For available options
see
ncmpcpp(1).
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { ncmpcpp_directory = "~/.local/share/ncmpcpp"; }

options.title: programs.ncspot.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ncspot.

options.title: programs.ncspot.package
options.note: The package to use for ncspot.

options.title: programs.ncspot.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/ncspot/config.toml.
options.example: { shuffle = true; gapless = true; }

options.title: programs.ne.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ne.

options.title: programs.ne.automaticPreferences
options.note: Automatic preferences files for ne.
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n”
options.example: { nix = '' TAB 0 TS 2 ''; js = '' TS 4 ''; }

options.title: programs.ne.defaultPreferences
options.note: Default preferences for ne.

options.title: programs.ne.keybindings
options.note: Keybinding file for ne.
options.example: '' KEY 7f BS SEQ "\x1b[1;5D" 7f ''

options.title: programs.ne.menus
options.note: Menu configuration file for ne.

options.title: programs.ne.virtualExtensions
options.note: Virtual extensions configuration file for ne.
options.example: '' sh 1 ^#!\s*/.*\b(bash|sh|ksh|zsh)\s* csh 1 ^#!\s*/.*\b(csh|tcsh)\s* ''

options.title: programs.neomutt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the NeoMutt mail client.

options.title: programs.neomutt.package
options.note: The neomutt package to use.

options.title: programs.neomutt.binds
options.note: List of keybindings.

options.title: programs.neomutt.binds.*.action
options.note: Specify the action to take.

options.title: programs.neomutt.binds.*.key
options.note: The key to bind.

options.title: programs.neomutt.binds.*.map
options.note: Select the menu to bind the command to.
options.type: one of “alias”, “attach”, “browser”, “compose”, “editor”, “generic”, “index”, “mix”, “pager”, “pgp”, “postpone”, “query”, “smime” or list of (one of “alias”, “attach”, “browser”, “compose”, “editor”, “generic”, “index”, “mix”, “pager”, “pgp”, “postpone”, “query”, “smime”)

options.title: programs.neomutt.changeFolderWhenSourcingAccount
options.note: Whether to enable changing the folder when sourcing an account.

options.title: programs.neomutt.checkStatsInterval
options.note: Enable and set the interval of automatic mail check.

options.title: programs.neomutt.editor
options.note: Select the editor used for writing mail.

options.title: programs.neomutt.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration appended to the end.

options.title: programs.neomutt.macros
options.note: List of macros.

options.title: programs.neomutt.macros.*.action
options.note: Specify the action to take.

options.title: programs.neomutt.macros.*.key
options.note: The key to bind.

options.title: programs.neomutt.macros.*.map
options.note: Select the menu to bind the command to.
options.type: one of “alias”, “attach”, “browser”, “compose”, “editor”, “generic”, “index”, “mix”, “pager”, “pgp”, “postpone”, “query”, “smime” or list of (one of “alias”, “attach”, “browser”, “compose”, “editor”, “generic”, “index”, “mix”, “pager”, “pgp”, “postpone”, “query”, “smime”)

options.title: programs.neomutt.settings
options.note: Extra configuration appended to the end.

options.title: programs.neomutt.sidebar
options.note: Options related to the sidebar.

options.title: programs.neomutt.sidebar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sidebar support.

options.title: programs.neomutt.sidebar.format
options.note: Sidebar format. Check neomutt documentation for details.

options.title: programs.neomutt.sidebar.shortPath
options.note:
By default sidebar shows the full path of the mailbox, but
with this enabled only the relative name is shown.

options.title: programs.neomutt.sidebar.width
options.note: Width of the sidebar

options.title: programs.neomutt.sort
options.note: Sorting method on messages.

options.title: programs.neomutt.vimKeys
options.note: Enable vim-like bindings.

options.title: programs.neovim.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Neovim.

options.title: programs.neovim.package
options.note: The package to use for the neovim binary.

options.title: programs.neovim.coc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Coc.

options.title: programs.neovim.coc.package
options.note: The package to use for the CoC plugin.

options.title: programs.neovim.coc.pluginConfig
options.note: Script to configure CoC. Must be viml.

options.title: programs.neovim.coc.settings
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/nvim/coc-settings.json
See
https://github.com/neoclide/coc.nvim/wiki/Using-the-configuration-file
for options.
options.example: { "suggest.noselect" = true; "suggest.enablePreview" = true; "suggest.enablePreselect" = false; "suggest.disableKind" = true; languageserver = { haskell = { command = "haskell-language-server-wrapper"; args = [ "--lsp" ]; rootPatterns = [ "*.cabal" "stack.yaml" "cabal.project" "package.yaml" "hie.yaml" ]; filetypes = [ "haskell" "lhaskell" ]; }; }; };

options.title: programs.neovim.defaultEditor
options.note:
Whether to configure nvim as the default
editor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.neovim.extraConfig
options.note: Custom vimrc lines.
options.example: '' set nobackup ''

options.title: programs.neovim.extraLuaConfig
options.note: Custom lua lines.
options.example: '' vim.opt.nobackup = true ''

options.title: programs.neovim.extraLuaPackages
options.note:
The extra Lua packages required for your plugins to work.
This option accepts a function that takes a Lua package set as an argument,
and selects the required Lua packages from this package set.
See the example for more info.
options.type: (function that evaluates to a(n) list of package) or (list of package) convertible to it

options.title: programs.neovim.extraPackages
options.note: Extra packages available to nvim.

options.title: programs.neovim.extraPython3Packages
options.note:
The extra Python 3 packages required for your plugins to work.
This option accepts a function that takes a Python 3 package set as an argument,
and selects the required Python 3 packages from this package set.
See the example for more info.
options.type: (function that evaluates to a(n) list of package) or (list of package) convertible to it

options.title: programs.neovim.finalPackage
options.note: Resulting customized neovim package.

options.title: programs.neovim.generatedConfigViml
options.note: Generated vimscript config.

options.title: programs.neovim.generatedConfigs
options.note: Generated configurations with as key their language (set via type).
options.type: attribute set of strings concatenated with “\n” (read only)
options.example: { viml = '' " Generated by home-manager map <leader> , ''; lua = '' -- Generated by home-manager vim.opt.background = "dark" ''; }

options.title: programs.neovim.plugins
options.note:
List of vim plugins to install optionally associated with
configuration to be placed in init.vim.
options.example: with pkgs.vimPlugins; [ yankring vim-nix { plugin = vim-startify; config = "let g:startify_change_to_vcs_root = 0"; } ]

options.title: programs.neovim.viAlias
options.note: Symlink vi to nvim binary.

options.title: programs.neovim.vimAlias
options.note: Symlink vim to nvim binary.

options.title: programs.neovim.vimdiffAlias
options.note: Alias vimdiff to nvim -d.

options.title: programs.neovim.withNodeJs
options.note:
Enable node provider. Set to true to
use Node plugins.

options.title: programs.neovim.withPython3
options.note:
Enable Python 3 provider. Set to true to
use Python 3 plugins.

options.title: programs.neovim.withRuby
options.note: Enable ruby provider.

options.title: programs.newsboat.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Newsboat feed reader.

options.title: programs.newsboat.autoReload
options.note: Whether to enable automatic reloading while newsboat is running.

options.title: programs.newsboat.browser
options.note: External browser to use.

options.title: programs.newsboat.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration values that will be appended to the end.

options.title: programs.newsboat.maxItems
options.note: Maximum number of items per feed, 0 for infinite.

options.title: programs.newsboat.queries
options.note: A list of queries to use.
options.example: { foo = "rssurl =~ \"example.com\""; }

options.title: programs.newsboat.reloadThreads
options.note: How many threads to use for updating the feeds.

options.title: programs.newsboat.reloadTime
options.note: Time in minutes between reloads.

options.title: programs.newsboat.urls
options.note:
List of news feeds. Leave it empty if you want to manage feeds
imperatively, for example, using Syncthing.
options.example: [ { tags = [ "foo" "bar" ]; url = "http://example.com"; } ]

options.title: programs.newsboat.urls.*.tags
options.note: Feed tags.
options.example: [ "foo" "bar" ]

options.title: programs.newsboat.urls.*.title
options.note: Feed title.

options.title: programs.newsboat.urls.*.url
options.note: Feed URL.

options.title: programs.nheko.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Qt desktop client for Matrix.

options.title: programs.nheko.package
options.note: The nheko package to use.

options.title: programs.nheko.settings
options.note: Attribute set of Nheko preferences (converted to an INI file).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { general.disableCertificateValidation = false; auth = { accessToken = "SECRET"; deviceId = "MY_DEVICE"; homeServer = "https://matrix-client.matrix.org:443"; userId = "@@user:matrix.org"; }; settings.scaleFactor = 1.0; sidebar.width = 416; user = { alertOnNotification = true; animateImagesOnHover = false; "sidebar\\roomListWidth" = 308; }; }

options.title: programs.nix-index.enable
options.note: Whether to enable nix-index, a file database for nixpkgs.

options.title: programs.nix-index.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.nix-index.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.nix-index.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.nix-index.package
options.note: Package providing the nix-index tool.

options.title: programs.nnn.enable
options.note: Whether to enable nnn.

options.title: programs.nnn.package
options.note: Package containing the nnn program.

options.title: programs.nnn.bookmarks
options.note: Directory bookmarks.
options.example: { d = "~/Documents"; D = "~/Downloads"; p = "~/Pictures"; v = "~/Videos"; };

options.title: programs.nnn.extraPackages
options.note: Extra packages available to nnn.

options.title: programs.nnn.plugins
options.note: Manage nnn plugins.

options.title: programs.nnn.plugins.mappings
options.note: Key mappings to the plugins.
options.example: { c = "fzcd"; f = "finder"; v = "imgview"; };

options.title: programs.nnn.plugins.src
options.note: Path to the plugin folder.
options.example: (pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "jarun"; repo = "nnn"; rev = "v4.0"; sha256 = "sha256-Hpc8YaJeAzJoEi7aJ6DntH2VLkoR6ToP6tPYn3llR7k="; }) + "/plugins";

options.title: programs.noti.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Noti.

options.title: programs.noti.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/noti/noti.yaml.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string
options.example: { say = { voice = "Alex"; }; slack = { token = "1234567890abcdefg"; channel = "@jaime"; }; }

options.title: programs.notmuch.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Notmuch mail indexer.

options.title: programs.notmuch.extraConfig
options.note: Options that should be appended to the notmuch configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: programs.notmuch.hooks.postInsert
options.note:
Bash statements run after a message has been inserted
into the database and initial tags have been applied.

options.title: programs.notmuch.hooks.postNew
options.note:
Bash statements run after new messages have been imported
into the database and initial tags have been applied.
options.example: '' notmuch tag +nixos -- tag:new and from:nixos1@discoursemail.com ''

options.title: programs.notmuch.hooks.preNew
options.note:
Bash statements run before scanning or importing new
messages into the database.

options.title: programs.notmuch.maildir.synchronizeFlags
options.note: Whether to synchronize Maildir flags.

options.title: programs.notmuch.new
options.note:
Options related to email processing performed by
notmuch new.

options.title: programs.notmuch.new.ignore
options.note:
A list to specify files and directories that will not be
searched for messages by notmuch new.

options.title: programs.notmuch.new.tags
options.note:
A list of tags that will be added to all messages
incorporated by notmuch new.
options.example: [ "new" ]

options.title: programs.notmuch.search.excludeTags
options.note:
A  list  of  tags  that  will be excluded from search results by
default. Using an excluded tag in a  query  will  override  that
exclusion.
options.example: [ "trash" "spam" ]

options.title: programs.nushell.enable
options.note: Whether to enable nushell.

options.title: programs.nushell.package
options.note: The package to use for nushell.

options.title: programs.nushell.configFile
options.note: The configuration file to be used for nushell.
options.example: { text = '' let $config = { filesize_metric: false table_mode: rounded use_ls_colors: true } ''; }

options.title: programs.nushell.configFile.source
options.note:
Path of the nushell config.nu file to use.
If the text option is set, it will be preferred.

options.title: programs.nushell.configFile.text
options.note:
Text of the nushell config.nu file.
If unset then the source option will be preferred.
options.default: if source is defined, the content of source, otherwise empty

options.title: programs.nushell.envFile
options.note: The environment variables file to be used for nushell.
options.example: '' $env.FOO = 'BAR' ''

options.title: programs.nushell.envFile.source
options.note:
Path of the nushell env.nu file to use.
If the text option is set, it will be preferred.

options.title: programs.nushell.envFile.text
options.note:
Text of the nushell env.nu file.
If unset then the source option will be preferred.
options.default: if source is defined, the content of source, otherwise empty

options.title: programs.nushell.environmentVariables
options.note: An attribute set that maps an environment variable to a shell interpreted string.
options.example: { FOO = "BAR"; }

options.title: programs.nushell.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add to the nushell configuration file.

options.title: programs.nushell.extraEnv
options.note: Additional configuration to add to the nushell environment variables file.

options.title: programs.nushell.extraLogin
options.note: Additional configuration to add to the nushell login file.

options.title: programs.nushell.loginFile
options.note: The login file to be used for nushell upon logging in.
options.example: '' # Prints "Hello, World" upon logging into tty1 if (tty) == "/dev/tty1" { echo "Hello, World" } ''

options.title: programs.nushell.loginFile.source
options.note:
Path of the nushell login.nu file to use.
If the text option is set, it will be preferred.

options.title: programs.nushell.loginFile.text
options.note:
Text of the nushell login.nu file.
If unset then the source option will be preferred.
options.default: if source is defined, the content of source, otherwise empty

options.title: programs.nushell.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names in
this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { ll = "ls -l"; }

options.title: programs.obs-studio.enable
options.note: Whether to enable obs-studio.

options.title: programs.obs-studio.package
options.note: OBS Studio package to install.

options.title: programs.obs-studio.plugins

options.title: programs.offlineimap.enable
options.note: Whether to enable OfflineIMAP.

options.title: programs.offlineimap.package
options.note: The offlineimap package to use. Can be used to specify extensions.
options.example: pkgs.offlineimap.overridePythonAttrs ( old: { propagatedBuildInputs = old.propagatedBuildInputs ++ (with pkgs.python3Packages; [ requests_oauthlib xdg gpgme]); })

options.title: programs.offlineimap.extraConfig.default
options.note:
Extra configuration options added to the
DEFAULT section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { gmailtrashfolder = "[Gmail]/Papierkorb"; }

options.title: programs.offlineimap.extraConfig.general
options.note:
Extra configuration options added to the
general section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { maxage = 30; ui = "blinkenlights"; }

options.title: programs.offlineimap.extraConfig.mbnames
options.note:
Extra configuration options added to the
mbnames section.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean)
options.example: { filename = "~/.config/mutt/mailboxes"; header = "'mailboxes '"; peritem = "'+%(accountname)s/%(foldername)s'"; sep = "' '"; footer = "'\\n'"; }

options.title: programs.offlineimap.pythonFile
options.note:
Python code that can then be used in other parts of the
configuration.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable oh-my-posh, a prompt theme engine for any shell.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.package
options.note: The oh-my-posh package to use.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/oh-my-posh/config.json. See
https://ohmyposh.dev/docs/configuration/overview
for details. The useTheme option is ignored when this
option is used.

options.title: programs.oh-my-posh.useTheme
options.note:
Use one of the official themes. This should be a name from this list:
https://ohmyposh.dev/docs/themes. Because a theme
is essentially a configuration file, this option is not used when a
configFile is set.

options.title: programs.opam.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Opam.

options.title: programs.opam.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.opam.enableFishIntegration

options.title: programs.opam.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.opam.package
options.note: Opam package to install.

options.title: programs.openstackclient.enable
options.note: Whether to enable OpenStack command-line client.

options.title: programs.openstackclient.package
options.note: The openstackclient package to use.

options.title: programs.openstackclient.clouds
options.note: Configuration needed to connect to one or more clouds.

options.note: Public information about clouds.

options.title: programs.pandoc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pandoc.

options.title: programs.pandoc.package
options.note: The pandoc package to use.

options.title: programs.pandoc.citationStyles

options.note:
Options to set by default.

options.title: programs.pandoc.finalPackage
options.note: Resulting package.

options.title: programs.pandoc.templates
options.note: Custom templates.
options.example: { "default.latex" = path/to/your/template; }

options.note: Whether to enable papis.

options.title: programs.papis.libraries
options.note: Attribute set of papis libraries.

options.title: programs.papis.libraries.<name>.isDefault
options.note:
Whether this is a default library. There must be exactly one
default library.

options.title: programs.papis.libraries.<name>.name
options.note: This library’s name.

options.title: programs.papis.libraries.<name>.settings
options.note: Configuration for this library.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { dir = "~/papers/"; }

options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/papis/config. See
https://papis.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration.html
for supported values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { editor = "nvim"; file-browser = "ranger" add-edit = true; }

options.note: Whether to enable Password store.

The pass package to use.

options.example: pkgs.pass.withExtensions (exts: [ exts.pass-otp ])

options.title: programs.password-store.settings
options.note: The pass environment variables dictionary.
options.example: { PASSWORD_STORE_DIR = "/some/directory"; PASSWORD_STORE_KEY = "12345678"; PASSWORD_STORE_CLIP_TIME = "60"; }

options.title: programs.pazi.enable

options.title: programs.pazi.enableBashIntegration

options.title: programs.pazi.enableZshIntegration

options.note:
Settings written to config.toml. See the pet

options.title: programs.pet.snippets
options.note: The snippets.

options.title: programs.pet.snippets.*.command
options.note: The command.

options.title: programs.pet.snippets.*.description
options.note: Description of the snippet.

options.title: programs.pet.snippets.*.output
options.note: Example output of the command.

options.title: programs.pet.snippets.*.tag
options.note: List of tags attached to the command.

options.title: programs.pidgin.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Pidgin messaging client.

options.title: programs.pidgin.package
options.note: The Pidgin package to use.

options.title: programs.pidgin.plugins
options.note: Plugins that should be available to Pidgin.

options.note: Whether to enable file previewer for terminal file managers.

options.title: programs.pistol.associations
options.note:
Associations written to the Pistol configuration at
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/pistol/pistol.conf.
options.example: [ { mime = "application/json"; command = "bat %pistol-filename%"; } { mime = "application/*"; command = "hexyl %pistol-filename%"; } { fpath = ".*.md$"; command = "sh: bat --paging=never --color=always %pistol-filename% | head -8"; } ]

options.title: programs.pistol.associations.*.command
options.note: Preview command for files matched by this association.

options.title: programs.pistol.associations.*.fpath
options.note: File path regex that this association should match.

options.title: programs.pistol.associations.*.mime
options.note: Mime type regex that this association should match.

options.title: programs.piston-cli.enable
options.note: Whether to enable piston-cli, code runner.

options.title: programs.piston-cli.package
options.note: The piston-cli package to use.

options.title: programs.piston-cli.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/piston-cli/config.yml.
options.example: { theme = "emacs"; box_style = "MINIMAL_DOUBLE_HEAD"; prompt_continuation = "..."; prompt_start = ">>>"; }

options.title: programs.pls.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pls, a modern replacement for ls.

options.title: programs.pls.enableAliases
options.note: Whether to enable recommended pls aliases.

options.title: programs.pls.package
options.note: The pls package to use.

options.title: programs.powerline-go.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Powerline-go, a beautiful and useful low-latency prompt for your shell.

options.title: programs.powerline-go.extraUpdatePS1
options.note: Shell code to execute after the prompt is set.
options.example: '' PS1=$PS1"NixOS> "; ''

options.title: programs.powerline-go.modules
options.note:
List of module names to load. The list of all available
modules as well as the choice of default ones are at
https://github.com/justjanne/powerline-go.
options.example: [ "host" "ssh" "cwd" "gitlite" "jobs" "exit" ]

options.title: programs.powerline-go.modulesRight
options.note:
List of module names to load to be displayed on the right side.
Currently not supported by bash. Specifying a value for this
option will force powerline-go to use the eval format to set
the prompt.
options.example: [ "host" "venv" "git" ]

options.title: programs.powerline-go.newline
options.note: Set to true if the prompt should be on a line of its own.

options.title: programs.powerline-go.pathAliases
options.note:
Pairs of full-path and corresponding desired short name. You
may use ‘~’ to represent your home directory but you should
protect it to avoid shell substitution.
options.example: { "\\~/projects/home-manager" = "prj:home-manager"; }

options.title: programs.powerline-go.settings
options.note:
This can be any key/value pair as described in
https://github.com/justjanne/powerline-go.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of string)
options.example: { hostname-only-if-ssh = true; numeric-exit-codes = true; cwd-max-depth = 7; ignore-repos = [ "/home/me/big-project" "/home/me/huge-project" ]; }

options.title: programs.pqiv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pqiv image viewer.

options.title: programs.pqiv.package
options.note: The pqiv package to install.

options.title: programs.pqiv.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
<filename>$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/pqivrc</filename>. See <link
xlink:href=“https://github.com/phillipberndt/pqiv/blob/master/pqiv.1”/>
for a list of available options. To set a boolean flag, set the value to 1.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { options = { lazy-load = 1; hide-info-box = 1; background-pattern = "black"; thumbnail-size = "256x256"; command-1 = "thunar"; }; };

options.title: programs.pubs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pubs.

options.title: programs.pubs.package
options.note: The package to use for the pubs script.

options.title: programs.pubs.extraConfig
options.note:
Configuration using syntax written to
$HOME/.pubsrc.
options.example: '' [main] pubsdir = ${config.home.homeDirectory}/.pubs docsdir = ${config.home.homeDirectory}/.pubs/doc doc_add = link open_cmd = xdg-open [plugins] active = git,alias [[alias]] [[[la]]] command = list -a description = lists papers in lexicographic order [[git]] quiet = True manual = False force_color = False ''

options.title: programs.pyenv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pyenv.

options.title: programs.pyenv.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable pyenv’s Bash integration.

options.title: programs.pyenv.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable pyenv’s Fish integration.

options.title: programs.pyenv.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable pyenv’s Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.pyenv.package
options.note: The package to use for pyenv.

options.title: programs.pyenv.rootDirectory
options.note: The pyenv root directory (PYENV_ROOT).

options.title: programs.pylint.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the pylint Python linter.

options.title: programs.pylint.package
options.note: The pylint package to use.

options.title: programs.pylint.settings
options.note: The pylint configuration.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a non-empty list of them)

options.title: programs.pywal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pywal.

options.title: programs.qcal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable qcal, a CLI calendar application.

options.title: programs.qcal.defaultNumDays
options.note: Default number of days to show calendar entries for

options.title: programs.qcal.timezone
options.note: Timezone to display calendar entries in

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.enable
options.note: Whether to enable qutebrowser.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.enableDefaultBindings
options.note: Disable to prevent loading default key bindings.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.package
options.note: Qutebrowser package to install.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.aliases
options.note: Aliases for commands.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.extraConfig
options.note: Extra lines added to qutebrowser config.py file.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.greasemonkey
options.note:
Greasemonkey userscripts to add to qutebrowser’s greasemonkey
directory.
options.example: [ (pkgs.fetchurl { url = "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/afreakk/greasemonkeyscripts/1d1be041a65c251692ee082eda64d2637edf6444/youtube_sponsorblock.js"; sha256 = "sha256-e3QgDPa3AOpPyzwvVjPQyEsSUC9goisjBUDMxLwg8ZE="; }) (pkgs.writeText "some-script.js" '' // ==UserScript== // @name Some Greasemonkey script // ==/UserScript== '') ]

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyBindings
options.note:
Key bindings mapping keys to commands in different modes. This setting
is a dictionary containing mode names and dictionaries mapping keys to
commands: {mode: {key: command}} If you want to map
a key to another key, check the keyMappings setting
instead. For modifiers, you can use either - or
+ as delimiters, and these names:
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of strings concatenated with " ;; "
options.example: { normal = { "<Ctrl-v>" = "spawn mpv {url}"; ",p" = "spawn --userscript qute-pass"; ",l" = ''config-cycle spellcheck.languages ["en-GB"] ["en-US"]''; "<F1>" = mkMerge [ "config-cycle tabs.show never always" "config-cycle statusbar.show in-mode always" "config-cycle scrolling.bar never always" ]; }; prompt = { "<Ctrl-y>" = "prompt-yes"; }; }

options.description: Default mode, where most commands are invoked.

Entered when an input field is focused on a website, or by pressing i in normal mode. Passes through almost all keypresses to the website, but has some bindings like <Ctrl-e> to open an external editor. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when f is pressed to select links with the keyboard. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.

Similar to insert mode, but passes through all keypresses except <Escape> to leave the mode. It might be useful to bind <Escape> to some other key in this mode if you want to be able to send an Escape key to the website as well. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when pressing the : key in order to enter a command. Note that single keys can’t be bound in this mode.
Entered when there’s a prompt to display, like for download locations or when invoked from JavaScript.
Entered when there’s a yes/no prompt displayed.
Entered when pressing the v mode, used to select text using the keyboard.
Entered when qutebrowser is waiting for a register name/key for commands like :set-mark.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.keyMappings
options.note:
This setting can be used to map keys to other keys. When the key used
as dictionary-key is pressed, the binding for the key used as
dictionary-value is invoked instead. This is useful for global
remappings of keys, for example to map Ctrl-[ to Escape. Note that when
a key is bound (via bindings.default or
bindings.commands), the mapping is ignored.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.loadAutoconfig
options.note: Load settings configured via the GUI.

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.quickmarks
options.note:
Quickmarks to add to qutebrowser’s quickmarks file.
Note that when Home Manager manages your quickmarks, you cannot edit them at runtime.
options.example: { nixpkgs = "https://github.com/NixOS/nixpkgs"; home-manager = "https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager"; }

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.searchEngines
options.note:
Search engines that can be used via the address bar. Maps a search
engine name (such as DEFAULT, or
ddg) to a URL with a {}
placeholder. The placeholder will be replaced by the search term, use
{{ and }} for literal
{/} signs. The search engine named
DEFAULT is used when
url.auto_search is turned on and something else than
a URL was entered to be opened. Other search engines can be used by
prepending the search engine name to the search term, for example
:open google qutebrowser.
options.example: { w = "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search?search={}&go=Go&ns0=1"; aw = "https://wiki.archlinux.org/?search={}"; nw = "https://nixos.wiki/index.php?search={}"; g = "https://www.google.com/search?hl=en&q={}"; }

options.title: programs.qutebrowser.settings
options.note:
Options to add to qutebrowser config.py file.
See https://qutebrowser.org/doc/help/settings.html
for options.
options.example: { colors = { hints = { bg = "#000000"; fg = "#ffffff"; }; tabs.bar.bg = "#000000"; }; tabs.tabs_are_windows = true; }

options.title: programs.rbenv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable rbenv.

options.title: programs.rbenv.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.rbenv.enableFishIntegration

options.title: programs.rbenv.enableZshIntegration

options.example: [ { name = "ruby-build"; src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "rbenv"; repo = "ruby-build"; rev = "v20221225"; hash = "sha256-Kuq0Z1kh2mvq7rHEgwVG9XwzR5ZUtU/h8SQ7W4/mBU0="; }; } ]

options.title: programs.rbenv.plugins.*.name

rbw configuration, if not defined the configuration will not be

options.title: programs.rbw.settings.base_url

options.title: programs.rbw.settings.email

options.title: programs.rbw.settings.identity_url

options.title: programs.rbw.settings.lock_timeout

options.note:
Which pinentry interface to use. Beware that
pinentry-gnome3 may not work on non-Gnome
systems. You can fix it by adding the following to your
system configuration:

options.title: programs.readline.enable
options.note: Whether to enable readline.

Configuration lines appended unchanged to the end of the

Enable Rio, a terminal built to run everywhere, as a native desktop applications by

options.example: { modi = "drun,emoji,ssh"; kb-primary-paste = "Control+V,Shift+Insert"; kb-secondary-paste = "Control+v,Insert"; }

options.title: programs.rofi.finalPackage
options.note: Resulting customized rofi package.

options.title: programs.rofi.font
options.note: Font to use.

options.title: programs.rofi.location
options.note: The location rofi appears on the screen.

options.title: programs.rofi.pass.enable
options.note: Whether to enable rofi integration with password-store.

options.title: programs.rofi.pass.package
options.note: The rofi-pass package to use.

options.title: programs.rofi.pass.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration to be added at to the rofi-pass config file.
Additional examples can be found at
https://github.com/carnager/rofi-pass/blob/master/config.example.
options.example: '' URL_field='url' USERNAME_field='user' AUTOTYPE_field='autotype' ''

options.title: programs.rofi.pass.stores
options.note: Directory roots of your password-stores.

options.title: programs.rofi.plugins
options.note: List of rofi plugins to be installed.

options.title: programs.rofi.terminal
options.note: Path to the terminal which will be used to run console applications

options.title: programs.rofi.theme
options.note:
Name of theme or path to theme file in rasi format or attribute set with
theme configuration. Available named themes can be viewed using the
rofi-theme-selector tool.
options.type: null or string or path or attribute set of ((attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or (Rasi literal string) or list of (string or signed integer or boolean or (Rasi literal string)))) or string)
options.example: let # Use `mkLiteral` for string-like values that should show without # quotes, e.g.: # { # foo = "abc"; => foo: "abc"; # bar = mkLiteral "abc"; => bar: abc; # }; inherit (config.lib.formats.rasi) mkLiteral; in { "*" = { background-color = mkLiteral "#000000"; foreground-color = mkLiteral "rgba ( 250, 251, 252, 100 % )"; border-color = mkLiteral "#FFFFFF"; width = 512; }; "#inputbar" = { children = map mkLiteral [ "prompt" "entry" ]; }; "#textbox-prompt-colon" = { expand = false; str = ":"; margin = mkLiteral "0px 0.3em 0em 0em"; text-color = mkLiteral "@foreground-color"; }; }

options.title: programs.rofi.xoffset
options.note: Offset in the x-axis in pixels relative to the chosen location.

options.title: programs.rofi.yoffset
options.note: Offset in the y-axis in pixels relative to the chosen location.

options.title: programs.rtorrent.enable
options.note: Whether to enable rTorrent.

options.title: programs.rtorrent.extraConfig
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/rtorrent/rtorrent.rc. See
https://github.com/rakshasa/rtorrent/wiki/Config-Guide
for explanation about possible values.

options.title: programs.ruff.enable
options.note: Whether to enable ruff, an extremely fast Python linter and code formatter, written in Rust.

options.title: programs.ruff.package
options.note: The ruff package to use.

options.title: programs.ruff.settings
options.note:
Ruff configuration.
For available settings see https://docs.astral.sh/ruff/settings.
options.example: { line-length = 100; per-file-ignores = { "__init__.py" = [ "F401" ]; }; lint = { select = [ "E4" "E7" "E9" "F" ]; ignore = [ ]; }; }

options.title: programs.sagemath.enable
options.note: Whether to enable SageMath, a mathematics software system.

options.title: programs.sagemath.package
options.note: The SageMath package to use.

options.title: programs.sagemath.configDir
options.note:
Directory where the sage.init file will be stored.
Note that the upstream default is ~/.sage,
but our default is to follow XDG.

options.title: programs.sagemath.dataDir
options.note:
Location for DOT_SAGE.
Note that the upstream default is ~/.sage,
but our default is to follow XDG.

options.title: programs.sagemath.initScript
options.note: Contents of the init.sage file that is loaded on startup.

options.title: programs.sapling.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Sapling.

options.title: programs.sapling.package
options.note: The sapling package to use.

options.title: programs.sapling.aliases
options.note: Sapling aliases to define.

options.title: programs.sapling.extraConfig
