options.note: Additional configuration to add.

options.title: programs.sapling.userEmail
options.note: Default user email to use.

options.title: programs.sapling.userName
options.note: Default user name to use.

options.title: programs.sbt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sbt.

options.title: programs.sbt.package
options.note: The package with sbt to be installed.

options.title: programs.sbt.baseUserConfigPath
options.note:
Where the sbt configuration files should be located, relative
HOME.

options.title: programs.sbt.credentials
options.note: A list of credentials to define in the sbt configuration directory.
options.example: [{ realm = "Sonatype Nexus Repository Manager"; host = "example.com"; user = "user"; passwordCommand = "pass show sbt/user@example.com"; }]

options.title: programs.sbt.credentials.*.host
options.note: The hostname of the repository you’re authenticating to.

options.title: programs.sbt.credentials.*.passwordCommand
options.note:
The command that provides the password or authentication token for
the repository.

options.title: programs.sbt.credentials.*.realm
options.note: The realm of the repository you’re authenticating to.

options.title: programs.sbt.credentials.*.user
options.note: The user you’re using to authenticate.

options.title: programs.sbt.plugins
options.note: A list of plugins to place in the sbt configuration directory.
options.example: [ { org = "net.virtual-void"; artifact = "sbt-dependency-graph"; version = "0.10.0-RC1"; } { org = "com.dwijnand"; artifact = "sbt-project-graph"; version = "0.4.0"; } ]

options.title: programs.sbt.plugins.*.artifact
options.note: The name of the artifact.

options.title: programs.sbt.plugins.*.org
options.note: The organization the artifact is published under.

options.title: programs.sbt.plugins.*.version
options.note: The version of the plugin.

options.title: programs.sbt.repositories
options.note:
A list of repositories to use when resolving dependencies. Defined as a
list of pre-defined repository or custom repository as a set of name to
URL. The list will be used populate the ~/.sbt/repositories
file in the order specified.
options.type: list of (one of “local”, “maven-central”, “maven-local” or attribute set of string)
options.example: [ "local" { my-ivy-proxy-releases = "http://repo.company.com/ivy-releases/, [organization]/[module]/(scala_[scalaVersion]/)(sbt_[sbtVersion]/)[revision]/[type]s/[artifact](-[classifier]).[ext]" } { my-maven-proxy-releases = "http://repo.company.com/maven-releases/" } "maven-central" ]

options.title: programs.scmpuff.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable scmpuff, a command line tool that allows you to work quicker with Git by
substituting numeric shortcuts for files.

options.title: programs.scmpuff.enableAliases
options.note: Whether to enable aliases (e.g. gs, ga, gd, gco).

options.title: programs.scmpuff.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.scmpuff.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable fish integration.

options.title: programs.scmpuff.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.scmpuff.package
options.note: Package providing the scmpuff tool.

options.title: programs.script-directory.enable
options.note: Whether to enable script-directory.

options.title: programs.script-directory.package
options.note: The script-directory package to use.

options.title: programs.script-directory.settings
options.note: script-directory config, for options take a look at the documentation
options.example: { SD_ROOT = "${config.home.homeDirectory}/.sd"; SD_EDITOR = "nvim"; SD_CAT = "lolcat"; }

options.title: programs.senpai.enable
options.note: Whether to enable senpai.

options.title: programs.senpai.package
options.note: The senpai package to use.

options.title: programs.senpai.config
options.note:
Configuration for senpai. For a complete list of options, see
senpai(5).
options.example: { addr = "libera.chat:6697"; nick = "nicholas"; password = "verysecurepassword"; }

options.title: programs.senpai.config.addr
options.note:
The address (host[:port]) of the IRC server. senpai uses TLS
connections by default unless you specify no-tls option. TLS
connections default to port 6697, plain-text use port 6667.

options.title: programs.senpai.config.nick
options.note:
Your nickname, sent with a NICK IRC message. It mustn’t contain
spaces or colons (:).

options.title: programs.senpai.config.no-tls
options.note: Disables TLS encryption.

options.title: programs.senpai.config.password
options.note:
Your password, used for SASL authentication. Note that it will
reside world-readable in the Nix store.

options.title: programs.sftpman.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sftpman, an application that handles sshfs/sftp file systems mounting.

options.title: programs.sftpman.package
options.note: The sftpman package to use.

options.title: programs.sftpman.defaultSshKey
options.note: Path to the SSH key to be used by default. Can be overridden per host.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts
options.note:
The sshfs mount configurations written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/sftpman/mounts/.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.authType
options.note: The authentication method to use.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.beforeMount
options.note: Command to run before mounting.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.host
options.note: The host to connect to.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.mountOptions
options.note: Options to pass to sshfs.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.mountPoint
options.note: The remote path to mount.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.port
options.note: The port to connect to.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.sshKey
options.note:
Path to the SSH key to use for authentication.
Only applies if authMethod is publickey.

options.title: programs.sftpman.mounts.<name>.user
options.note: The username to authenticate with.

options.title: programs.sioyek.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Sioyek, a PDF viewer designed for reading research papers and technical books.

options.title: programs.sioyek.package
options.note: Package providing the sioyek binary

options.title: programs.sioyek.bindings
options.note:
Input configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/sioyek/keys_user.config.
See https://github.com/ahrm/sioyek/blob/main/pdf_viewer/keys.config.
options.type: attribute set of (string or list of string)
options.example: { "move_up" = "k"; "move_down" = "j"; "move_left" = "h"; "move_right" = "l"; "screen_down" = [ "d" "<C-d>" ]; "screen_up" = [ "u" "<C-u>" ]; }

options.title: programs.sioyek.config
options.note:
Input configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/sioyek/prefs_user.config.
See https://github.com/ahrm/sioyek/blob/main/pdf_viewer/prefs.config.
options.example: { "background_color" = "1.0 1.0 1.0"; "text_highlight_color" = "1.0 0.0 0.0"; }

options.title: programs.skim.enable
options.note: Whether to enable skim - a command-line fuzzy finder.

options.title: programs.skim.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.skim.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.skim.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.skim.package
options.note: Package providing the skim tool.

options.title: programs.skim.changeDirWidgetCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the source for skim for the
ALT-C keybinding.

options.title: programs.skim.changeDirWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the ALT-C keybinding.
options.example: [ "--preview 'tree -C {} | head -200'" ]

options.title: programs.skim.defaultCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the default source for skim
when running.

options.title: programs.skim.defaultOptions
options.note: Extra command line options given to skim by default.
options.example: [ "--height 40%" "--prompt ⟫" ]

options.title: programs.skim.fileWidgetCommand
options.note:
The command that gets executed as the source for skim for the
CTRL-T keybinding.

options.title: programs.skim.fileWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the CTRL-T keybinding.
options.example: [ "--preview 'head {}'" ]

options.title: programs.skim.historyWidgetOptions
options.note: Command line options for the CTRL-R keybinding.
options.example: [ "--tac" "--exact" ]

options.title: programs.sm64ex.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sm64ex.

options.title: programs.sm64ex.package
options.note: The sm64ex package to use.

options.title: programs.sm64ex.baserom
options.note: The path to the Super Mario 64 baserom to extract assets from.

options.title: programs.sm64ex.extraCompileFlags
options.note:
Extra flags to pass to the compiler. See
https://github.com/sm64pc/sm64ex/wiki/Build-options
for more information.
options.example: [ "BETTERCAMERA=1" "NODRAWINGDISTANCE=1" ];

options.title: programs.sm64ex.region
options.note: Your baserom’s region. Note that only “us”, “eu”, and “jp” are supported.

options.title: programs.sm64ex.settings
options.note: Settings for sm64ex’s $XDG_DATA_HOME/sm64pc/sm64config.txt file.
options.type: null or (attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or list of string))
options.example: { fullscreen = false; window_x = 0; window_y = 0; window_w = 1920; window_h = 1080; vsync = 1; texture_filtering = 1; master_volume = 127; music_volume = 127; sfx_volume = 127; env_volume = 127; key_a = [ "0026" "1000" "1103" ]; key_b = [ "0033" "1002" "1101" ]; key_start = [ "0039" "1006" "ffff" ]; key_l = [ "0034" "1007" "1104" ]; key_r = [ "0036" "100a" "1105" ]; key_z = [ "0025" "1009" "1102" ]; key_cup = [ "100b" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_cdown = [ "100c" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_cleft = [ "100d" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_cright = [ "100e" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_stickup = [ "0011" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_stickdown = [ "001f" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_stickleft = [ "001e" "ffff" "ffff" ]; key_stickright = [ "0020" "ffff" "ffff" ]; stick_deadzone = 16; rumble_strength = 10; skip_intro = 1; };

options.title: programs.sqls.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sqls, a SQL language server written in Go.

options.title: programs.sqls.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/sqls/config.yml. See
https://github.com/lighttiger2505/sqls#db-configuration
for supported values.
options.example: { lowercaseKeywords = true; connections = [ { driver = "mysql"; dataSourceName = "root:root@tcp(127.0.0.1:13306)/world"; } ]; }

options.title: programs.ssh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable SSH client configuration.

options.title: programs.ssh.package
options.note: The openssh package to use. By default, the client provided by your system is used.

options.title: programs.ssh.addKeysToAgent
options.note:
When enabled, a private key that is used during authentication will be
added to ssh-agent if it is running (with confirmation enabled if
set to ‘confirm’). The argument must be ‘no’ (the default), ‘yes’, ‘confirm’
(optionally followed by a time interval), ‘ask’ or a time interval (e.g. ‘1h’).

options.title: programs.ssh.compression
options.note: Specifies whether to use compression.

options.title: programs.ssh.controlMaster
options.note: Configure sharing of multiple sessions over a single network connection.

options.title: programs.ssh.controlPath
options.note: Specify path to the control socket used for connection sharing.

options.title: programs.ssh.controlPersist
options.note: Whether control socket should remain open in the background.

options.title: programs.ssh.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration.

options.title: programs.ssh.extraOptionOverrides
options.note:
Extra SSH configuration options that take precedence over any
host specific configuration.

options.title: programs.ssh.forwardAgent
options.note:
Whether the connection to the authentication agent (if any)
will be forwarded to the remote machine.

options.title: programs.ssh.hashKnownHosts
options.note:
Indicates that
ssh(1)
should hash host names and addresses when they are added to
the known hosts file.

options.title: programs.ssh.includes
options.note:
File globs of ssh config files that should be included via the
Include directive.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks
options.note:
Specify per-host settings. Note, if the order of rules matter
then use the DAG functions to express the dependencies as
shown in the example.
options.example: { "john.example.com" = { hostname = "example.com"; user = "john"; }; foo = lib.hm.dag.entryBefore ["john.example.com"] { hostname = "example.com"; identityFile = "/home/john/.ssh/foo_rsa"; }; };

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.addressFamily
options.note: Specifies which address family to use when connecting.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.certificateFile
options.note: Specifies files from which the user certificate is read.
options.type: (list of string) or null or string

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.checkHostIP
options.note:
Check the host IP address in the
known_hosts file.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.compression
options.note:
Specifies whether to use compression. Omitted from the host
block when null.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.dynamicForwards
options.note:
Specify dynamic port forwardings. See
ssh_config(5) for DynamicForward.
options.example: [ { port = 8080; } ];

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.dynamicForwards.*.address
options.note: The address where to bind the port.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.dynamicForwards.*.port
options.note: Specifies port number to bind on bind address.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.extraOptions
options.note: Extra configuration options for the host.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.forwardAgent
options.note:
Whether the connection to the authentication agent (if any)
will be forwarded to the remote machine.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.forwardX11
options.note:
Specifies whether X11 connections will be automatically redirected
over the secure channel and DISPLAY set.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.forwardX11Trusted
options.note:
Specifies whether remote X11 clients will have full access to the
original X11 display.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.host
options.note:
Host pattern used by this conditional block.
See
ssh_config(5)
for Host block details.
This option is ignored if
ssh.matchBlocks.*.match
if defined.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.hostname
options.note: Specifies the real host name to log into.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.identitiesOnly
options.note:
Specifies that ssh should only use the authentication
identity explicitly configured in the
~/.ssh/config files or passed on the
ssh command-line, even if ssh-agent
offers more identities.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.identityFile
options.note:
Specifies files from which the user identity is read.
Identities will be tried in the given order.
options.type: (list of string) or null or string

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.localForwards
options.note:
Specify local port forwardings. See
ssh_config(5) for LocalForward.
options.example: [ { bind.port = 8080; host.address = "10.0.0.13"; host.port = 80; } ];

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.localForwards.*.bind.address
options.note: The address where to bind the port.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.localForwards.*.bind.port
options.note: Specifies port number to bind on bind address.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.localForwards.*.host.address
options.note: The address where to forward the traffic to.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.localForwards.*.host.port
options.note: Specifies port number to forward the traffic to.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.match
options.note:
Match block conditions used by this block. See
ssh_config(5)
for Match block details.
This option takes precedence over
ssh.matchBlocks.*.host
if defined.
options.example: '' host <hostname> canonical host <hostname> exec "ping -c1 -q 192.168.17.1"''

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.port
options.note: Specifies port number to connect on remote host.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.proxyCommand
options.note: The command to use to connect to the server.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.proxyJump
options.note: The proxy host to use to connect to the server.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.remoteForwards
options.note:
Specify remote port forwardings. See
ssh_config(5) for RemoteForward.
options.example: [ { bind.port = 8080; host.address = "10.0.0.13"; host.port = 80; } ];

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.remoteForwards.*.bind.address
options.note: The address where to bind the port.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.remoteForwards.*.bind.port
options.note: Specifies port number to bind on bind address.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.remoteForwards.*.host.address
options.note: The address where to forward the traffic to.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.remoteForwards.*.host.port
options.note: Specifies port number to forward the traffic to.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.sendEnv
options.note:
Environment variables to send from the local host to the
server.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.serverAliveCountMax
options.note:
Sets the number of server alive messages which may be sent
without SSH receiving any messages back from the server.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.serverAliveInterval
options.note: Set timeout in seconds after which response will be requested.

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.setEnv
options.note: Environment variables and their value to send to the server.
options.type: attribute set of (string or path or signed integer or floating point number)

options.title: programs.ssh.matchBlocks.<name>.user
options.note: Specifies the user to log in as.

options.title: programs.ssh.serverAliveCountMax
options.note:
Sets the default number of server alive messages which may be
sent without SSH receiving any messages back from the server.

options.title: programs.ssh.serverAliveInterval
options.note: Set default timeout in seconds after which response will be requested.

options.title: programs.ssh.userKnownHostsFile
options.note:
Specifies one or more files to use for the user host key
database, separated by whitespace. The default is
~/.ssh/known_hosts.

options.title: programs.starship.enable
options.note: Whether to enable starship.

options.title: programs.starship.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.starship.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.starship.enableIonIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Ion integration.

options.title: programs.starship.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.starship.enableTransience
options.note:
The TransientPrompt feature of Starship replaces previous prompts with a
custom string. This is only a valid option for the Fish shell.

options.title: programs.starship.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.starship.package
options.note: The package to use for the starship binary.

options.title: programs.starship.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/starship.toml.
options.example: { add_newline = false; format = lib.concatStrings [ "$line_break" "$package" "$line_break" "$character" ]; scan_timeout = 10; character = { success_symbol = "➜"; error_symbol = "➜"; }; }

options.title: programs.swaylock.enable
options.note: Whether to enable swaylock.

options.title: programs.swaylock.package
options.note: The swaylock package to use.

options.title: programs.swaylock.settings
options.note:
Default arguments to swaylock. An empty set
disables configuration generation.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or floating point number or signed integer or string)
options.example: { color = "808080"; font-size = 24; indicator-idle-visible = false; indicator-radius = 100; line-color = "ffffff"; show-failed-attempts = true; }

options.title: programs.swayr.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the swayr service.

options.title: programs.swayr.package
options.note: swayr package to use.

options.title: programs.swayr.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to append to the swayr
configuration file.

options.title: programs.swayr.settings
options.note:
Configuration included in config.toml.
For available options see https://git.sr.ht/~tsdh/swayr#swayr-configuration
options.example: menu = { executable = "${pkgs.wofi}/bin/wofi"; args = [ "--show=dmenu" "--allow-markup" "--allow-images" "--insensitive" "--cache-file=/dev/null" "--parse-search" "--height=40%" "--prompt={prompt}" ]; }; format = { output_format = "{indent}<b>Output {name}</b> <span alpha=\"20000\">({id})</span>"; workspace_format = "{indent}<b>Workspace {name} [{layout}]</b> on output {output_name} <span alpha=\"20000\">({id})</span>"; container_format = "{indent}<b>Container [{layout}]</b> <i>{marks}</i> on workspace {workspace_name} <span alpha=\"20000\">({id})</span>"; window_format = "img:{app_icon}:text:{indent}<i>{app_name}</i> — {urgency_start}<b>“{title}”</b>{urgency_end} <i>{marks}</i> on workspace {workspace_name} / {output_name} <span alpha=\"20000\">({id})</span>"; indent = " "; urgency_start = "<span background=\"darkred\" foreground=\"yellow\">"; urgency_end = "</span>"; html_escape = true; }; layout = { auto_tile = false; auto_tile_min_window_width_per_output_width = [ [ 800 400 ] [ 1024 500 ] [ 1280 600 ] [ 1400 680 ] [ 1440 700 ] [ 1600 780 ] [ 1680 780 ] [ 1920 920 ] [ 2048 980 ] [ 2560 1000 ] [ 3440 1200 ] [ 3840 1280 ] [ 4096 1400 ] [ 4480 1600 ] [ 7680 2400 ] ]; }; focus = { lockin_delay = 750; }; misc = { seq_inhibit = false; };

options.title: programs.swayr.systemd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable swayr systemd integration.

options.title: programs.swayr.systemd.target
options.note: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Task Warrior.

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.package
options.note: The taskwarrior package to use.

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.colorTheme
options.note:
Either one of the default provided theme as string, or a
path to a theme configuration file.

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.config
options.note:
Key-value configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/task/taskrc.
options.example: { confirmation = false; report.minimal.filter = "status:pending"; report.active.columns = [ "id" "start" "entry.age" "priority" "project" "due" "description" ]; report.active.labels = [ "ID" "Started" "Age" "Priority" "Project" "Due" "Description" ]; taskd = { certificate = "/path/to/cert"; key = "/path/to/key"; ca = "/path/to/ca"; server = "host.domain:53589"; credentials = "Org/First Last/cf31f287-ee9e-43a8-843e-e8bbd5de4294"; }; }

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.dataLocation
options.note: Location where Task Warrior will store its data.

options.title: programs.taskwarrior.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional content written at the end of
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/task/taskrc.

options.title: programs.tealdeer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Tealdeer.

options.title: programs.tealdeer.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/tealdeer/config.toml on Linux or
$HOME/Library/Application Support/tealdeer/config.toml
on Darwin. See
https://dbrgn.github.io/tealdeer/config.html
for more information.
options.example: { display = { compact = false; use_pager = true; }; updates = { auto_update = false; }; };

options.title: programs.tealdeer.updateOnActivation
options.note: Whether to update tealdeer’s cache on activation.

options.title: programs.terminator.enable
options.note: Whether to enable terminator, a tiling terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.terminator.package
options.note: terminator package to install.

options.title: programs.terminator.config
options.note: configuration for terminator.
options.example: { global_config.borderless = true; profiles.default.background_color = "#002b36"; }

options.title: programs.termite.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Termite VTE-based terminal.

options.title: programs.termite.enableVteIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Shell VTE integration.

options.title: programs.termite.allowBold
options.note: Allow the output of bold characters when the bold escape sequence appears.

options.title: programs.termite.audibleBell
options.note: Have the terminal beep on the terminal bell.

options.title: programs.termite.backgroundColor
options.note: Background color value.

options.title: programs.termite.browser
options.note:
Set the default browser for opening links. If its not set, $BROWSER is read.
If that’s not set, url hints will be disabled.

options.title: programs.termite.clickableUrl
options.note:
Auto-detected URLs can be clicked on to open them in  your browser.
Only enabled if a browser is configured or detected.

options.title: programs.termite.colorsExtra
options.note: Extra colors options that should be added to [colors] section.
options.example: '' color0 = #3f3f3f color1 = #705050 color2 = #60b48a ''

options.title: programs.termite.cursorBlink
options.note:
Specify the how the terminal’s cursor should behave.
Accepts system to respect the gtk global configuration,
on and off to explicitly enable or disable them.

options.title: programs.termite.cursorColor
options.note: Cursor color value.

options.title: programs.termite.cursorForegroundColor
options.note: Cursor foreground color value.

options.title: programs.termite.cursorShape
options.note: Specify how the cursor should look. Accepts block, ibeam and underline.

options.title: programs.termite.dynamicTitle
options.note:
Settings dynamic title allows the terminal and the shell to
update the terminal’s title.

options.title: programs.termite.filterUnmatchedUrls
options.note: Whether to hide url hints not matching input in url hints mode.

options.title: programs.termite.font
options.note: The font description for the terminal’s font.

options.title: programs.termite.foregroundBoldColor
options.note: Foreground bold color value.

options.title: programs.termite.foregroundColor
options.note: Foreground color value.

options.title: programs.termite.fullscreen
options.note: Enables entering fullscreen mode by pressing F11.

options.title: programs.termite.geometry
options.note: The default window geometry for new terminal windows.

options.title: programs.termite.highlightColor
options.note: highlight color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsActiveBackgroundColor
options.note: Hints active background color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsActiveForegroundColor
options.note: Hints active foreground color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsBackgroundColor
options.note: Hints background color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsBorderColor
options.note: Hints border color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsBorderWidth
options.note: Hints border width.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsExtra
options.note: Extra hints options that should be added to [hints] section.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsFont
options.note: The font description for the hints font.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsForegroundColor
options.note: Hints foreground color value.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsPadding
options.note: Hints padding.

options.title: programs.termite.hintsRoundness
options.note: Hints roundness.

options.title: programs.termite.iconName
options.note: The name of the icon to be used for the terminal process.

options.title: programs.termite.modifyOtherKeys
options.note:
Emit escape sequences for extra keys,
like the modifyOtherKeys resource for
xterm(1).

options.title: programs.termite.mouseAutohide
options.note: Automatically hide the mouse pointer when you start typing.

options.title: programs.termite.optionsExtra
options.note: Extra options that should be added to [options] section.

options.title: programs.termite.scrollOnKeystroke
options.note: Scroll to the bottom automatically when a key is pressed.

options.title: programs.termite.scrollOnOutput
options.note: Scroll to the bottom when the shell generates output.

options.title: programs.termite.scrollbackLines
options.note: Set the number of lines to limit the terminal’s scrollback.

options.title: programs.termite.scrollbar
options.note: Scrollbar position.

options.title: programs.termite.searchWrap
options.note: Search from top again when you hit the bottom.

options.title: programs.termite.sizeHints
options.note:
Enable size hints. Locks the terminal resizing
to increments of the terminal’s cell size.
Requires a window manager that respects scroll hints.

options.title: programs.termite.urgentOnBell
options.note: Sets the window as urgent on the terminal bell.

options.title: programs.texlive.enable
options.note: Whether to enable TeX Live.

options.title: programs.texlive.package
options.note: Resulting customized TeX Live package.

options.title: programs.texlive.packageSet
options.note: TeX Live package set to use.

options.title: programs.texlive.extraPackages
options.note: Extra packages available to TeX Live.
options.example: tpkgs: { inherit (tpkgs) collection-fontsrecommended algorithms; }

options.title: programs.thefuck.enable
options.note: Whether to enable thefuck - magnificent app that corrects your previous console command.

options.title: programs.thefuck.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.thefuck.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.thefuck.enableInstantMode
options.note: Whether to enable thefuck’s experimental instant mode.

options.title: programs.thefuck.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.thefuck.package
options.note: The thefuck package to use.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Thunderbird.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.package
options.note: The Thunderbird package to use.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles
options.note: Attribute set of Thunderbird profiles.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.extraConfig
options.note: Extra preferences to add to user.js.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.isDefault
options.note:
Whether this is a default profile. There must be exactly one
default profile.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.name
options.note: This profile’s name.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.settings
options.note:
Preferences to add to this profile’s
user.js.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { "mail.spellcheck.inline" = false; }

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.userChrome
options.note: Custom Thunderbird user chrome CSS.
options.example: '' /* Hide tab bar in Thunderbird */ #tabs-toolbar { visibility: collapse !important; } ''

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.userContent
options.note: Custom Thunderbird user content CSS.
options.example: '' /* Hide scrollbar on Thunderbird pages */ *{scrollbar-width:none !important} ''

options.title: programs.thunderbird.profiles.<name>.withExternalGnupg
options.note: Allow using external GPG keys with GPGME.

options.title: programs.thunderbird.settings
options.note:
Attribute set of Thunderbird preferences to be added to
all profiles.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { "general.useragent.override" = ""; "privacy.donottrackheader.enabled" = true; }

options.title: programs.timidity.enable
options.note: Whether to enable timidity, a software MIDI renderer.

options.title: programs.timidity.package
options.note: The timidity package to use.

options.title: programs.timidity.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration.
options.example: '' soundfont ${pkgs.soundfont-fluid}/share/soundfonts/FluidR3_GM2-2.sf2 ''

options.title: programs.timidity.finalPackage
options.note: Resulting package.

options.title: programs.tint2.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tint2, a simple, unobtrusive and light panel for Xorg.

options.title: programs.tint2.package
options.note: Tint2 package to install.

options.title: programs.tint2.extraConfig
options.note:
Commands for tint2 that will be add to the tint2rc
file.

options.title: programs.tiny.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tiny, a TUI IRC client written in Rust.

options.title: programs.tiny.package
options.note: The tiny package to install.

options.title: programs.tiny.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/tiny/config.yml. See
https://github.com/osa1/tiny/blob/master/crates/tiny/config.yml
for the default configuration.
options.example: { servers = [ { addr = "irc.libera.chat"; port = 6697; tls = true; realname = "John Doe"; nicks = [ "tinyuser" ]; } ]; defaults = { nicks = [ "tinyuser" ]; realname = "John Doe"; join = []; tls = true; }; };

options.title: programs.tmate.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tmate.

options.title: programs.tmate.package
options.note: The tmate package to install.

options.title: programs.tmate.dsaFingerprint
options.note: Tmate server EdDSA key fingerprint.

options.title: programs.tmate.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional content written at the end of
~/.tmate.conf.

options.title: programs.tmate.host
options.note: Tmate server address.

options.title: programs.tmate.port
options.note: Tmate server port.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.tmate.rsaFingerprint
options.note: Tmate server RSA key fingerprint.

options.title: programs.tmux.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tmux.

options.title: programs.tmux.package
options.note: The tmux package to install

options.title: programs.tmux.aggressiveResize
options.note:
Resize the window to the size of the smallest session for
which it is the current window.

options.title: programs.tmux.baseIndex
options.note: Base index for windows and panes.

options.title: programs.tmux.clock24
options.note: Use 24 hour clock.

options.title: programs.tmux.customPaneNavigationAndResize
options.note:
Override the hjkl and HJKL bindings for pane navigation and
resizing in VI mode.

options.title: programs.tmux.disableConfirmationPrompt
options.note: Disable confirmation prompt before killing a pane or window

options.title: programs.tmux.escapeTime
options.note:
Time in milliseconds for which tmux waits after an escape is
input.

options.title: programs.tmux.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional configuration to add to
tmux.conf.

options.title: programs.tmux.historyLimit
options.note: Maximum number of lines held in window history.

options.title: programs.tmux.keyMode
options.note: VI or Emacs style shortcuts.

options.title: programs.tmux.mouse
options.note: Whether to enable mouse support.

options.title: programs.tmux.newSession
options.note:
Automatically spawn a session if trying to attach and none
are running.

options.title: programs.tmux.plugins
options.note:
List of tmux plugins to be included at the end of your tmux
configuration. The sensible plugin, however, is defaulted to
run at the top of your configuration.
options.type: list of plugin packages or submodules
options.example: with pkgs; [ tmuxPlugins.cpu { plugin = tmuxPlugins.resurrect; extraConfig = "set -g @resurrect-strategy-nvim 'session'"; } { plugin = tmuxPlugins.continuum; extraConfig = '' set -g @continuum-restore 'on' set -g @continuum-save-interval '60' # minutes ''; } ]

options.title: programs.tmux.prefix
options.note: Set the prefix key. Overrules the “shortcut” option when set.

options.title: programs.tmux.resizeAmount
options.note: Number of lines/columns when resizing.

options.title: programs.tmux.reverseSplit
options.note: Reverse the window split shortcuts.

options.title: programs.tmux.secureSocket
options.note:
Store tmux socket under /run, which is more
secure than /tmp, but as a downside it doesn’t
survive user logout.

options.title: programs.tmux.sensibleOnTop
options.note:
Run the sensible plugin at the top of the configuration. It
is possible to override the sensible settings using the
programs.tmux.extraConfig option.

options.title: programs.tmux.shell
options.note: Set the default-shell tmux variable.

options.title: programs.tmux.shortcut
options.note: CTRL following by this key is used as the main shortcut.

options.title: programs.tmux.terminal
options.note: Set the $TERM variable.

options.title: programs.tmux.tmuxinator.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tmuxinator.

options.title: programs.tmux.tmuxp.enable
options.note: Whether to enable tmuxp.

options.title: programs.topgrade.enable
options.note: Whether to enable topgrade.

options.title: programs.topgrade.package
options.note: The package to use for the topgrade binary.

options.title: programs.topgrade.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/topgrade.toml.
options.example: { assume_yes = true; disable = [ "flutter" "node" ]; set_title = false; cleanup = true; commands = { "Run garbage collection on Nix store" = "nix-collect-garbage"; }; }

options.title: programs.translate-shell.enable
options.note: Whether to enable translate-shell.

options.title: programs.translate-shell.settings
options.note:
Options to add to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/translate-shell/init.trans file.
See https://github.com/soimort/translate-shell/wiki/Configuration
for options.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or string or list of string)
options.example: { hl = "en"; tl = [ "es" "fr" ]; verbose = true; }

options.title: programs.urxvt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable rxvt-unicode terminal emulator.

options.title: programs.urxvt.package
options.note: rxvt-unicode package to install.

options.title: programs.urxvt.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add.
options.example: { shading = 15; }

options.title: programs.urxvt.fonts
options.note: List of fonts to be used.
options.example: [ "xft:Droid Sans Mono Nerd Font:size=9" ]

options.title: programs.urxvt.iso14755
options.note: ISO14755 support for viewing and entering unicode characters.

options.title: programs.urxvt.keybindings
options.note: Mapping of keybindings to actions
options.example: { "Shift-Control-C" = "eval:selection_to_clipboard"; "Shift-Control-V" = "eval:paste_clipboard"; }

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar
options.note: Scrollbar settings.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the scrollbar

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar.align
options.note: Scrollbar alignment.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar.floating
options.note: Whether to display an rxvt scrollbar without a trough.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar.position
options.note: Scrollbar position.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.bar.style
options.note: Scrollbar style.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.keepPosition
options.note: Whether to keep a scroll position when TTY receives new lines.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.lines
options.note: Number of lines to save in the scrollback buffer.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.scrollOnKeystroke
options.note: Whether to scroll to bottom on keyboard input.

options.title: programs.urxvt.scroll.scrollOnOutput
options.note: Whether to scroll to bottom on TTY output.

options.title: programs.urxvt.shading
options.note: Darken (0 to 99) or lighten (101 to 200) the transparent background.

options.title: programs.urxvt.transparent
options.note: Whether to enable pseudo-transparency.

options.title: programs.vdirsyncer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable vdirsyncer.

options.title: programs.vdirsyncer.package
options.note: vdirsyncer package to use.

options.title: programs.vdirsyncer.statusPath
options.note: A directory where vdirsyncer will store some additional data for the next sync.

options.title: programs.vim.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Vim.

options.title: programs.vim.package
options.note: Resulting customized vim package

options.title: programs.vim.packageConfigurable
options.note: Vim package to customize

options.title: programs.vim.defaultEditor
options.note:
Whether to configure vim as the default
editor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: programs.vim.extraConfig
options.note: Custom .vimrc lines
options.example: '' set nocompatible set nobackup ''

options.title: programs.vim.plugins
options.note:
List of vim plugins to install. To get a list of supported plugins run:
nix-env -f '<nixpkgs>' -qaP -A vimPlugins.

options.title: programs.vim.settings
options.note:
At attribute set of Vim settings. The attribute names and
corresponding values must be among the following supported
options.
options.example: { expandtab = true; history = 1000; background = "dark"; }

options.title: programs.vim-vint.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Vint linter for Vimscript.

options.title: programs.vim-vint.package
options.note: The vim-vint package to use.

options.title: programs.vim-vint.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/.vintrc.yaml

options.title: programs.vscode.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Visual Studio Code.

options.title: programs.vscode.enableExtensionUpdateCheck
options.note: Whether to enable update notifications for extensions.

options.title: programs.vscode.enableUpdateCheck
options.note: Whether to enable update checks/notifications.

options.title: programs.vscode.package
options.note: Version of Visual Studio Code to install.

options.title: programs.vscode.extensions
options.note: The extensions Visual Studio Code should be started with.

options.title: programs.vscode.globalSnippets
options.note: Defines global user snippets.
options.example: { fixme = { body = [ "$LINE_COMMENT FIXME: $0" ]; description = "Insert a FIXME remark"; prefix = [ "fixme" ]; }; }

options.title: programs.vscode.haskell.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Haskell integration for Visual Studio Code.

options.title: programs.vscode.haskell.hie.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Haskell IDE engine integration.

options.title: programs.vscode.haskell.hie.executablePath
options.note: The path to the Haskell IDE Engine executable.
options.example: (import ~/src/haskell-ide-engine {}).hies + "/bin/hie-wrapper";

options.title: programs.vscode.keybindings
options.note:
Keybindings written to Visual Studio Code’s
keybindings.json.
options.example: [ { key = "ctrl+c"; command = "editor.action.clipboardCopyAction"; when = "textInputFocus"; } ]

options.title: programs.vscode.keybindings.*.args
options.note: Optional arguments for a command.
options.example: { direction = "up"; }

options.title: programs.vscode.keybindings.*.command
options.note: The VS Code command to execute.

options.title: programs.vscode.keybindings.*.key
options.note: The key or key-combination to bind.

options.title: programs.vscode.keybindings.*.when
options.note: Optional context filter.

options.title: programs.vscode.languageSnippets
options.note: Defines user snippets for different languages.
options.example: { haskell = { fixme = { body = [ "$LINE_COMMENT FIXME: $0" ]; description = "Insert a FIXME remark"; prefix = [ "fixme" ]; }; }; }

options.title: programs.vscode.mutableExtensionsDir
options.note:
Whether extensions can be installed or updated manually
or by Visual Studio Code.

options.title: programs.vscode.userSettings
options.note:
Configuration written to Visual Studio Code’s
settings.json.
options.example: { "files.autoSave" = "off"; "[nix]"."editor.tabSize" = 2; }

options.title: programs.vscode.userTasks
options.note:
Configuration written to Visual Studio Code’s
tasks.json.
options.example: { version = "2.0.0"; tasks = [ { type = "shell"; label = "Hello task"; command = "hello"; } ]; }

options.title: programs.watson.enable
options.note: Whether to enable watson, a wonderful CLI to track your time.

options.title: programs.watson.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable watson’s bash integration.

options.title: programs.watson.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable watson’s fish integration.

options.title: programs.watson.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable watson’s zsh integration.

options.title: programs.watson.package
options.note: Package providing the watson.

options.title: programs.watson.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/watson/config on Linux or
$HOME/Library/Application Support/watson/config on Darwin.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { backend = { url = "https://api.crick.fr"; token = "yourapitoken"; }; options = { stop_on_start = true; stop_on_restart = false; date_format = "%Y.%m.%d"; time_format = "%H:%M:%S%z"; week_start = "monday"; log_current = false; pager = true; report_current = false; reverse_log = true; }; }

options.title: programs.waybar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Waybar.

options.title: programs.waybar.package
options.note: Waybar package to use. Set to null to use the default package.

options.title: programs.waybar.settings
options.note:
Configuration for Waybar, see https://github.com/Alexays/Waybar/wiki/Configuration
for supported values.
options.type: (list of (JSON value)) or attribute set of (JSON value)
options.example: { mainBar = { layer = "top"; position = "top"; height = 30; output = [ "eDP-1" "HDMI-A-1" ]; modules-left = [ "sway/workspaces" "sway/mode" "wlr/taskbar" ]; modules-center = [ "sway/window" "custom/hello-from-waybar" ]; modules-right = [ "mpd" "custom/mymodule#with-css-id" "temperature" ]; "sway/workspaces" = { disable-scroll = true; all-outputs = true; }; "custom/hello-from-waybar" = { format = "hello {}"; max-length = 40; interval = "once"; exec = pkgs.writeShellScript "hello-from-waybar" '' echo "from within waybar" ''; }; }; }

options.title: programs.waybar.style
options.note: CSS style of the bar.
options.type: null or path or strings concatenated with “\n”
options.example: '' * { border: none; border-radius: 0; font-family: Source Code Pro; } window#waybar { background: #16191C; color: #AAB2BF; } #workspaces button { padding: 0 5px; } ''

options.title: programs.waybar.systemd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Waybar systemd integration.

options.title: programs.waybar.systemd.target
options.note: The systemd target that will automatically start the Waybar service.

options.title: programs.wezterm.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wezterm.

options.title: programs.wezterm.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable WezTerm’s Bash integration.

options.title: programs.wezterm.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable WezTerm’s Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.wezterm.package
options.note: The Wezterm package to install.

options.title: programs.wezterm.colorSchemes
options.note:
Attribute set of additional color schemes to be written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/wezterm/colors, where each key is
taken as the name of the corresponding color scheme. See
https://wezfurlong.org/wezterm/config/appearance.html#defining-a-color-scheme-in-a-separate-file
for more details of the TOML color scheme format.
options.example: myCoolTheme = { ansi = [ "#222222" "#D14949" "#48874F" "#AFA75A" "#599797" "#8F6089" "#5C9FA8" "#8C8C8C" ]; brights = [ "#444444" "#FF6D6D" "#89FF95" "#FFF484" "#97DDFF" "#FDAAF2" "#85F5DA" "#E9E9E9" ]; background = "#1B1B1B"; cursor_bg = "#BEAF8A"; cursor_border = "#BEAF8A"; cursor_fg = "#1B1B1B"; foreground = "#BEAF8A"; selection_bg = "#444444"; selection_fg = "#E9E9E9"; };

options.title: programs.wezterm.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/wezterm/wezterm.lua. See
https://wezfurlong.org/wezterm/config/files.html
how to configure.
options.example: -- Your lua code / config here local mylib = require 'mylib'; return { usemylib = mylib.do_fun(); font = wezterm.font("JetBrains Mono"), font_size = 16.0, color_scheme = "Tomorrow Night", hide_tab_bar_if_only_one_tab = true, default_prog = { "zsh", "--login", "-c", "tmux attach -t dev || tmux new -s dev" }, keys = { {key="n", mods="SHIFT|CTRL", action="ToggleFullScreen"}, } }

options.title: programs.wlogout.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wlogout.

options.title: programs.wlogout.package
options.note: The wlogout package to use.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout
options.note:
Layout configuration for wlogout, see https://github.com/ArtsyMacaw/wlogout#config
for supported values.
options.example: [ { label = "shutdown"; action = "systemctl poweroff"; text = "Shutdown"; keybind = "s"; } ]

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.action
options.note: Command to execute when clicked.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.circular
options.note: Make button circular.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.height
options.note: Relative height of tile.
options.type: null or integer or floating point number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.keybind
options.note: Keyboard character to trigger this action.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.label
options.note: CSS label of button.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.text
options.note: Text displayed on button.

options.title: programs.wlogout.layout.*.width
options.note: Relative width of tile.
options.type: null or integer or floating point number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: programs.wlogout.style
options.note: CSS style of the bar.
options.example: '' window { background: #16191C; } button { color: #AAB2BF; } ''

options.title: programs.wofi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wofi: a launcher/menu program for wlroots based wayland compositors such as sway.

options.title: programs.wofi.package
options.note: The wofi package to use.

options.title: programs.wofi.settings
options.note:
Configuration options for wofi. See
wofi(5).
options.example: { location = "bottom-right"; allow_markup = true; width = 250; }

options.title: programs.wofi.style
options.note:
CSS style for wofi to use as a stylesheet. See
wofi(7).
options.example: '' * { font-family: monospace; } window { background-color: #7c818c; } ''

options.title: programs.wpaperd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wpaperd.

options.title: programs.wpaperd.package
options.note: The wpaperd package to use.

options.title: programs.wpaperd.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/wpaperd/wallpaper.toml.
See https://github.com/danyspin97/wpaperd#wallpaper-configuration
for the full list of options.
options.example: { eDP-1 = { path = "/home/foo/Pictures/Wallpaper"; apply-shadow = true; }; DP-2 = { path = "/home/foo/Pictures/Anime"; sorting = "descending"; }; }

options.title: programs.xmobar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Xmobar, a minimalistic status bar.

options.title: programs.xmobar.package
options.note: Package providing the xmobar binary.

options.title: programs.xmobar.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/xmobar/.xmobarrc.
See
https://xmobar.org/#configuration
for options.
options.example: Config { font = "Fira Code" , borderColor = "#d0d0d0" , border = FullB , borderWidth = 3 , bgColor = "#222" , fgColor = "grey" , position = TopSize C 99 30 , commands = [ Run Cpu ["-t", "cpu: <fc=#4eb4fa><bar> <total>%</fc>"] 10 , Run Network "enp3s0" ["-S", "True", "-t", "eth: <fc=#4eb4fa><rx></fc>/<fc=#4eb4fa><tx></fc>"] 10 , Run Memory ["-t","mem: <fc=#4eb4fa><usedbar> <usedratio>%</fc>"] 10 , Run Date "date: <fc=#4eb4fa>%a %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S </fc>" "date" 10 , Run StdinReader ] , sepChar = "%" , alignSep = "}{" , template = " %StdinReader% | %cpu% | %memory% | %enp3s0% }{%date% " }

options.title: programs.xplr.enable
options.note: Whether to enable xplr, terminal UI based file explorer.

options.title: programs.xplr.package
options.note: The xplr package to use.

options.title: programs.xplr.extraConfig
options.note: Extra xplr configuration.
options.example: require("wl-clipboard").setup { copy_command = "wl-copy -t text/uri-list", paste_command = "wl-paste", keep_selection = true, }

options.title: programs.xplr.plugins
options.note: An attribute set of plugin paths to be added to the [package.path]https://www.lua.org/manual/5.4/manual.html#pdf-package.path of the ~/config/xplr/init.lua configuration file.
options.type: null or (attribute set of (package or string))
options.example: { wl-clipboard = fetchFromGitHub { owner = "sayanarijit"; repo = "wl-clipboard.xplr"; rev = "a3ffc87460c5c7f560bffea689487ae14b36d9c3"; hash = "sha256-I4rh5Zks9hiXozBiPDuRdHwW5I7ppzEpQNtirY0Lcks="; } local-plugin = "/home/user/.config/plugins/local-plugin"; };

options.title: programs.yazi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable yazi.

options.title: programs.yazi.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.yazi.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.yazi.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.yazi.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.yazi.package
options.note: Yazi package to install.

options.title: programs.yazi.keymap
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/yazi/keymap.toml.
options.example: { input.keymap = [ { exec = "close"; on = [ "<C-q>" ]; } { exec = "close --submit"; on = [ "<Enter>" ]; } { exec = "escape"; on = [ "<Esc>" ]; } { exec = "backspace"; on = [ "<Backspace>" ]; } ]; manager.keymap = [ { exec = "escape"; on = [ "<Esc>" ]; } { exec = "quit"; on = [ "q" ]; } { exec = "close"; on = [ "<C-q>" ]; } ]; }

options.title: programs.yazi.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/yazi/yazi.toml.
options.example: { log = { enabled = false; }; manager = { show_hidden = false; sort_by = "modified"; sort_dir_first = true; sort_reverse = true; }; }

options.title: programs.yazi.theme
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/yazi/theme.toml.
options.example: { filetype = { rules = [ { fg = "#7AD9E5"; mime = "image/*"; } { fg = "#F3D398"; mime = "video/*"; } { fg = "#F3D398"; mime = "audio/*"; } { fg = "#CD9EFC"; mime = "application/x-bzip"; } ]; }; }

options.title: programs.yt-dlp.enable
options.note: Whether to enable yt-dlp.

options.title: programs.yt-dlp.package
options.note: Package providing the yt-dlp tool.

options.title: programs.yt-dlp.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration to add to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/yt-dlp/config.
options.example: '' --update -F ''

options.title: programs.yt-dlp.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/yt-dlp/config.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { embed-thumbnail = true; embed-subs = true; sub-langs = "all"; downloader = "aria2c"; downloader-args = "aria2c:'-c -x8 -s8 -k1M'"; }

options.title: programs.z-lua.enable
options.note: Whether to enable z.lua.

options.title: programs.z-lua.enableAliases
options.note: Whether to enable recommended z.lua aliases.

options.title: programs.z-lua.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.z-lua.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.z-lua.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.z-lua.options
options.note: List of options to pass to z.lua.
options.example: [ "enhanced" "once" "fzf" ]

options.title: programs.zathura.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Zathura, a highly customizable and functional document viewer
focused on keyboard interaction.

options.title: programs.zathura.package
options.note: The Zathura package to use

options.title: programs.zathura.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional commands for zathura that will be added to the
zathurarc file.

options.title: programs.zathura.mappings
options.note:
Add :map mappings to zathura and make
them permanent. See
zathurarc(5)
for the full list of possible mappings.
options.example: { "<Right>" = "navigate next"; D = "toggle_page_mode"; "[fullscreen] <C-i>" = "zoom in"; }

options.title: programs.zathura.options
options.note:
Add :set command options to zathura and make
them permanent. See
zathurarc(5)
for the full list of options.
options.type: attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer)
options.example: { default-bg = "#000000"; default-fg = "#FFFFFF"; }

options.title: programs.zellij.enable
options.note: Whether to enable zellij.

options.title: programs.zellij.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.zellij.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.zellij.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.zellij.package
options.note: The zellij package to install.

options.title: programs.zellij.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/zellij/config.yaml.
options.example: { theme = "custom"; themes.custom.fg = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: programs.zoxide.enable
options.note: Whether to enable zoxide.

options.title: programs.zoxide.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: programs.zoxide.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: programs.zoxide.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: programs.zoxide.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: programs.zoxide.package
options.note: Zoxide package to install.

options.title: programs.zoxide.options
options.note: List of options to pass to zoxide.
options.example: [ "--no-aliases" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Z shell (Zsh).

options.title: programs.zsh.enableAutosuggestions
options.note: Enable zsh autosuggestions

options.title: programs.zsh.enableCompletion
options.note: Enable zsh completion. Don’t forget to add

options.title: programs.zsh.enableVteIntegration
options.note:
Whether to enable integration with terminals using the VTE
library. This will let the terminal track the current working
directory.

options.title: programs.zsh.package
options.note: The zsh package to use.

options.title: programs.zsh.antidote.enable
options.note: Whether to enable antidote - a zsh plugin manager.

options.title: programs.zsh.antidote.package
options.note: The antidote package to use.

options.title: programs.zsh.antidote.plugins
options.note: List of antidote plugins.
options.example: [ "zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.antidote.useFriendlyNames
options.note: Whether to enable friendly names.

options.title: programs.zsh.autocd
options.note: Automatically enter into a directory if typed directly into shell.

options.title: programs.zsh.cdpath
options.note: List of paths to autocomplete calls to cd.

options.title: programs.zsh.completionInit
options.note: Initialization commands to run when completion is enabled.

options.title: programs.zsh.defaultKeymap
options.note: The default base keymap to use.

options.title: programs.zsh.dirHashes
options.note: An attribute set that adds to named directory hash table.
options.example: { docs = "$HOME/Documents"; vids = "$HOME/Videos"; dl = "$HOME/Downloads"; }

options.title: programs.zsh.dotDir
options.note:
Directory where the zsh configuration and more should be located,
relative to the users home directory. The default is the home
directory.

options.title: programs.zsh.envExtra
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zshenv.

options.title: programs.zsh.history
options.note: Options related to commands history configuration.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.expireDuplicatesFirst
options.note: Expire duplicates first.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.extended
options.note: Save timestamp into the history file.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.ignoreAllDups
options.note:
If a new command line being added to the history list
duplicates an older one, the older command is removed
from the list (even if it is not the previous event).

options.title: programs.zsh.history.ignoreDups
options.note:
Do not enter command lines into the history list
if they are duplicates of the previous event.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.ignorePatterns
options.note:
Do not enter command lines into the history list
if they match any one of the given shell patterns.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.ignoreSpace
options.note:
Do not enter command lines into the history list
if the first character is a space.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.path
options.note: History file location

options.title: programs.zsh.history.save
options.note: Number of history lines to save.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.share
options.note: Share command history between zsh sessions.

options.title: programs.zsh.history.size
options.note: Number of history lines to keep.

options.title: programs.zsh.historySubstringSearch
options.note: Options related to zsh-history-substring-search.

options.title: programs.zsh.historySubstringSearch.enable
options.note: Whether to enable history substring search.

options.title: programs.zsh.historySubstringSearch.searchDownKey
options.note:
The key codes to be used when searching down.
The default of ^[[B may correspond to the DOWN key – if not, try
$terminfo[kcud1].

options.title: programs.zsh.historySubstringSearch.searchUpKey
options.note:
The key codes to be used when searching up.
The default of ^[[A may correspond to the UP key – if not, try
$terminfo[kcuu1].

options.title: programs.zsh.initExtra
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zshrc.

options.title: programs.zsh.initExtraBeforeCompInit
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zshrc before compinit.

options.title: programs.zsh.initExtraFirst
options.note: Commands that should be added to top of .zshrc.

options.title: programs.zsh.localVariables
options.note: Extra local variables defined at the top of .zshrc.
options.example: { POWERLEVEL9K_LEFT_PROMPT_ELEMENTS = [ "dir" "vcs" ]; }

options.title: programs.zsh.loginExtra
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zlogin.

options.title: programs.zsh.logoutExtra
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zlogout.

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh
options.note: Options to configure oh-my-zsh.

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.enable
options.note: Whether to enable oh-my-zsh.

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.package
options.note: The oh-my-zsh package to use.

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.custom
options.note:
Path to a custom oh-my-zsh package to override config of
oh-my-zsh. See https://github.com/robbyrussell/oh-my-zsh/wiki/Customization
for more information.

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.extraConfig
options.note: Extra settings for plugins.
options.example: '' zstyle :omz:plugins:ssh-agent identities id_rsa id_rsa2 id_github ''

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.plugins
options.note: List of oh-my-zsh plugins
options.example: [ "git" "sudo" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.oh-my-zsh.theme
options.note: Name of the theme to be used by oh-my-zsh.

options.title: programs.zsh.plugins
options.note: Plugins to source in .zshrc.
options.example: [ { # will source zsh-autosuggestions.plugin.zsh name = "zsh-autosuggestions"; src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "zsh-users"; repo = "zsh-autosuggestions"; rev = "v0.4.0"; sha256 = "0z6i9wjjklb4lvr7zjhbphibsyx51psv50gm07mbb0kj9058j6kc"; }; } { name = "enhancd"; file = "init.sh"; src = pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "b4b4r07"; repo = "enhancd"; rev = "v2.2.1"; sha256 = "0iqa9j09fwm6nj5rpip87x3hnvbbz9w9ajgm6wkrd5fls8fn8i5g"; }; } ]

options.title: programs.zsh.plugins.*.file
options.note: The plugin script to source.

options.title: programs.zsh.plugins.*.name
options.note: The name of the plugin.

options.title: programs.zsh.plugins.*.src
options.note: Path to the plugin folder.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto
options.note: Options to configure prezto.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.enable
options.note: Whether to enable prezto.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.autosuggestions.color
options.note: Set the query found color.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.caseSensitive
options.note: Set case-sensitivity for completion, history lookup, etc.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.color
options.note: Color output (automatically set to false on dumb terminals).

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.completions.ignoredHosts
options.note:
Set the entries to ignore in static /etc/hosts for
host completion.
options.example: [ "0.0.0.0" "127.0.0.1" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.editor.dotExpansion
options.note: Automatically convert .... to ../..

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.editor.keymap
options.note: Set the key mapping style to emacs or vi.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.editor.promptContext
options.note: Allow the Zsh prompt context to be shown.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add to .zpreztorc.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.extraFunctions
options.note: Set the Zsh functions to load (zshcontrib(1)).
options.example: [ "zargs" "zmv" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.extraModules
options.note: Set the Zsh modules to load (zshmodules(1)).
options.example: [ "attr" "stat" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.git.submoduleIgnore
options.note:
Ignore submodules when they are dirty, untracked, all,
or none.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.gnuUtility.prefix
options.note: Set the command prefix on non-GNU systems.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.historySubstring.foundColor
options.note: Set the query found color.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.historySubstring.globbingFlags
options.note: Set the search globbing flags.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.historySubstring.notFoundColor
options.note: Set the query not found color.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.macOS.dashKeyword
options.note:
Set the keyword used by mand to open man pages
in Dash.app.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.pmoduleDirs
options.note: Add additional directories to load prezto modules from.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.pmodules
options.note: Set the Prezto modules to load (browse modules). The order matters.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.prompt.pwdLength
options.note:
Set the working directory prompt display length. By
default, it is set to short. Set it to long (without ~
expansion) for longer or full (with ~ expansion) for
even longer prompt display.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.prompt.showReturnVal
options.note:
Set the prompt to display the return code along with an
indicator for non-zero return codes. This is not supported by all prompts.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.prompt.theme
options.note:
Set the prompt theme to load. Setting it to random
loads a random theme. Automatically set to off on dumb
terminals.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.python.virtualenvAutoSwitch
options.note: Auto switch to Python virtualenv on directory change.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.python.virtualenvInitialize
options.note: Automatically initialize virtualenvwrapper if pre-requisites are met.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.ruby.chrubyAutoSwitch
options.note: Auto switch the Ruby version on directory change.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.screen.autoStartLocal
options.note: Auto start a session when Zsh is launched in a local terminal.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.screen.autoStartRemote
options.note: Auto start a session when Zsh is launched in a SSH connection.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.ssh.identities
options.note: Set the SSH identities to load into the agent.
options.example: [ "id_rsa" "id_rsa2" "id_github" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.syntaxHighlighting.highlighters
options.note:
Set syntax highlighters. By default, only the main
highlighter is enabled.
options.example: [ "main" "brackets" "pattern" "line" "cursor" "root" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.syntaxHighlighting.pattern
options.note: Set syntax pattern styles.
options.example: { "rm*-rf*" = "fg=white,bold,bg=red"; }

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.syntaxHighlighting.styles
options.note: Set syntax highlighting styles.
options.example: { builtin = "bg=blue"; command = "bg=blue"; function = "bg=blue"; }

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.terminal.autoTitle
options.note: Auto set the tab and window titles.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.terminal.multiplexerTitleFormat
options.note: Set the multiplexer title format.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.terminal.tabTitleFormat
options.note: Set the tab title format.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.terminal.windowTitleFormat
options.note: Set the window title format.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.tmux.autoStartLocal
options.note: Auto start a session when Zsh is launched in a local terminal.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.tmux.autoStartRemote
options.note: Auto start a session when Zsh is launched in a SSH connection.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.tmux.defaultSessionName
options.note: Set the default session name.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.tmux.itermIntegration
options.note: Integrate with iTerm2.

options.title: programs.zsh.prezto.utility.safeOps
options.note:
Enabled safe options. This aliases cp,
ln, mv and rm so that they
prompt before deleting or overwriting files. Set to no to
disable this safer behavior.

options.title: programs.zsh.profileExtra
options.note: Extra commands that should be added to .zprofile.

options.title: programs.zsh.sessionVariables
options.note: Environment variables that will be set for zsh session.
options.example: { MAILCHECK = 30; }

options.title: programs.zsh.shellAliases
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names in
this option) to command strings or directly to build outputs.
options.example: { ll = "ls -l"; ".." = "cd .."; }

options.title: programs.zsh.shellGlobalAliases
options.note:
Similar to programs.zsh.shellAliases,
but are substituted anywhere on a line.
options.example: { UUID = "$(uuidgen | tr -d \\n)"; G = "| grep"; }

options.title: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting
options.note: Options related to zsh-syntax-highlighting.

options.title: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.enable
options.note: Whether to enable zsh syntax highlighting.

options.title: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.package
options.note: The zsh-syntax-highlighting package to use.

options.title: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.highlighters
options.note:
Highlighters to enable
See the list of highlighters: https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting/blob/master/docs/highlighters.md
options.example: [ "brackets" ]

options.title: programs.zsh.syntaxHighlighting.styles
options.note:
Custom styles for syntax highlighting.
See each highlighter’s options: https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting/blob/master/docs/highlighters.md
options.example: { comment = "fg=black,bold"; }

options.title: programs.zsh.zplug.enable
options.note: Whether to enable zplug - a zsh plugin manager.

options.title: programs.zsh.zplug.plugins
options.note: List of zplug plugins.

options.title: programs.zsh.zplug.plugins.*.name
options.note: The name of the plugin.

options.title: programs.zsh.zplug.plugins.*.tags
options.note: The plugin tags.

options.title: programs.zsh.zplug.zplugHome
options.note: Path to zplug home directory.

options.title: programs.zsh.zprof.enable
options.note: Enable zprof in your zshrc.

options.title: programs.zsh.zsh-abbr.enable
options.note: Whether to enable zsh-abbr - zsh manager for auto-expanding abbreviations.

options.title: programs.zsh.zsh-abbr.abbreviations
options.note:
An attribute set that maps aliases (the top level attribute names
in this option) to abbreviations. Abbreviations are expanded with
the longer phrase after they are entered.
options.example: { gco = "git checkout"; l = "less"; }

options.title: qt.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Qt 5 and 6 configuration.

options.title: qt.platformTheme
options.note: Platform theme to use for Qt applications.

options.description: Use GTK3 integration for file picker dialogs, font and theme configuration
Use LXQt theme style set using the lxqt-config-appearance application
Use Qt style set using qt5ct and qt6ct applications

options.title: qt.style.package
options.note:
Theme package to be used in Qt5/Qt6 applications.
Auto-detected from qt.style.name if possible.
options.type: null or package or list of package

options.title: qt.style.name
options.note: Style to use for Qt5/Qt6 applications. Case-insensitive.

options.description: Use the Adwaita style from adwaita-qt
Use the Breeze style from breeze

options.title: services.arrpc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable arrpc.

options.title: services.arrpc.package
options.note: The arrpc package to use.

options.title: services.arrpc.systemdTarget
options.note: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: services.autorandr.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable the Autorandr systemd service.
This module is complementary to programs.autorandr
which handles the configuration (profiles).

options.title: services.autorandr.ignoreLid
options.note: Treat outputs as connected even if their lids are closed.

options.title: services.avizo.enable
options.note: Whether to enable avizo, a simple notification daemon.

options.title: services.avizo.package
options.note: The avizo package to use.
options.example: pkgs.avizo.overrideAttrs (final: prev: { patchPhase = "cp ${./images}/*.png data/images/"; })

options.title: services.avizo.settings
options.note: The settings that will be written to the avizo configuration file.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { default = { time = 1.0; y-offset = 0.5; fade-in = 0.1; fade-out = 0.2; padding = 10; }; }

options.title: services.barrier.client.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Barrier Client daemon.

options.title: services.barrier.client.enableCrypto
options.note: Whether to enable crypto (SSL) plugin.

options.title: services.barrier.client.enableDragDrop
options.note: Whether to enable file drag & drop.

options.title: services.barrier.client.extraFlags
options.note:
Additional flags to pass to barrierc.
See barrierc --help.

options.title: services.barrier.client.name
options.note: Screen name of client. Defaults to hostname.

options.title: services.barrier.client.server
options.note:
Server to connect to formatted as
<host>[:<port>].
Port defaults to 24800.

options.title: services.batsignal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Batsignal Battery Daemon.

options.title: services.batsignal.package
options.note: The batsignal package to use.

options.title: services.batsignal.extraArgs
options.note: Extra arguments to be passed to the batsignal executable.

options.title: services.betterlockscreen.enable
options.note: Whether to enable betterlockscreen, a screen-locker module.

options.title: services.betterlockscreen.package
options.note: Package providing betterlockscreen.

options.title: services.betterlockscreen.arguments
options.note: List of arguments appended to ./betterlockscreen --lock [args]

options.title: services.betterlockscreen.inactiveInterval
options.note: Value used for services.screen-locker.inactiveInterval.

options.title: services.blueman-applet.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Blueman applet.

options.title: services.borgmatic.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Borgmatic service.

options.title: services.borgmatic.frequency
options.note:
How often to run borgmatic when
services.borgmatic.enable = true.
This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as
the onCalendar option. See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Cachix Deploy Agent: https://docs.cachix.org/deploy/.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.package
options.note: The cachix package to use.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.credentialsFile
options.note:
Required file that needs to contain
CACHIX_AGENT_TOKEN=....

options.title: services.cachix-agent.host
options.note: Cachix URI to use.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.name
options.note: The unique agent name.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.profile
options.note: The Nix profile name.

options.title: services.cachix-agent.verbose
options.note: Whether to enable verbose output.

options.title: services.caffeine.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Caffeine service.

options.title: services.cbatticon.enable
options.note: Whether to enable cbatticon.

options.title: services.cbatticon.batteryId
options.note:
ID of the battery to monitor. List with cbatticon -p.
Defaults to the first entry in the list.

options.title: services.cbatticon.commandCriticalLevel
options.note: Command to execute when the critical battery level is reached.
options.example: '' notify-send "battery critical!" ''

options.title: services.cbatticon.commandLeftClick
options.note: Command to execute when left clicking on the tray icon.

options.title: services.cbatticon.criticalLevelPercent
options.note:
Critical level percentage of the battery in percent (without
the percent symbol).
options.type: null or integer between 0 and 100 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.cbatticon.hideNotification
options.note: Hide the notification popups.

options.title: services.cbatticon.iconType
options.note: Icon type to display in the system tray.

options.title: services.cbatticon.lowLevelPercent
options.note:
Low level percentage of the battery in percent (without the
percent symbol).
options.type: null or integer between 0 and 100 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.cbatticon.updateIntervalSeconds
options.note: Number of seconds between updates of the battery information.

options.title: services.cliphist.enable
options.note: Whether to enable cliphist, a clipboard history “manager” for wayland.

options.title: services.cliphist.package
options.note: The cliphist package to use.

options.title: services.cliphist.systemdTarget
options.note: The systemd target that will automatically start the cliphist service.

options.title: services.clipman.enable
