options.note: Whether to enable clipman, a simple clipboard manager for Wayland.

options.title: services.clipman.package
options.note: The clipman package to use.

options.title: services.clipman.systemdTarget
options.note: The systemd target that will automatically start the clipman service.

options.title: services.clipmenu.enable
options.note: Whether to enable clipmenu, the clipboard management daemon.

options.title: services.clipmenu.package
options.note: clipmenu derivation to use.

options.title: services.clipmenu.launcher
options.note:
Launcher command, if not set, dmenu
will be used by default.

options.title: services.comodoro.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Comodoro server.

options.title: services.comodoro.package
options.note: The comodoro package to use.

options.title: services.comodoro.environment
options.note: Extra environment variables to be exported in the service.
options.example: { "PASSWORD_STORE_DIR" = "~/.password-store"; }

options.title: services.comodoro.preset
options.note: Use configuration from the given preset as defined in the configuration file.

options.title: services.comodoro.protocols
options.note: Define protocols the server should use to accept requests.

options.title: services.copyq.enable
options.note: Whether to enable CopyQ, a clipboard manager with advanced features.

options.title: services.copyq.package
options.note: The copyq package to use.

options.title: services.copyq.systemdTarget
options.note: The systemd target that will automatically start the CopyQ service.

options.title: services.darkman.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable darkman, a tool that automatically switches dark-mode on and off based on
the time of the day.

options.title: services.darkman.package
options.note: The darkman package to use.

options.title: services.darkman.darkModeScripts
options.note: Scripts to run when switching to “dark mode”.
options.type: attribute set of (path or strings concatenated with “\n”)
options.example: { gtk-theme = '' ${pkgs.dconf}/bin/dconf write \ /org/gnome/desktop/interface/color-scheme "'prefer-dark'" ''; my-python-script = pkgs.writers.writePython3 "my-python-script" { } '' print('Do something!') ''; }

options.title: services.darkman.lightModeScripts
options.note: Scripts to run when switching to “light mode”.
options.type: attribute set of (path or strings concatenated with “\n”)
options.example: { gtk-theme = '' ${pkgs.dconf}/bin/dconf write \ /org/gnome/desktop/interface/color-scheme "'prefer-light'" ''; my-python-script = pkgs.writers.writePython3 "my-python-script" { } '' print('Do something!') ''; }

options.title: services.darkman.settings
options.note:
Settings for the darkman command. See
https://darkman.whynothugo.nl/#CONFIGURATION for details.
options.example: { lat = 52.3; lng = 4.8; usegeoclue = true; }

options.title: services.devilspie2.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Devilspie2, a window matching utility, allowing the user to
perform scripted actions on windows as they are created.

options.title: services.devilspie2.config
options.note: Content of file placed in the devilspie2 config directory.
options.example: '' if (get_window_class() == "Gnome-terminal") then make_always_on_top(); end ''

options.title: services.dropbox.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Dropbox daemon.

options.title: services.dropbox.path
options.note: Where to put the Dropbox directory.

options.title: services.dunst.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the dunst notification daemon.

options.title: services.dunst.package
options.note: Package providing dunst.

options.title: services.dunst.configFile
options.note: Path to the configuration file read by dunst.

options.title: services.dunst.iconTheme
options.note: Set the icon theme.

options.title: services.dunst.iconTheme.package
options.note: Package providing the theme.

options.title: services.dunst.iconTheme.name
options.note: The name of the theme within the package.

options.title: services.dunst.iconTheme.size
options.note: The desired icon size.

options.title: services.dunst.settings
options.note: Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/dunst/dunstrc.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)
options.example: { global = { width = 300; height = 300; offset = "30x50"; origin = "top-right"; transparency = 10; frame_color = "#eceff1"; font = "Droid Sans 9"; }; urgency_normal = { background = "#37474f"; foreground = "#eceff1"; timeout = 10; }; };

options.title: services.dunst.settings.global.icon_path
options.note: Paths where dunst will look for icons.

options.title: services.dunst.waylandDisplay
options.note: Set the service’s WAYLAND_DISPLAY environment variable.

options.title: services.dwm-status.enable
options.note: Whether to enable dwm-status user service.

options.title: services.dwm-status.package
options.note: Which dwm-status package to use.

options.title: services.dwm-status.extraConfig
options.note: Extra config of dwm-status.
options.example: { separator = "#"; battery = { notifier_levels = [ 2 5 10 15 20 ]; }; time = { format = "%H:%M"; }; }

options.title: services.dwm-status.order
options.note: List of enabled features in order.

options.title: services.easyeffects.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Easyeffects daemon.
Note, it is necessary to add

options.title: services.easyeffects.package
options.note: The easyeffects package to use.

options.title: services.easyeffects.preset
options.note:
Which preset to use when starting easyeffects.
Will likely need to launch easyeffects to initially create preset.

options.title: services.emacs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Emacs daemon.

options.title: services.emacs.package
options.note: The Emacs package to use.

options.title: services.emacs.client.enable
options.note: Whether to enable generation of Emacs client desktop file.

options.title: services.emacs.client.arguments
options.note: Command-line arguments to pass to emacsclient.

options.title: services.emacs.defaultEditor
options.note:
Whether to configure emacsclient as the default
editor using the EDITOR environment variable.

options.title: services.emacs.extraOptions
options.note: Extra command-line arguments to pass to emacs.
options.example: [ "-f" "exwm-enable" ]

options.title: services.emacs.socketActivation.enable
options.note: Whether to enable systemd socket activation for the Emacs service.

options.title: services.emacs.startWithUserSession
options.note:
Whether to launch Emacs service with the systemd user session. If it is
true, Emacs service is started by
default.target. If it is
"graphical", Emacs service is started by
graphical-session.target.

options.title: services.espanso.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Espanso: cross platform text expander in Rust.

options.title: services.espanso.package
options.note: Which espanso package to use

options.title: services.espanso.configs
options.note:
The Espanso configuration to use. See
https://espanso.org/docs/configuration/basics/
for a description of available options.
options.example: { default = { show_notifications = false; }; vscode = { filter_title = "Visual Studio Code$"; backend = "Clipboard"; }; };

options.title: services.espanso.matches
options.note:
The Espanso matches to use. See
https://espanso.org/docs/matches/basics/
for a description of available options.
options.example: { base = { matches = [ { trigger = ":now"; replace = "It's {{currentdate}} {{currenttime}}"; } { trigger = ":hello"; replace = "line1\nline2"; } { regex = ":hi(?P<person>.*)\\."; replace = "Hi {{person}}!"; } ]; }; global_vars = { global_vars = [ { name = "currentdate"; type = "date"; params = {format = "%d/%m/%Y";}; } { name = "currenttime"; type = "date"; params = {format = "%R";}; } ]; }; };

options.title: services.etesync-dav.enable
options.note: Whether to enable etesync-dav.

options.title: services.etesync-dav.package
options.note: The etesync-dav derivation to use.

options.title: services.etesync-dav.serverUrl
options.note: The URL to the etesync server.

options.title: services.etesync-dav.settings
options.note: Settings for etesync-dav, passed as environment variables.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer)
options.example: { ETESYNC_LISTEN_ADDRESS = "localhost"; ETESYNC_LISTEN_PORT = 37358; }

options.title: services.flameshot.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Flameshot.

options.title: services.flameshot.package
options.note: Package providing flameshot.

options.title: services.flameshot.settings
options.note:
Configuration to use for Flameshot. See
https://github.com/flameshot-org/flameshot/blob/master/flameshot.example.ini
for available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { General = { disabledTrayIcon = true; showStartupLaunchMessage = false; }; }

options.title: services.fluidsynth.enable
options.note: Whether to enable fluidsynth midi synthesizer.

options.title: services.fluidsynth.extraOptions
options.note:
Extra arguments, added verbatim to the fluidsynth command. See
fluidsynth.conf(1).
options.example: [ "--sample-rate 96000" ]

options.title: services.fluidsynth.soundFont
options.note: The soundfont file to use, in SoundFont 2 format.

options.title: services.fluidsynth.soundService
options.note: The systemd sound service to depend on.

options.title: services.fnott.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable fnott, a lightweight Wayland notification daemon for wlroots-based compositors
.

options.title: services.fnott.package
options.note: Package providing fnott.

options.title: services.fnott.configFile
options.note: Path to the configuration file read by fnott.

options.title: services.fnott.extraFlags
options.note: Extra arguments to use for executing fnott.
options.example: [ "-s" ]

options.title: services.fnott.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/fnott/fnott.ini.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { main = { notification-margin = 5; }; low = { timeout = 5; title-font = "Dina:weight=bold:slant=italic"; title-color = "ffffff"; }; }

options.title: services.fusuma.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the fusuma systemd service to automatically enable touchpad gesture.

options.title: services.fusuma.package
options.note: Package providing fusuma.

options.title: services.fusuma.extraPackages
options.note: Extra packages needs to bring to the scope of fusuma service.
options.example: with pkgs; [ coreutils xdotool ];

options.title: services.fusuma.settings
options.note: YAML config that will override the default fusuma configuration.
options.example: { threshold = { swipe = 0.1; }; interval = { swipe = 0.7; }; swipe = { "3" = { left = { # GNOME: Switch to left workspace command = "xdotool key ctrl+alt+Right"; }; }; }; };

options.title: services.gammastep.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Gammastep.

options.title: services.gammastep.enableVerboseLogging
options.note: Whether to enable verbose service logging.

options.title: services.gammastep.package
options.note: Gammastep derivation to use.

options.title: services.gammastep.dawnTime
options.note:
Set the time interval of dawn manually.
The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.gammastep.duskTime
options.note:
Set the time interval of dusk manually.
The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.gammastep.latitude
options.note:
Your current latitude, between -90.0 and
90.0. Must be provided along with
longitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.gammastep.longitude
options.note:
Your current longitude, between -180.0 and
180.0. Must be provided along with
latitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.gammastep.provider
options.note:
The location provider to use for determining your location. If set to
manual you must also provide latitude/longitude.
If set to geoclue2, you must also enable the global
geoclue2 service.

options.title: services.gammastep.settings
options.note:
The configuration to pass to Gammastep.
Available options for Gammastep described in
gammastep(1).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { general = { adjustment-method = "randr"; }; randr = { screen = 0; }; };

options.title: services.gammastep.temperature.day
options.note:
Colour temperature to use during the day, between
1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.gammastep.temperature.night
options.note:
Colour temperature to use at night, between
1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.gammastep.tray
options.note: Start the gammastep-indicator tray applet.

options.title: services.getmail.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the getmail systemd service to automatically retrieve mail.

options.title: services.getmail.frequency
options.note:
The refresh frequency. Check man systemd.time for
more information on the syntax. If you use a gpg-agent in
combination with the passwordCommand, keep the poll
frequency below the cache-ttl value (as set by the
default) to avoid pinentry asking
permanently for a password.

options.title: services.git-sync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable git-sync services.

options.title: services.git-sync.package
options.note: Package containing the git-sync program.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories
options.note: The repositories that should be synchronized.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.interval
options.note:
The interval, specified in seconds, at which the synchronization will
be triggered even without filesystem changes.

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.path
options.note: The path at which to sync the repository

options.title: services.git-sync.repositories.<name>.uri
options.note:
The URI of the remote to be synchronized. This is only used in the
event that the directory does not already exist. See
https://git-scm.com/docs/git-clone#_git_urls
for the supported URIs.

options.title: services.gnome-keyring.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GNOME Keyring.

options.title: services.gnome-keyring.components
options.note:
The GNOME keyring components to start. If empty then the
default set of components will be started.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enable
options.note: Whether to enable GnuPG private key agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableBashIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Bash integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableExtraSocket
options.note:
Whether to enable extra socket of the GnuPG key agent (useful for GPG
Agent forwarding).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableFishIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Fish integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableNushellIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Nushell integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableScDaemon
options.note:
Make use of the scdaemon tool. This option has the effect of
enabling the ability to do smartcard operations. When
disabled, this option passes
disable-scdaemon setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableSshSupport
options.note: Whether to use the GnuPG key agent for SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.enableZshIntegration
options.note: Whether to enable Zsh integration.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtl
options.note:
Set the time a cache entry is valid to the given number of
seconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.defaultCacheTtlSsh
options.note:
Set the time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to the
given number of seconds.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to append to the gpg-agent
configuration file.
options.example: '' allow-emacs-pinentry allow-loopback-pinentry ''

options.title: services.gpg-agent.grabKeyboardAndMouse
options.note:
Tell the pinentry to grab the keyboard and mouse. This
option should in general be used to avoid X-sniffing
attacks. When disabled, this option passes
no-grab setting to gpg-agent.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtl
options.note:
Set the maximum time a cache entry is valid to n seconds. After this
time a cache entry will be expired even if it has been accessed
recently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase. The default is
2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.maxCacheTtlSsh
options.note:
Set the maximum time a cache entry used for SSH keys is valid to n
seconds. After this time a cache entry will be expired even if it has
been accessed recently or has been set using gpg-preset-passphrase.
The default is 2 hours (7200 seconds).

options.title: services.gpg-agent.pinentryFlavor
options.note:
Which pinentry interface to use. If not
null, it sets
pinentry-program in
gpg-agent.conf. Beware that
pinentry-gnome3 may not work on non-Gnome
systems. You can fix it by adding the following to your
system configuration:

options.title: services.gpg-agent.sshKeys
options.note: Which GPG keys (by keygrip) to expose as SSH keys.

options.title: services.gpg-agent.verbose
options.note: Whether to produce verbose output.

options.title: services.grobi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the grobi display setup daemon.

options.title: services.grobi.executeAfter
options.note:
Commands to be run after an output configuration was
changed. The Nix value declared here will be translated to
JSON and written to the execute_after key
in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.
options.example: [ "setxkbmap dvorak" ]

options.title: services.grobi.rules
options.note:
These are the rules grobi tries to match to the current
output configuration. The rules are evaluated top to bottom,
the first matching rule is applied and processing stops. See
https://github.com/fd0/grobi/blob/master/doc/grobi.conf
for more information. The Nix value declared here will be
translated to JSON and written to the rules
key in $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/grobi.conf.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)
options.example: [ { name = "Home"; outputs_connected = [ "DP-2" ]; configure_single = "DP-2"; primary = true; atomic = true; execute_after = [ "${pkgs.xorg.xrandr}/bin/xrandr --dpi 96" "${pkgs.xmonad-with-packages}/bin/xmonad --restart"; ]; } { name = "Mobile"; outputs_disconnected = [ "DP-2" ]; configure_single = "eDP-1"; primary = true; atomic = true; execute_after = [ "${pkgs.xorg.xrandr}/bin/xrandr --dpi 120" "${pkgs.xmonad-with-packages}/bin/xmonad --restart"; ]; } ]

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Gromit-MPX annotation tool.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.package
options.note: The gromit-mpx package to use.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.hotKey
options.note:
A keysym or raw keycode that toggles the activation state of
gromit-mpx.  Set to null to disable the
hotkey in which case you’ll have to activate gromit-mpx
manually using the command line.
options.type: null or string or (positive integer, meaning >0)

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.opacity
options.note: Opacity of the drawing overlay.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools
options.note: Tool definitions for gromit-mpx to use.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.arrowSize
options.note:
If not null, automatically draw an arrow
at the end of a stroke with the given size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.color
options.note: The stroke (or recolor) color of the tool.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.device
options.note:
Use this tool with the given xinput device.  The device with
the name default works with any input.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.modifiers
options.note: Only activate this tool if the given modifiers are also active.
options.example: [ "SHIFT" ]

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.size
options.note: The tool size.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.tools.*.type
options.note: Which type of tool this is.

options.title: services.gromit-mpx.undoKey
options.note:
A keysym or raw keycode that causes gromit-mpx to undo the
last stroke.  Use this key along with the shift key to redo an
undone stoke.  Set to null to disable the
undo hotkey.
options.type: null or string or (positive integer, meaning >0)

options.title: services.himalaya-watch.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the email client Himalaya CLI envelopes watcher service.

options.title: services.himalaya-watch.environment
options.note: Extra environment variables to be exported in the service.
options.example: { "PASSWORD_STORE_DIR" = "~/.password-store"; }

options.title: services.himalaya-watch.settings.account
options.note:
Name of the account the watcher should be started for.
If no account is given, the default one is used.

options.title: services.home-manager.autoUpgrade.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable the Home Manager upgrade service that periodically updates your Nix
channels before running home-manager switch.

options.title: services.home-manager.autoUpgrade.frequency
options.note:
The interval at which the Home Manager auto upgrade is run.
This value is passed to the systemd timer configuration
as the OnCalendar option.
The format is described in
systemd.time(7).

options.title: services.hound.enable
options.note: Whether to enable hound.

options.title: services.hound.databasePath
options.note: The Hound database path.

options.title: services.hound.listenAddress
options.note: Listen address of the Hound daemon.

options.title: services.hound.maxConcurrentIndexers
options.note: Limit the amount of concurrent indexers.

options.title: services.hound.repositories
options.note: The repository configuration.
options.example: { SomeGitRepo = { url = "https://www.github.com/YourOrganization/RepoOne.git"; ms-between-poll = 10000; exclude-dot-files = true; }; }

options.title: services.imapnotify.enable
options.note: Whether to enable imapnotify.

options.title: services.imapnotify.package
options.note: The imapnotify package to use

options.title: services.kanshi.enable
options.note: Whether to enable kanshi, a Wayland daemon that automatically configures outputs.

options.title: services.kanshi.package
options.note: kanshi derivation to use.

options.title: services.kanshi.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to append to the kanshi
configuration file.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles
options.note: List of profiles.
options.example: undocked = { outputs = [ { criteria = "eDP-1"; } ]; }; docked = { outputs = [ { criteria = "eDP-1"; } { criteria = "Some Company ASDF 4242"; transform = "90"; } ]; };

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.exec
options.note:
Commands executed after the profile is successfully applied.
Note that if you provide multiple commands, they will be
executed asynchronously with no guaranteed ordering.
options.type: (list of string) or string convertible to it

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs
options.note: Outputs configuration.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.adaptiveSync
options.note:
Enables or disables adaptive synchronization
(aka. Variable Refresh Rate).

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.criteria
options.note:
The criteria can either be an output name, an output description or “*”.
The latter can be used to match any output.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.mode
options.note: <width>x<height>[@<rate>[Hz]]

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.scale
options.note: Scales the output by the specified scale factor.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.status
options.note: Enables or disables the specified output.

options.title: services.kanshi.profiles.<name>.outputs.*.transform
options.note: Sets the output transform.

options.title: services.kanshi.systemdTarget
options.note: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: services.kbfs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Keybase File System.

options.title: services.kbfs.extraFlags
options.note: Additional flags to pass to the Keybase filesystem on launch.
options.example: [ "-label kbfs" "-mount-type normal" ]

options.title: services.kbfs.mountPoint
options.note:
Mount point for the Keybase filesystem, relative to
HOME.

options.title: services.kdeconnect.enable
options.note: Whether to enable KDE connect.

options.title: services.kdeconnect.indicator
options.note: Whether to enable kdeconnect-indicator service.

options.title: services.keybase.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Keybase.

options.title: services.keynav.enable
options.note: Whether to enable keynav.

options.title: services.lieer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lieer Gmail synchronization service.

options.title: services.listenbrainz-mpd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable listenbrainz-mpd.

options.title: services.listenbrainz-mpd.package
options.note: The listenbrainz-mpd package to use.

options.title: services.listenbrainz-mpd.settings
options.note:
Configuration for listenbrainz-mpd written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/listenbrainz-mpd/config.toml.
options.example: { submission = { tokenFile = "/run/secrets/listenbrainz-mpd"; }; }

options.title: services.lorri.enable
options.note: Whether to enable lorri build daemon.

options.title: services.lorri.enableNotifications
options.note: Whether to enable lorri build notifications.

options.title: services.lorri.package
options.note: Which lorri package to install.

options.title: services.lorri.nixPackage
options.note: Which nix package to use.

options.title: services.mako.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Mako, lightweight notification daemon for Wayland
.

options.title: services.mako.package
options.note: The mako package to use.

options.title: services.mako.actions
options.note:
Applications may request an action to be associated with activating a
notification. Disabling this will cause mako to ignore these requests.

options.title: services.mako.anchor
options.note:
Show notifications at the specified position on the output.
Supported values are top-right, top-center, top-left, bottom-right,
bottom-center, bottom-left, and center.

options.title: services.mako.backgroundColor
options.note:
Set popup background color to a specific color, represented in hex
color code.

options.title: services.mako.borderColor
options.note:
Set popup border color to a specific color, represented in hex color
code.

options.title: services.mako.borderRadius
options.note: Set popup corner radius to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.borderSize
options.note: Set popup border size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.defaultTimeout
options.note:
Set the default timeout to timeout in milliseconds. To disable the
timeout, set it to zero.

options.title: services.mako.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration.
options.example: [urgency=low] border-color=#b8bb26

options.title: services.mako.font
options.note: Font to use, in Pango format.

options.title: services.mako.format
options.note:
Set notification format string to format. See FORMAT SPECIFIERS for
more information. To change this for grouped notifications, set it
within a grouped criteria.

options.title: services.mako.groupBy
options.note:
A comma-separated list of criteria fields that will be compared to
other visible notifications to determine if this one should form a
group with them. All listed criteria must be exactly equal for two
notifications to group.

options.title: services.mako.height
options.note:
Set maximum height of notification popups. Notifications whose text
takes up less space are shrunk to fit.

options.title: services.mako.iconPath
options.note:
Paths to search for icons when a notification specifies a name
instead of a full path. Colon-delimited. This approximates the search
algorithm used by the XDG Icon Theme Specification, but does not
support any of the theme metadata. Therefore, if you want to search
parent themes, you’ll need to add them to the path manually.

options.title: services.mako.icons
options.note: Whether or not to show icons in notifications.

options.title: services.mako.ignoreTimeout
options.note:
If set, mako will ignore the expire timeout sent by notifications
and use the one provided by default-timeout instead.

options.title: services.mako.layer
options.note:
Arrange mako at the specified layer, relative to normal windows.
Supported values are background, bottom, top, and overlay. Using
overlay will cause notifications to be displayed above fullscreen
windows, though this may also occur at top depending on your
compositor.

options.title: services.mako.margin
options.note:
Set margin of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to
apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set
vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will
give each edge a separate value.
For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20
and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.markup
options.note:
If 1, enable Pango markup. If 0, disable Pango markup. If enabled,
Pango markup will be interpreted in your format specifier and in the
body of notifications.

options.title: services.mako.maxIconSize
options.note: Set maximum icon size to the specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mako.maxVisible
options.note: Set maximum number of visible notifications. Set -1 to show all.

options.title: services.mako.output
options.note:
Show notifications on the specified output. If empty, notifications
will appear on the focused output. Requires the compositor to support
the Wayland protocol xdg-output-unstable-v1 version 2.

options.title: services.mako.padding
options.note:
Set padding of each edge specified in pixels. Specify single value to
apply margin on all sides. Two comma-separated values will set
vertical and horizontal edges separately. Four comma-separated will
give each edge a separate value.
For example: 10,20,5 will set top margin to 10, left and right to 20
and bottom to five.

options.title: services.mako.progressColor
options.note:
Set popup progress indicator color to a specific color,
represented in hex color code. To draw the progress
indicator on top of the background color, use the
over attribute. To replace the background
color, use the source attribute (this can
be useful when the notification is semi-transparent).

options.title: services.mako.sort
options.note:
Sorts incoming notifications by time and/or priority in ascending(+)
or descending(-) order.

options.title: services.mako.textColor
options.note:
Set popup text color to a specific color, represented in hex color
code.

options.title: services.mako.width
options.note: Set width of notification popups in specified number of pixels.

options.title: services.mbsync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mbsync.

options.title: services.mbsync.package
options.note: The package to use for the mbsync binary.

options.title: services.mbsync.configFile
options.note:
Optional configuration file to link to use instead of
the default file (~/.mbsyncrc).

options.title: services.mbsync.frequency
options.note:
How often to run mbsync.  This value is passed to the systemd
timer configuration as the onCalendar option.  See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: services.mbsync.postExec
options.note:
An optional command to run after mbsync executes successfully.
This is useful for running mailbox indexing tools.

options.title: services.mbsync.preExec
options.note:
An optional command to run before mbsync executes.  This is
useful for creating the directories mbsync is going to use.

options.title: services.mbsync.verbose
options.note: Whether mbsync should produce verbose output.

options.title: services.megasync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Megasync client.

options.title: services.megasync.package
options.note: The megasync package to use.

options.title: services.mopidy.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Mopidy music player daemon.

options.title: services.mopidy.extensionPackages
options.note: Mopidy extensions that should be loaded by the service.

options.title: services.mopidy.extraConfigFiles
options.note:
Extra configuration files read by Mopidy when the service starts.
Later files in the list override earlier configuration files and
structured settings.

options.title: services.mopidy.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mopidy/mopidy.conf.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Mopidy config value)
options.example: { file = { media_dirs = [ "$XDG_MUSIC_DIR|Music" "~/library|Library" ]; follow_symlinks = true; excluded_file_extensions = [ ".html" ".zip" ".jpg" ".jpeg" ".png" ]; }; # Please don't put your mopidy-spotify configuration in the public. :) # Think of your Spotify Premium subscription! spotify = { client_id = "CLIENT_ID"; client_secret = "CLIENT_SECRET"; }; }

options.title: services.mpd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable MPD, the music player daemon.

options.title: services.mpd.package
options.note: The MPD package to run.

options.title: services.mpd.dataDir
options.note:
The directory where MPD stores its state, tag cache,
playlists etc.

options.title: services.mpd.dbFile
options.note:
The path to MPD’s database. If set to
null the parameter is omitted from the
configuration.

options.title: services.mpd.extraArgs
options.note: Extra command-line arguments to pass to MPD.
options.example: [ "--verbose" ]

options.title: services.mpd.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra directives added to to the end of MPD’s configuration
file, mpd.conf. Basic configuration
like file location and uid/gid is added automatically to the
beginning of the file. For available options see
mpd.conf(5).

options.title: services.mpd.musicDirectory
options.note: The directory where mpd reads music from.

options.title: services.mpd.network.listenAddress
options.note:
The address for the daemon to listen on.
Use any to listen on all addresses.

options.title: services.mpd.network.port
options.note: The TCP port on which the the daemon will listen.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpd.network.startWhenNeeded
options.note: Enable systemd socket activation.

options.title: services.mpd.playlistDirectory
options.note: The directory where mpd stores playlists.

options.title: services.mpd-discord-rpc.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the mpd-discord-rpc service.

options.title: services.mpd-discord-rpc.package
options.note: mpd-discord-rpc package to use.

options.title: services.mpd-discord-rpc.settings
options.note:
Configuration included in config.toml.
For available options see https://github.com/JakeStanger/mpd-discord-rpc#configuration
options.example: { hosts = [ "localhost:6600" ]; format = { details = "$title"; state = "On $album by $artist"; }; }

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mpd-mpris: An implementation of the MPRIS protocol for MPD.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.package
options.note: The mpd-mpris package to use.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.host
options.note: The address where MPD is listening for connections.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.network
services.mpd-mpris.mpd.password
options.note: The password to connect to MPD.

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.port
options.note: The port number where MPD is listening for connections.
options.type: null or 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpd-mpris.mpd.useLocal
options.note:
Whether to configure for the local MPD daemon. If
true the network,
host, and port
settings are ignored.

options.title: services.mpdris2.enable
options.note: Whether to enable mpDris2 the MPD to MPRIS2 bridge.

options.title: services.mpdris2.package
options.note: The mpDris2 package to use.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.host
options.note: The address where MPD is listening for connections.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.musicDirectory
options.note: If set, mpDris2 will use this directory to access music artwork.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.password
options.note: The password to connect to MPD.

options.title: services.mpdris2.mpd.port
options.note: The port number where MPD is listening for connections.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.mpdris2.multimediaKeys
options.note: Whether to enable multimedia key support.

options.title: services.mpdris2.notifications
options.note: Whether to enable song change notifications.

options.title: services.mpris-proxy.enable
options.note: Whether to enable a proxy forwarding Bluetooth MIDI controls via MPRIS2 to control media players.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes
options.note: Muchsync remotes to synchronise with.
options.example: { server = { frequency = "*:0/10"; remote.host = "server.tld"; }; }

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.frequency
options.note:
How often to run muchsync. This
value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the
OnCalendar option. See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.checkForModifiedFiles
options.note:
Check for locally modified files.
Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir are
never edited.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.local.importNew
options.note:
Whether to begin the synchronisation by running
notmuch new locally.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.checkForModifiedFiles
options.note:
Check for modified files on the remote side.
Without this option, muchsync assumes that files in a maildir are
never edited.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.host
options.note: Remote SSH host to synchronize with.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.importNew
options.note:
Whether to begin the synchronisation by running
notmuch new on the remote side.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.remote.muchsyncPath
options.note:
Specifies the path to muchsync on the server.
Ordinarily, muchsync should be in the default PATH on the server
so this option is not required.
However, this option is useful if you have to install muchsync in
a non-standard place or wish to test development versions of the
code.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.sshCommand
options.note:
Specifies a command line to pass to /bin/sh
to execute a command on another machine.

options.title: services.muchsync.remotes.<name>.upload
options.note: Whether to propagate local changes to the remote.

options.title: services.network-manager-applet.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Network Manager applet.

options.title: services.nextcloud-client.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Nextcloud Client.

options.title: services.nextcloud-client.package
options.note: The package to use for the nextcloud client binary.

options.title: services.nextcloud-client.startInBackground
options.note: Whether to start the Nextcloud client in the background.

options.title: services.notify-osd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable notify-osd.

options.title: services.notify-osd.package
options.note: Package containing the notify-osd program.

options.title: services.opensnitch-ui.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Opensnitch client.

options.title: services.osmscout-server.enable
options.note: Whether to enable OSM Scout Server.

options.title: services.osmscout-server.package
options.note: The osmscout-server package to use.

options.title: services.osmscout-server.network.listenAddress
options.note: The address for the server to listen on.

options.title: services.osmscout-server.network.port
options.note: The TCP port on which the server will listen.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.osmscout-server.network.startWhenNeeded
options.note: Enable systemd socket activation.

options.title: services.owncloud-client.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Owncloud Client.

options.title: services.owncloud-client.package
options.note: The owncloud-client package to use.

options.title: services.pantalaimon.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Pantalaimon, an E2EE aware proxy daemon for matrix clients.

options.title: services.pantalaimon.package
options.note: Package providing the pantalaimon executable to use.

options.title: services.pantalaimon.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/pantalaimon/pantalaimon.conf.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { Default = { LogLevel = "Debug"; SSL = true; }; local-matrix = { Homeserver = "https://matrix.org"; ListenAddress = "127.0.0.1"; ListenPort = 8008; }; }

options.title: services.parcellite.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Parcellite.

options.title: services.parcellite.package
options.note: Parcellite derivation to use.

options.title: services.parcellite.extraOptions
options.note: Command line arguments passed to Parcellite.
options.example: [ "--no-icon" ]

options.title: services.pass-secret-service.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Pass libsecret service.

options.title: services.pass-secret-service.package
options.note: The pass-secret-service package to use.

options.title: services.pass-secret-service.storePath
options.note:
Absolute path to password store. Defaults to
$HOME/.password-store if the
programs.password-store module is not enabled, and
programs.password-store.settings.PASSWORD_STORE_DIR if it is.

options.title: services.pasystray.enable
options.note: Whether to enable PulseAudio system tray.

options.title: services.pasystray.extraOptions
options.note: Extra command-line arguments to pass to pasystray.

options.title: services.pbgopy.enable
options.note: Whether to enable pbgopy.

options.title: services.pbgopy.cache.ttl
options.note: The TTL for the cache. Use "0s" to disable it.

options.title: services.pbgopy.httpAuth
options.note:
Basic HTTP authentication’s username and password. Both the username and
password are escaped.

options.title: services.pbgopy.port
options.note: The port to host the pbgopy server on.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.picom.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Picom X11 compositor.

options.title: services.picom.package
options.note: Picom derivation to use.

options.title: services.picom.activeOpacity
options.note: Opacity of active windows.
options.type: integer or floating point number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.picom.backend
options.note: Backend to use: egl, glx, xrender or xr_glx_hybrid.

options.title: services.picom.extraArgs
options.note: Extra arguments to be passed to the picom executable.

options.title: services.picom.fade
options.note: Fade windows in and out.

options.title: services.picom.fadeDelta
options.note: Time between fade animation step (in ms).

options.title: services.picom.fadeExclude
options.note:
List of conditions of windows that should not be faded.
See picom(1) man page for more examples.
options.example: [ "window_type *= 'menu'" "name ~= 'Firefox$'" "focused = 1" ]

options.title: services.picom.fadeSteps
options.note: Opacity change between fade steps (in and out).
options.type: pair of integer or floating point number between 0.01 and 1 (both inclusive)
options.example: [ 0.04 0.04 ]

options.title: services.picom.inactiveOpacity
options.note: Opacity of inactive windows.
options.type: integer or floating point number between 0.1 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.picom.menuOpacity
options.note: Opacity of dropdown and popup menu.
options.type: integer or floating point number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.picom.opacityRules
options.note: Rules that control the opacity of windows, in format PERCENT:PATTERN.
options.example: [ "95:class_g = 'URxvt' && !_NET_WM_STATE@:32a" "0:_NET_WM_STATE@:32a *= '_NET_WM_STATE_HIDDEN'" ]

options.title: services.picom.settings
options.note:
Picom settings. Use this option to configure Picom settings not exposed
in a NixOS option or to bypass one. For the available options see the
CONFIGURATION FILES section at picom(1).
options.type: libconfig configuration. The format consists of an attributesset (called a group) of settings. Each setting can be a scalar type(boolean, integer, floating point number or string), a list ofscalars or a group itself
options.example: blur = { method = "gaussian"; size = 10; deviation = 5.0; };

options.title: services.picom.shadow
options.note: Draw window shadows.

options.title: services.picom.shadowExclude
options.note:
List of conditions of windows that should have no shadow.
See picom(1) man page for more examples.
options.example: [ "window_type *= 'menu'" "name ~= 'Firefox$'" "focused = 1" ]

options.title: services.picom.shadowOffsets
options.note: Left and right offset for shadows (in pixels).
options.example: [ -10 -15 ]

options.title: services.picom.shadowOpacity
options.note: Window shadows opacity.
options.type: integer or floating point number between 0 and 1 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.picom.vSync
options.note: Enable vertical synchronization.

options.title: services.picom.wintypes
options.note: Rules for specific window types.

options.title: services.plan9port.fontsrv.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Plan 9 file system access to host fonts.

options.title: services.plan9port.plumber.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Plan 9 file system for interprocess messaging.

options.title: services.playerctld.enable
options.note: Whether to enable playerctld daemon.

options.title: services.playerctld.package
options.note: The playerctl package to use.

options.title: services.plex-mpv-shim.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Plex mpv shim.

options.title: services.plex-mpv-shim.package
options.note: The package to use for the Plex mpv shim.

options.title: services.plex-mpv-shim.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/plex-mpv-shim/config.json. See
https://github.com/iwalton3/plex-mpv-shim/blob/master/README.md
for the configuration documentation.
options.example: { adaptive_transcode = false; allow_http = false; always_transcode = false; audio_ac3passthrough = false; audio_dtspassthrough = false; auto_play = true; auto_transcode = true; }

options.title: services.polybar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Polybar status bar.

options.title: services.polybar.package
options.note: Polybar package to install.
options.example: pkgs.polybar.override { i3GapsSupport = true; alsaSupport = true; iwSupport = true; githubSupport = true; }

options.title: services.polybar.config
options.note:
Polybar configuration. Can be either path to a file, or set of attributes
that will be used to create the final configuration.
See also services.polybar.settings for a more nix-friendly format.
options.type: (attribute set of attribute set of (string or boolean or signed integer or list of string)) or path convertible to it
options.example: { "bar/top" = { monitor = "\${env:MONITOR:eDP1}"; width = "100%"; height = "3%"; radius = 0; modules-center = "date"; }; "module/date" = { type = "internal/date"; internal = 5; date = "%d.%m.%y"; time = "%H:%M"; label = "%time% %date%"; }; }

options.title: services.polybar.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add.
options.example: '' [module/date] type = internal/date interval = 5 date = "%d.%m.%y" time = %H:%M format-prefix-foreground = \''${colors.foreground-alt} label = %time% %date% ''

options.title: services.polybar.script
options.note:
This script will be used to start the polybars.
Set all necessary environment variables here and start all bars.
It can be assumed that polybar executable is in the PATH.

options.title: services.polybar.settings
options.note:
Polybar configuration. This takes a nix attrset and converts it to the
strange data format that polybar uses.
Each entry will be converted to a section in the output file.
Several things are treated specially: nested keys are converted
to dash-separated keys; the special text key is ignored as a nested key,
to allow mixing different levels of nesting; and lists are converted to
polybar’s foo-0, foo-1, ... format.
options.example: { "module/volume" = { type = "internal/pulseaudio"; format.volume = "<ramp-volume> <label-volume>"; label.muted.text = "🔇"; label.muted.foreground = "#666"; ramp.volume = ["🔈" "🔉" "🔊"]; click.right = "pavucontrol &"; }; }

options.title: services.poweralertd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the Upower-powered power alertd.

options.title: services.pueue.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Pueue, CLI process scheduler and manager.

options.title: services.pueue.package
options.note: The pueue package to use.

options.title: services.pueue.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/pueue/pueue.yml.
options.example: { daemon = { default_parallel_tasks = 2; }; }

options.title: services.pulseeffects.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable Pulseeffects daemon
Note, it is necessary to add

options.title: services.pulseeffects.package
options.note: Pulseeffects package to use.

options.title: services.pulseeffects.preset
options.note:
Which preset to use when starting pulseeffects.
Will likely need to launch pulseeffects to initially create preset.

options.title: services.random-background.enable
options.note: Whether to enable random desktop background.

options.title: services.random-background.enableXinerama
options.note:
Will place a separate image per screen when enabled,
otherwise a single image will be stretched across all
screens.

options.title: services.random-background.display
options.note: Display background images according to this option.

options.title: services.random-background.imageDirectory
options.note:
The directory of images from which a background should be
chosen. Should be formatted in a way understood by systemd,
e.g., ‘%h’ is the home directory.

options.title: services.random-background.interval
options.note:
The duration between changing background image, set to null
to only set background when logging in. Should be formatted
as a duration understood by systemd.

options.title: services.recoll.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Recoll file index service.

options.title: services.recoll.package
options.note: Package providing the recoll binary.

options.title: services.recoll.configDir
options.note:
The directory to contain Recoll configuration files. This will be set
as RECOLL_CONFDIR.

options.title: services.recoll.settings
options.note: The configuration to be written at $RECOLL_CONFDIR/recoll.conf.
options.example: { nocjk = true; loglevel = 5; topdirs = [ "~/Downloads" "~/Documents" "~/projects" ]; "~/Downloads" = { "skippedNames+" = [ "*.iso" ]; }; "~/projects" = { "skippedNames+" = [ "node_modules" "target" "result" ]; }; }

options.title: services.recoll.startAt
options.note:
When or how often the periodic update should run. Must be the format
described from systemd.time(7).

options.title: services.redshift.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Redshift.

options.title: services.redshift.enableVerboseLogging
options.note: Whether to enable verbose service logging.

options.title: services.redshift.package
options.note: Redshift derivation to use.

options.title: services.redshift.dawnTime
options.note:
Set the time interval of dawn manually.
The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.redshift.duskTime
options.note:
Set the time interval of dusk manually.
The times must be specified as HH:MM in 24-hour format.

options.title: services.redshift.latitude
options.note:
Your current latitude, between -90.0 and
90.0. Must be provided along with
longitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.redshift.longitude
options.note:
Your current longitude, between -180.0 and
180.0. Must be provided along with
latitude.
options.type: null or string or floating point number

options.title: services.redshift.provider
options.note:
The location provider to use for determining your location. If set to
manual you must also provide latitude/longitude.
If set to geoclue2, you must also enable the global
geoclue2 service.

options.title: services.redshift.settings
options.note:
The configuration to pass to Redshift.
Available options for Redshift described in
redshift(1).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { redshift = { adjustment-method = "randr"; }; randr = { screen = 0; }; };

options.title: services.redshift.temperature.day
options.note:
Colour temperature to use during the day, between
1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.redshift.temperature.night
options.note:
Colour temperature to use at night, between
1000 and 25000 K.

options.title: services.redshift.tray
options.note: Start the redshift-gtk tray applet.

options.title: services.rsibreak.enable
options.note: Whether to enable rsibreak.

options.title: services.safeeyes.enable
options.note: Whether to enable The Safe Eyes OSGI service.

options.title: services.safeeyes.package
options.note: The safeeyes package to use.

options.title: services.screen-locker.enable
options.note: Whether to enable screen locker for X session.

options.title: services.screen-locker.inactiveInterval
options.note:
Inactive time interval in minutes after which session will be locked.
The minimum is 1 minute, and the maximum is 1 hour.
If xautolock.enable is true, it will use this setting.
See https://linux.die.net/man/1/xautolock.
Otherwise, this will be used with xset to configure
the X server’s screensaver timeout.

options.title: services.screen-locker.lockCmd
options.note: Locker command to run.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xautolock.enable
options.note: Use xautolock for time-based locking.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xautolock.package
options.note: Package providing the xautolock binary.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xautolock.detectSleep
options.note:
Whether to reset xautolock timers when awaking from sleep.
No effect if xautolock.enable is false.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xautolock.extraOptions
options.note:
Extra command-line arguments to pass to xautolock.
No effect if xautolock.enable is false.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xss-lock.package
options.note: Package providing the xss-lock binary.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xss-lock.extraOptions
options.note: Extra command-line arguments to pass to xss-lock.

options.title: services.screen-locker.xss-lock.screensaverCycle
options.note:
The X server’s screensaver cycle value expressed as seconds.
This will be used with xset to configure
the cycle along with timeout.

options.title: services.sctd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sctd.

options.title: services.sctd.baseTemperature
options.note:
The base color temperature used by sctd, which should be between 2500 and 9000.
See
sctd(1)
for more details.

options.title: services.signaturepdf.enable
options.note: Whether to enable signaturepdf; signing, organizing, editing metadatas or compressing PDFs.

options.title: services.signaturepdf.package
options.note: signaturepdf derivation to use.

options.title: services.signaturepdf.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration optional.
options.type: attribute set of (string or signed integer or boolean or floating point number)
options.example: { max_file_uploads = "201"; post_max_size = "24M"; upload_max_filesize = "24M"; }

options.title: services.signaturepdf.port
options.note: The port on which the application runs
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.spotifyd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable SpotifyD connect.

options.title: services.spotifyd.package
options.note:
The spotifyd package to use.
Can be used to specify extensions.

options.title: services.spotifyd.settings
options.note: Configuration for spotifyd
options.example: { global = { username = "Alex"; password = "foo"; device_name = "nix"; }; }

options.title: services.ssh-agent.enable
options.note: Whether to enable OpenSSH private key agent.

options.title: services.stalonetray.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Stalonetray system tray.

options.title: services.stalonetray.package
options.note: The package to use for the Stalonetray binary.

options.title: services.stalonetray.config
options.note: Stalonetray configuration as a set of attributes.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or boolean or signed integer)
options.example: { background = "#cccccc"; decorations = null; geometry = "3x1-600+0"; icon_size = 30; sticky = true; }

options.title: services.stalonetray.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration lines for stalonetrayrc.
options.example: '' geometry 3x1-600+0 decorations none icon_size 30 sticky true background "#cccccc" ''

options.title: services.status-notifier-watcher.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Status Notifier Watcher.

options.title: services.status-notifier-watcher.package
options.note: The package to use for the status notifier watcher binary.

options.title: services.swayidle.enable
options.note: Whether to enable idle manager for Wayland.

options.title: services.swayidle.package
options.note: Swayidle package to install.

options.title: services.swayidle.events
options.note: Run command on occurrence of a event.
options.example: [ { event = "before-sleep"; command = "${pkgs.swaylock}/bin/swaylock -fF"; } { event = "lock"; command = "lock"; } ]

options.title: services.swayidle.events.*.command
options.note: Command to run when event occurs.

options.title: services.swayidle.events.*.event
options.note: Event name.

options.title: services.swayidle.extraArgs
options.note: Extra arguments to pass to swayidle.

options.title: services.swayidle.systemdTarget
options.note: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: services.swayidle.timeouts
options.note: List of commands to run after idle timeout.
options.example: [ { timeout = 60; command = "${pkgs.swaylock}/bin/swaylock -fF"; } { timeout = 90; command = "${pkgs.systemd}/bin/systemctl suspend"; } ]

options.title: services.swayidle.timeouts.*.command
options.note: Command to run after timeout seconds of inactivity.

options.title: services.swayidle.timeouts.*.resumeCommand
options.note: Command to run when there is activity again.

options.title: services.swayidle.timeouts.*.timeout
options.note: Timeout in seconds.

options.title: services.swayosd.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable swayosd, a GTK based on screen display for keyboard shortcuts like
caps-lock and volume.

options.title: services.swayosd.package
options.note: The swayosd package to use.

options.title: services.swayosd.display
options.note: X display to use.

options.title: services.swayosd.topMargin
options.note: OSD margin from top edge (0.5 would be screen center).

options.title: services.sxhkd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable simple X hotkey daemon.

options.title: services.sxhkd.package
options.note: Package containing the sxhkd executable.

options.title: services.sxhkd.extraConfig
options.note: Additional configuration to add.
options.example: super + {_,shift +} {1-9,0} i3-msg {workspace,move container to workspace} {1-10}

options.title: services.sxhkd.extraOptions
options.note: Command line arguments to invoke sxhkd with.

options.title: services.sxhkd.keybindings
options.note: An attribute set that assigns hotkeys to commands.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or path)
options.example: { "super + shift + {r,c}" = "i3-msg {restart,reload}"; "super + {s,w}" = "i3-msg {stacking,tabbed}"; "super + F1" = pkgs.writeShellScript "script" "echo $USER"; }

options.title: services.syncthing.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Syncthing continuous file synchronization.

options.title: services.syncthing.extraOptions
options.note: Extra command-line arguments to pass to syncthing.
options.example: [ "--gui-apikey=apiKey" ]

options.title: services.syncthing.tray
options.note: Syncthing tray service configuration.

options.title: services.systembus-notify.enable
options.note: Whether to enable systembus-notify - system bus notification daemon.

options.title: services.taffybar.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Taffybar.

options.title: services.taffybar.package
options.note: The package to use for the Taffybar binary.

options.title: services.tahoe-lafs.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Tahoe-LAFS.

options.title: services.taskwarrior-sync.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Taskwarrior periodic sync.

options.title: services.taskwarrior-sync.frequency
options.note:
How often to run taskwarrior sync. This
value is passed to the systemd timer configuration as the
OnCalendar option. See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: services.trayer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable trayer, the lightweight GTK2+ systray for UNIX desktops.

options.title: services.trayer.package
options.note: The package to use for the trayer binary.

options.title: services.trayer.settings
options.note:
Trayer configuration as a set of attributes. Further details can be
found in trayer’s README.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or boolean or signed integer)
options.example: { edge = "top"; padding = 6; SetDockType = true; tint = "0x282c34"; }

options.description: unsigned integer, meaning >=0, or value “primary” (singular enum) (default: 0)

options.title: services.twmn.enable
options.note: Whether to enable twmn, a tiling window manager notification daemon.

options.title: services.twmn.duration
options.note: The time each notification remains visible, in milliseconds.

options.title: services.twmn.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration options to add to the twmnd config file. See
https://github.com/sboli/twmn/blob/master/README.md
for details.

options.title: services.twmn.host
options.note: Host address to listen on for notifications.

options.title: services.twmn.icons.critical
options.note: Path to the critical notifications’ icon.

options.title: services.twmn.icons.info
options.note: Path to the informative notifications’ icon.

options.title: services.twmn.icons.warning
options.note: Path to the warning notifications’ icon.

options.title: services.twmn.port
options.note: UDP port to listen on for notifications.
options.type: 16 bit unsigned integer; between 0 and 65535 (both inclusive)

options.title: services.twmn.screen
options.note:
Screen number to display notifications on when using a multi-head
desktop.

options.title: services.twmn.soundCommand
options.note: Command to execute to play a notification’s sound.

options.title: services.twmn.text.color
options.note:
Notification’s text color. RGB hex and keywords (e.g. lightgray)
are supported.

options.title: services.twmn.text.font.package
options.note:
Notification text’s font package. If null then
the font is assumed to already be available in your profile.

options.title: services.twmn.text.font.family
options.note: Notification text’s font family.

options.title: services.twmn.text.font.size
options.note: Notification text’s font size.

options.title: services.twmn.text.font.variant
options.note: Notification text’s font variant.

options.title: services.twmn.text.maxLength
options.note:
Maximum length of the text before it is cut and suffixed with “…”.
Never cuts if null.

options.title: services.twmn.window.alwaysOnTop
options.note: Whether to enable forcing the notification window to always be on top.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.bounce.enable
options.note: Whether to enable notification bounce when displaying next notification directly.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.bounce.duration
options.note: The bounce animation duration in milliseconds.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeIn
options.note: Options for the notification appearance’s animation.
options.example: { curve = 19; duration = 618; }

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeIn.curve
options.note:
The qt easing-curve animation to use for the animation. See

QEasingCurve documentation.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeIn.duration
options.note: The animation duration in milliseconds.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeOut
options.note: Options for the notification disappearance’s animation.
options.example: { curve = 19; duration = 618; }

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeOut.curve
options.note:
The qt easing-curve animation to use for the animation. See

QEasingCurve documentation.

options.title: services.twmn.window.animation.easeOut.duration
options.note: The animation duration in milliseconds.

options.title: services.twmn.window.color
options.note:
Notification’s background color. RGB hex and keywords (e.g.
lightgray) are supported.

options.title: services.twmn.window.height
options.note:
Height of the slide bar. Useful to match your tiling window
manager’s bar.

options.title: services.twmn.window.offset.x
options.note:
Offset of the notification’s slide starting point in pixels on the
horizontal axis (positive is rightward).

options.title: services.twmn.window.offset.y
options.note:
Offset of the notification’s slide starting point in pixels on the
vertical axis (positive is upward).

options.title: services.twmn.window.opacity
options.note: The notification window’s opacity.

options.title: services.twmn.window.position
options.note:
Position of the notification slide. The notification will slide
in vertically from the border if placed in
top_center or bottom_center,
horizontally otherwise.

options.title: services.udiskie.enable
options.note: Whether to enable the udiskie mount daemon.

options.title: services.udiskie.automount
options.note: Whether to automatically mount new devices.

options.title: services.udiskie.notify
options.note: Whether to show pop-up notifications.

options.title: services.udiskie.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/udiskie/config.yml.
options.example: { program_options = { udisks_version = 2; tray = true; }; icon_names.media = [ "media-optical" ]; }

options.title: services.udiskie.tray
options.note: Whether to display tray icon.

options.description: Show tray icon only when there is a device available.

options.title: services.unclutter.enable
options.note: Whether to enable unclutter.

options.title: services.unclutter.package
options.note: unclutter derivation to use.

options.title: services.unclutter.extraOptions
options.note: More arguments to pass to the unclutter command.
options.example: [ "exclude-root" "ignore-scrolling" ]

options.title: services.unclutter.threshold
options.note: Minimum number of pixels considered cursor movement.

options.title: services.unclutter.timeout
options.note: Number of seconds before the cursor is marked inactive.

options.title: services.unison.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Unison synchronisation.

options.title: services.unison.package
options.note: The unison package to use.

options.title: services.unison.pairs
options.note: Unison root pairs to keep synchronised.
options.example: { "my-documents" = { roots = [ "/home/user/documents" "ssh://remote/documents" ]; }; }

options.title: services.unison.pairs.<name>.commandOptions
options.note:
Additional command line options as a dictionary to pass to the
unison program.
options.type: attribute set of (string or list of string)

options.title: services.unison.pairs.<name>.roots
options.note: Pair of roots to synchronise.
options.example: [ "/home/user/documents" "ssh://remote/documents" ]

options.title: services.unison.pairs.<name>.stateDirectory
options.note: Unison state directory to use.

options.title: services.vdirsyncer.enable
options.note: Whether to enable vdirsyncer.

options.title: services.vdirsyncer.package
options.note: The package to use for the vdirsyncer binary.

options.title: services.vdirsyncer.configFile
options.note:
Optional configuration file to link to use instead of
the default file ($XDG_CONFIG_HOME/vdirsyncer/config).

options.title: services.vdirsyncer.frequency
options.note:
How often to run vdirsyncer.  This value is passed to the systemd
timer configuration as the onCalendar option.  See
systemd.time(7)
for more information about the format.

options.title: services.vdirsyncer.verbosity
options.note: Whether vdirsyncer should produce verbose output.

options.title: services.volnoti.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Volnoti volume HUD daemon.

options.title: services.volnoti.package
options.note: Package containing the volnoti program.

options.title: services.wlsunset.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wlsunset.

options.title: services.wlsunset.package
options.note: wlsunset derivation to use.

options.title: services.wlsunset.gamma
options.note: Gamma value to use.

options.title: services.wlsunset.latitude
options.note:
Your current latitude, between -90.0 and
90.0.

options.title: services.wlsunset.longitude
options.note:
Your current longitude, between -180.0 and
180.0.

options.title: services.wlsunset.systemdTarget
options.note: Systemd target to bind to.

options.title: services.wlsunset.temperature.day
options.note:
Colour temperature to use during the day, in Kelvin (K).
This value must be greater than temperature.night.

options.title: services.wlsunset.temperature.night
options.note:
Colour temperature to use during the night, in Kelvin (K).
This value must be smaller than temperature.day.

options.title: services.wob.enable
options.note: Whether to enable wob.

options.title: services.wob.package
options.note: The wob package to use.

options.title: services.wob.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/wob/wob.ini.
See wob.ini(5) for documentation.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string))
options.example: { "" = { border_size = 10; height = 50; }; "output.foo".name = "DP-1"; "style.muted".background_color = "032cfc"; }

options.title: services.wob.systemd
options.note: Whether to enable systemd service and socket for wob.

options.title: services.xcape.enable
options.note: Whether to enable xcape.

options.title: services.xcape.mapExpression
options.note: The value has the grammar Key[|OtherKey].
options.example: { Control_L = "Control_L|O"; Shift_L = "Escape"; }

options.title: services.xcape.timeout
options.note:
If you hold a key longer than this timeout, xcape will not
generate a key event. Default is 500 ms.

options.title: services.xembed-sni-proxy.enable
options.note: Whether to enable XEmbed SNI Proxy.

options.title: services.xembed-sni-proxy.package
options.note:
Package containing the xembedsniproxy
program.

options.title: services.xidlehook.enable
options.note: Whether to enable xidlehook systemd service.

options.title: services.xidlehook.package
options.note: The package to use for xidlehook.

options.title: services.xidlehook.detect-sleep
options.note: Whether to enable detecting when the system wakes up from a suspended state and resetting the idle timer.

options.title: services.xidlehook.environment
options.note:
Extra environment variables to be exported in the script.
These options are passed unescaped as export name=value.
options.example: { "primary-display" = "$(xrandr | awk '/ primary/{print $1}')"; }

options.title: services.xidlehook.not-when-audio
options.note: Disable locking when audio is playing.

options.title: services.xidlehook.not-when-fullscreen
options.note: Disable locking when a fullscreen application is in use.

options.title: services.xidlehook.once
options.note: Whether to enable running the program once and exiting.

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers
options.note:
A set of commands to be executed after a specific idle timeout.
The commands specified in command and canceller
are passed escaped to the script.
To use or re-use environment variables that are script-dependent, specify them
in the environment section.
options.example: [ { delay = 60; command = "xrandr --output \"$PRIMARY_DISPLAY\" --brightness .1"; canceller = "xrandr --output \"$PRIMARY_DISPLAY\" --brightness 1"; } { delay = 120; command = "${pkgs.writeShellScript "my-script" '' # A complex script to run ''}"; } ]

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.canceller
options.note:
Command executed when the user becomes active again.
This is only executed if the next timer has not been reached.
Path to executables are accepted.
The command is automatically escaped.
options.example: ${pkgs.libnotify}/bin/notify-send "Idle" "Resuming activity"

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.command
options.note:
Command executed after the idle timeout is reached.
Path to executables are accepted.
The command is automatically escaped.
options.example: ${pkgs.libnotify}/bin/notify-send "Idle" "Sleeping in 1 minute"

options.title: services.xidlehook.timers.*.delay
options.note: Time before executing the command.

options.title: services.xscreensaver.enable
options.note: Whether to enable XScreenSaver.

options.title: services.xscreensaver.settings
options.note: The settings to use for XScreenSaver.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { fadeTicks = 20; lock = false; mode = "blank"; }

options.title: services.xsettingsd.enable
options.note: Whether to enable xsettingsd.

options.title: services.xsettingsd.package
options.note: Package containing the xsettingsd program.

options.title: services.xsettingsd.settings
options.note:
Xsettingsd options for configuration file. See
https://github.com/derat/xsettingsd/wiki/Settings
for documentation on these values.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { "Net/ThemeName" = "Numix"; "Xft/Antialias" = true; "Xft/Hinting" = true; "Xft/RGBA" = "rgb"; }

options.title: services.xsuspender.enable
options.note: Whether to enable XSuspender.

options.title: services.xsuspender.debug
options.note: Whether to enable debug output.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults
options.note: XSuspender defaults.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.autoSuspendOnBattery
options.note:
Whether to auto-apply rules when switching to battery
power even if the window(s) didn’t just lose focus.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.downclockOnBattery
options.note:
Limit CPU consumption for this factor when on battery power.
Value 1 means 50% decrease, 2 means 66%, 3 means 75% etc.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.execResume
options.note:
Before resuming, execute this shell script. Resume the
process regardless script failure.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.execSuspend
options.note:
Before suspending, execute this shell script. If it fails,
abort suspension.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.matchWmClassContains
options.note: Match windows that wm class contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.matchWmClassGroupContains
options.note: Match windows where wm class group contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.matchWmNameContains
options.note: Match windows where wm name contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.onlyOnBattery
options.note: Whether to enable process suspend only on battery.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.resumeEvery
options.note: Resume interval in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.resumeFor
options.note: Resume duration in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.sendSignals
options.note:
Whether to send SIGSTOP / SIGCONT signals or not.
If false just the exec scripts are run.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.suspendDelay
options.note: Initial suspend delay in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.defaults.suspendSubtreePattern
options.note: Also suspend descendant processes that match this regex.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules
options.note: Attribute set of XSuspender rules.
options.example: { Chromium = { matchWmClassContains = "chromium-browser"; suspendDelay = 10; suspendSubtreePattern = "chromium"; }; }

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.autoSuspendOnBattery
options.note:
Whether to auto-apply rules when switching to battery
power even if the window(s) didn’t just lose focus.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.downclockOnBattery
options.note:
Limit CPU consumption for this factor when on battery power.
Value 1 means 50% decrease, 2 means 66%, 3 means 75% etc.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.execResume
options.note:
Before resuming, execute this shell script. Resume the
process regardless script failure.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.execSuspend
options.note:
Before suspending, execute this shell script. If it fails,
abort suspension.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.matchWmClassContains
options.note: Match windows that wm class contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.matchWmClassGroupContains
options.note: Match windows where wm class group contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.matchWmNameContains
options.note: Match windows where wm name contains string.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.onlyOnBattery
options.note: Whether to enable process suspend only on battery.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.resumeEvery
options.note: Resume interval in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.resumeFor
options.note: Resume duration in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.sendSignals
options.note:
Whether to send SIGSTOP / SIGCONT signals or not.
If false just the exec scripts are run.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.suspendDelay
options.note: Initial suspend delay in seconds.

options.title: services.xsuspender.rules.<name>.suspendSubtreePattern
options.note: Also suspend descendant processes that match this regex.

options.title: specialisation
options.note:
A set of named specialized configurations. These can be used to extend
your base configuration with additional settings. For example, you can
have specialisations named “light” and “dark”
that apply light and dark color theme configurations.

options.title: specialisation.<name>.configuration
options.note: Arbitrary Home Manager configuration settings.

options.title: systemd.user.automounts
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user automount units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { automount-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Automount = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.mounts
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user mount units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { mount-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Mount = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.paths
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user path units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { path-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Path = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.services
options.note:
