Definition of systemd per-user service units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { service-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Service = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.servicesStartTimeoutMs
options.note:
How long to wait for started services to fail until their start is
considered successful. The value 0 indicates no timeout.

options.title: systemd.user.sessionVariables
options.note:
Environment variables that will be set for the user session.
The variable values must be as described in
environment.d(5).
options.type: attribute set of (signed integer or string)
options.example: { EDITOR = "vim"; }

options.title: systemd.user.settings
options.note:
Extra config options for user session service manager. See systemd-user.conf(5) for
available options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (INI atom (null, bool, int, float or string) or a list of them for duplicate keys)
options.example: { Manager.DefaultCPUAccounting = true; }

options.title: systemd.user.settings.Manager.DefaultEnvironment
options.note: Configures environment variables passed to all executed processes.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or path or package)
options.example: { PATH = "%u/bin:%u/.cargo/bin"; }

options.title: systemd.user.settings.Manager.ManagerEnvironment
options.note: Sets environment variables just for the manager process itself.
options.type: attribute set of (null or string or path or package)
options.example: { PATH = "%u/bin:%u/.cargo/bin"; }

options.title: systemd.user.slices
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user slice units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { slice-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Slice = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.sockets
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user socket units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { socket-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Socket = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.startServices
options.note:
Whether new or changed services that are wanted by active targets
should be started. Additionally, stop obsolete services from the
previous generation.

options.description: Use a very simple shell script to print suggested systemctl commands to run. You will have to manually run those commands after the switch.
Use a Ruby script to, in a more robust fashion, determine the necessary changes and automatically run the systemctl commands.

Use sd-switch, a third party application, to perform the service updates. This tool offers more features while having a small closure size. Note, it requires a fully functional user D-Bus session. Once tested and deemed sufficiently robust, this will become the default.

options.title: systemd.user.systemctlPath
options.note:
Absolute path to the systemctl tool. This
option may need to be set if running Home Manager on a
non-NixOS distribution.

options.title: systemd.user.targets
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user target units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { target-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Target = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.timers
options.note:
Definition of systemd per-user timer units. Attributes are
merged recursively.
options.example: { timer-name = { Unit = { Description = "Example description"; Documentation = [ "man:example(1)" "man:example(5)" ]; }; Timer = { … }; }; };

options.title: systemd.user.tmpfiles.rules
options.note:
Rules for creating and cleaning up temporary files
automatically. See
tmpfiles.d(5)
for the exact format.
options.example: [ "L /home/user/Documents - - - - /mnt/data/Documents" ]

options.title: targets.darwin.currentHostDefaults
options.note:
Set macOS user defaults. Unlike targets.darwin.defaults,
the preferences will only be applied to the currently logged-in host. This
distinction is important for networked accounts.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of anything
options.example: { "com.apple.controlcenter" = { BatteryShowPercentage = true; }; }

options.title: targets.darwin.currentHostDefaults."com.apple.controlcenter".BatteryShowPercentage
options.note: Whether to show battery percentage in the menu bar.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults
options.note:
Set macOS user defaults. Values set to null are
ignored.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of anything
options.example: { "com.apple.desktopservices" = { DSDontWriteNetworkStores = true; DSDontWriteUSBStores = true; }; }

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.AppleLanguages
options.note: Sets the language to use in the preferred order.
options.example: [ "en" ]

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.AppleLocale
options.note: Configures the user locale.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.AppleMeasurementUnits
options.note: Sets the measurement unit.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.AppleMetricUnits
options.note: Whether to enable the metric system.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.AppleTemperatureUnit
options.note: Sets the temperature unit.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.NSAutomaticCapitalizationEnabled
options.note: Whether to enable automatic capitalization.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.NSAutomaticDashSubstitutionEnabled
options.note: Whether to enable smart dashes.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.NSAutomaticPeriodSubstitutionEnabled
options.note: Whether to enable period with double space.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.NSAutomaticQuoteSubstitutionEnabled
options.note: Whether to enable smart quotes.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults.NSGlobalDomain.NSAutomaticSpellingCorrectionEnabled
options.note: Whether to enable spelling correction.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".AutoFillCreditCardData
options.note: Whether to enable autofill of credit card numbers.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".AutoFillPasswords
options.note: Whether to enable autofill of usernames and passwords.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".AutoOpenSafeDownloads
options.note: Whether to enable opening of downloaded files.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".IncludeDevelopMenu
options.note: Whether to enable “Develop” menu in the menu bar.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".ShowOverlayStatusBar
options.note: Whether to enable status bar.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari".WebKitDeveloperExtrasEnabledPreferenceKey
options.note: Configures the web inspector.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari"."WebKitPreferences.developerExtrasEnabled"
options.note: Configures the web inspector.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.Safari.SandboxBroker".ShowDevelopMenu
options.note: Show the “Develop” menu in Safari’s menubar.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.desktopservices".DSDontWriteNetworkStores
options.note:
Disable use of .DS_Store files on network shares.
See the
official article for more info.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.desktopservices".DSDontWriteUSBStores
options.note: Disable use of .DS_Store files on thumb drives.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.dock".expose-group-apps
options.note: Whether to enable grouping of windows by application in Mission Control.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.dock".size-immutable
options.note: Whether to enable locking of the dock size.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.dock".tilesize
options.note: Sets the size of the dock.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.apple.menuextra.battery".ShowPercent
options.note:
This option no longer works on macOS 11 and later. Instead, use
targets.darwin.currentHostDefaults.\"com.apple.controlcenter\".BatteryShowPercentage.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.googlecode.iterm2".AddNewTabAtEndOfTabs
options.note: Whether to enable placement of new tabs at the end of the tab bar.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.googlecode.iterm2".AlternateMouseScroll
options.note: Whether to enable arrow keys when scrolling in alternate screen mode.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.googlecode.iterm2".CopySelection
options.note: Whether to enable copy to clipboard upon selecting text.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.googlecode.iterm2".ExperimentalKeyHandling
options.note: Whether to enable experimental key handling for AquaSKK compatibility.

options.title: targets.darwin.defaults."com.googlecode.iterm2".OpenTmuxWindowsIn
options.note: Configures how to restore tmux windows when attaching to a session.

options.description: Native tabs in a new window

options.title: targets.darwin.keybindings
options.note:
This will configure the default keybindings for text fields in macOS
applications. See
Apple’s documentation
for more details.
options.example: { "^u" = "deleteToBeginningOfLine:"; "^w" = "deleteWordBackward:"; }

options.title: targets.darwin.search
options.note: Default search engine.

options.title: targets.genericLinux.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable settings that make Home Manager work better on
GNU/Linux distributions other than NixOS.

options.title: uninstall
options.note:
Whether to set up a minimal configuration that will remove all managed
files and packages.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Hyprland wayland compositor.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.enableNvidiaPatches
options.note: Whether to enable patching wlroots for better Nvidia support.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.package
options.note: The hyprland package to use.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf.
options.example: '' # window resize bind = $mod, S, submap, resize submap = resize binde = , right, resizeactive, 10 0 binde = , left, resizeactive, -10 0 binde = , up, resizeactive, 0 -10 binde = , down, resizeactive, 0 10 bind = , escape, submap, reset submap = reset ''

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.finalPackage
options.note: The Hyprland package after applying configuration.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.plugins
options.note:
List of Hyprland plugins to use. Can either be packages or
absolute plugin paths.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.settings
options.note:
Hyprland configuration written in Nix. Entries with the same key
should be written as lists. Variables’ and colors’ names should be
quoted. See https://wiki.hyprland.org for more examples.
options.example: { decoration = { shadow_offset = "0 5"; "col.shadow" = "rgba(00000099)"; }; "$mod" = "SUPER"; bindm = [ # mouse movements "$mod, mouse:272, movewindow" "$mod, mouse:273, resizewindow" "$mod ALT, mouse:272, resizewindow" ]; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.sourceFirst
options.note:
Whether to enable putting source entries at the top of the configuration
.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.systemd.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable hyprland-session.target on
hyprland startup. This links to graphical-session.target.
Some important environment variables will be imported to systemd
and D-Bus user environment before reaching the target, including

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.systemd.extraCommands
options.note: Extra commands to be run after D-Bus activation.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.systemd.variables
options.note:
Environment variables to be imported in the systemd & D-Bus user
environment.
options.example: [ "-all" ]

options.title: wayland.windowManager.hyprland.xwayland.enable
options.note: Whether to enable XWayland.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.enable
options.note: Whether to enable sway wayland compositor.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.package
options.note:
Sway package to use. Will override the options
‘wrapperFeatures’, ‘extraSessionCommands’, and ‘extraOptions’.
Set to null to not add any Sway package to your
path. This should be done if you want to use the NixOS Sway
module to install Sway.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config
options.note: Sway configuration options.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.assigns
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns applications to workspaces based
on criteria.
options.type: attribute set of list of attribute set of (string or boolean)
options.example: { "1: web" = [{ class = "^Firefox$"; }]; "0: extra" = [{ class = "^Firefox$"; window_role = "About"; }]; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars
options.note: Sway bars settings blocks. Set to empty list to remove bars completely.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors
options.note:
Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, fields and RGB color hex-codes as values.
See default values for the reference.
Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.activeWorkspace
options.note: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace is active.
options.example: { background = "#5f676a"; border = "#333333"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.background
options.note: Background color of the bar.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.bindingMode
options.note: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator
options.example: { background = "#900000"; border = "#2f343a"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.focusedBackground
options.note: Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.focusedSeparator
options.note: Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.focusedStatusline
options.note: Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.focusedWorkspace
options.note: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace has focus.
options.example: { background = "#285577"; border = "#4c7899"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.inactiveWorkspace
options.note:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace does not
have focus and is not active.
options.example: { background = "#222222"; border = "#333333"; text = "#888888"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.separator
options.note: Text color to be used for the separator.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.statusline
options.note: Text color to be used for the statusline.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.colors.urgentWorkspace
options.note:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace contains
a window with the urgency hint set.
options.example: { background = "#900000"; border = "#2f343a"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.command
options.note: Command that will be used to start a bar.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines for this bar.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.fonts
options.note: Font configuration for this bar.
options.example: { names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ]; style = "Bold Semi-Condensed"; size = 11.0; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.hiddenState
options.note: The default bar mode when ‘bar.mode’ == ‘hide’.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.id
options.note:
Specifies the bar ID for the configured bar instance.
If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x corresponds
to the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.mode
options.note: Bar visibility mode.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.position
options.note: The edge of the screen swaybar should show up.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.statusCommand
options.note: Command that will be used to get status lines.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.trayOutput
options.note: Where to output tray.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.trayPadding
options.note:
Sets the pixel padding of the system tray.
This padding will surround the tray on all sides and between each item.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.workspaceButtons
options.note: Whether workspace buttons should be shown or not.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bars.*.workspaceNumbers
options.note: Whether workspace numbers should be displayed within the workspace buttons.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.bindkeysToCode
options.note: Whether to make use of --to-code in keybindings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors
options.note:
Color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, ‘indicator’ and ‘childBorder’ fields
and RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference.
Note that ‘sway.config.colors.background’ parameter takes a single RGB value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.background
options.note:
Background color of the window. Only applications which do not cover
the whole area expose the color.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.focused
options.note: A window which currently has the focus.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.focusedInactive
options.note:
A window which is the focused one of its container,
but it does not have the focus at the moment.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.placeholder
options.note:
Background and text color are used to draw placeholder window
contents (when restoring layouts). Border and indicator are ignored.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.unfocused
options.note: A window which is not focused.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.colors.urgent
options.note: A window which has its urgency hint activated.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.defaultWorkspace
options.note:
The default workspace to show when sway is launched.
This must to correspond to the value of the keybinding of the default workspace.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.down
options.note: Home row direction key for moving down.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.floating
options.note: Floating window settings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.floating.border
options.note: Floating windows border width.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.floating.criteria
options.note: List of criteria for windows that should be opened in a floating mode.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean)
options.example: [ { title = "Steam - Update News"; } { class = "Pavucontrol"; } ]

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.floating.modifier
options.note: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.floating.titlebar
options.note: Whether to show floating window titlebars.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus
options.note: Focus related settings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.followMouse
options.note: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.forceWrapping
options.note: Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.mouseWarping
options.note:
Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focus
to a window on a different output.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.newWindow
options.note: This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.focus.wrapping
options.note: Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.fonts
options.note: Font configuration for window titles, nagbar…
options.example: { names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ]; style = "Bold Semi-Condensed"; size = 11.0; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps
options.note: Gaps related settings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.bottom
options.note: Bottom gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.horizontal
options.note: Horizontal gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.inner
options.note: Inner gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.left
options.note: Left gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.outer
options.note: Outer gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.right
options.note: Right gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.smartBorders
options.note:
This option controls whether to disable container borders on
workspace with a single container.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.smartGaps
options.note:
This option controls whether to disable all gaps (outer and inner)
on workspace with a single container.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.top
options.note: Top gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.gaps.vertical
options.note: Vertical gaps value.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.input
options.note:
An attribute set that defines input modules. See
sway-input(5)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string
options.example: { "*" = { xkb_variant = "dvorak"; }; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.keybindings
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol.
See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.example: let modifier = config.wayland.windowManager.sway.config.modifier; in lib.mkOptionDefault { "${modifier}+Return" = "exec ${pkgs.foot}/bin/foot"; "${modifier}+Shift+q" = "kill"; "${modifier}+d" = "exec ${pkgs.dmenu}/bin/dmenu_path | ${pkgs.dmenu}/bin/dmenu | ${pkgs.findutils}/bin/xargs swaymsg exec --"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.keycodebindings
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code.
See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.example: { "214" = "exec /bin/script.sh"; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.left
options.note: Home row direction key for moving left.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.menu
options.note: Default launcher to use.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.modes
options.note:
An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindings
inside them
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.modifier
options.note: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.output
options.note:
An attribute set that defines output modules. See
sway-output(5)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string
options.example: { HDMI-A-2 = { bg = "~/path/to/background.png fill"; }; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.right
options.note: Home row direction key for moving right.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.seat
options.note:
An attribute set that defines seat modules. See
sway-input(5)
for options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string
options.example: { "*" = { hide_cursor = "when-typing enable"; }; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.startup
options.note: Commands that should be executed at startup.
options.example: [ { command = "systemctl --user restart waybar"; always = true; } { command = "dropbox start"; } { command = "firefox"; } ]

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.startup.*.always
options.note: Whether to run command on each sway restart.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.startup.*.command
options.note: Command that will be executed on startup.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.terminal
options.note: Default terminal to run.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.up
options.note: Home row direction key for moving up.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window
options.note: Window titlebar and border settings.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.border
options.note: Window border width.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.commands
options.note:
List of commands that should be executed on specific windows.
See for_window swaywm option documentation.
options.example: [ { command = "border pixel 1"; criteria = { class = "XTerm"; }; } ]

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.commands.*.command
options.note: Swaywm command to execute.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.commands.*.criteria
options.note: Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.
options.example: { title = "x200: ~/work"; floating = true; };

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.hideEdgeBorders
options.note: Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.window.titlebar
options.note: Whether to show window titlebars.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceAutoBackAndForth
options.note:
Assume you are on workspace “1: www” and switch to “2: IM” using
mod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to remember
where you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switch
back to “1: www”.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceLayout
options.note:
The mode in which new containers on workspace level will
start.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign
options.note: Assign workspaces to outputs.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.output
options.note: Name(s) of the output(s) from    swaymsg -t get_outputs .

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.workspace
options.note: Name of the workspace to assign.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/sway/config.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraConfigEarly
options.note: Like extraConfig, except lines are added to ~/.config/sway/config before all other configuration.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraOptions
options.note:
Command line arguments passed to launch Sway. Please DO NOT report
issues if you use an unsupported GPU (proprietary drivers).
options.example: [ "--verbose" "--debug" "--unsupported-gpu" "--my-next-gpu-wont-be-nvidia" ]

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.extraSessionCommands
options.note: Shell commands executed just before Sway is started.
options.example: '' export SDL_VIDEODRIVER=wayland # needs qt5.qtwayland in systemPackages export QT_QPA_PLATFORM=wayland export QT_WAYLAND_DISABLE_WINDOWDECORATION="1" # Fix for some Java AWT applications (e.g. Android Studio), # use this if they aren't displayed properly: export _JAVA_AWT_WM_NONREPARENTING=1 ''

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.enable
options.note: Whether to enable configuration of swaynag, a lightweight error bar for sway.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.swaynag.settings
options.note:
Configuration written to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/swaynag/config.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (Swaynag config atom (null, bool, int, float, str))
options.example: { "<config>" = { edge = "bottom"; font = "Dina 12"; }; green = { edge = "top"; background = "00AA00"; text = "FFFFFF"; button-background = "00CC00"; message-padding = 10; }; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.enable
options.note:
Whether to enable sway-session.target on
sway startup. This links to
graphical-session.target.
Some important environment variables will be imported to systemd
and dbus user environment before reaching the target, including

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.systemd.xdgAutostart
options.note:
Whether to enable autostart of applications using
systemd-xdg-autostart-generator(8)
.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures
options.note: Attribute set of features to enable in the wrapper.
options.example: { gtk = true; }

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures.base
options.note:
Whether to make use of the base wrapper to execute extra session commands and prepend a
dbus-run-session to the sway command.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.wrapperFeatures.gtk
options.note:
Whether to make use of the wrapGAppsHook wrapper to execute sway with required environment
variables for GTK applications.

options.title: wayland.windowManager.sway.xwayland
options.note: Enable xwayland, which is needed for the default configuration of sway.

options.title: xdg.enable
options.note: Whether to enable management of XDG base directories.

options.title: xdg.cacheHome
options.note: Absolute path to directory holding application caches.

options.title: xdg.configFile
options.note:
Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDG
configuration home.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.enable
options.note:
Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific
files to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.executable
options.note:
Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the mode
of the source file or to false
for files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.onChange
options.note:
Shell commands to run when file has changed between
generations. The script will be run
after the new files have been linked
into place.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.recursive
options.note:
If the file source is a directory, then this option
determines whether the directory should be recursively
linked to the target location. This option has no effect
if the source is a file.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.source
options.note:
Path of the source file or directory. If
xdg.configFile.<name>.text
is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file
containing that text.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.target
options.note: Path to target file relative to xdg.configHome.

options.title: xdg.configFile.<name>.text
options.note:
Text of the file. If this option is null then
xdg.configFile.<name>.source
must be set.

options.title: xdg.configHome
options.note: Absolute path to directory holding application configurations.

options.title: xdg.dataFile
options.note:
Attribute set of files to link into the user’s XDG
data home.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.enable
options.note:
Whether this file should be generated. This option allows specific
files to be disabled.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.executable
options.note:
Set the execute bit. If null, defaults to the mode
of the source file or to false
for files created through the text option.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.onChange
options.note:
Shell commands to run when file has changed between
generations. The script will be run
after the new files have been linked
into place.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.recursive
options.note:
If the file source is a directory, then this option
determines whether the directory should be recursively
linked to the target location. This option has no effect
if the source is a file.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.source
options.note:
Path of the source file or directory. If
xdg.dataFile.<name>.text
is non-null then this option will automatically point to a file
containing that text.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.target
options.note: Path to target file relative to <varname>xdg.dataHome</varname>.

options.title: xdg.dataFile.<name>.text
options.note:
Text of the file. If this option is null then
xdg.dataFile.<name>.source
must be set.

options.title: xdg.dataHome
options.note: Absolute path to directory holding application data.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries
options.note: Desktop Entries allow applications to be shown in your desktop environment’s app launcher.
options.example: { firefox = { name = "Firefox"; genericName = "Web Browser"; exec = "firefox %U"; terminal = false; categories = [ "Application" "Network" "WebBrowser" ]; mimeType = [ "text/html" "text/xml" ]; }; }

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions
options.note: The set of actions made available to application launchers.
options.example: { "New Window" = { exec = "${pkgs.firefox}/bin/firefox --new-window %u"; }; }

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.exec
options.note: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.icon
options.note: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.actions.<name>.name
options.note: Name of the action.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.categories
options.note: Categories in which the entry should be shown in a menu.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.comment
options.note: Tooltip for the entry.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.exec
options.note: Program to execute, possibly with arguments.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.genericName
options.note: Generic name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.icon
options.note: Icon to display in file manager, menus, etc.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.mimeType
options.note: The MIME type(s) supported by this application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.name
options.note: Specific name of the application.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.noDisplay
options.note:
Means “this application exists, but don’t display it in the menus”.
This can be useful to e.g. associate this application with MIME types.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.prefersNonDefaultGPU
options.note: If true, the application prefers to be run on a more powerful discrete GPU if available.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.settings
options.note:
Extra key-value pairs to add to the [Desktop Entry] section.
This may override other values.
options.example: { Keywords = "calc;math"; DBusActivatable = "false"; }

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.startupNotify
options.note:
If true, it is KNOWN that the application will send a “remove”
message when started with the DESKTOP_STARTUP_ID
environment variable set. If false, it is KNOWN that the application
does not work with startup notification at all.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.terminal
options.note: Whether the program runs in a terminal window.

options.title: xdg.desktopEntries.<name>.type
options.note: The type of the desktop entry.

options.title: xdg.mime.enable
options.note:
Whether to install programs and files to support the
XDG Shared MIME-info specification and XDG MIME Applications
specification at
https://specifications.freedesktop.org/shared-mime-info-spec/shared-mime-info-spec-latest.html
and
https://specifications.freedesktop.org/mime-apps-spec/mime-apps-spec-latest.html,
respectively.
options.default: true if host platform is Linux, false otherwise

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.enable
options.note: Whether to manage $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/mimeapps.list.

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.added
options.note:
Defines additional associations of applications with
mimetypes, as if the .desktop file was listing this mimetype
in the first place.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)
options.example: { "mimetype1" = [ "foo1.desktop" "foo2.desktop" "foo3.desktop" ]; "mimetype2" = "foo4.desktop"; }

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.associations.removed
options.note:
Removes associations of applications with mimetypes, as if the
.desktop file was not listing this
mimetype in the first place.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)
options.example: { mimetype1 = "foo5.desktop"; }

options.title: xdg.mimeApps.defaultApplications
options.note:
The default application to be used for a given mimetype. This
is, for instance, the one that will be started when
double-clicking on a file in a file manager. If the
application is no longer installed, the next application in
the list is attempted, and so on.
options.type: attribute set of ((list of string) or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)
options.example: { "mimetype1" = [ "default1.desktop" "default2.desktop" ]; }

options.title: xdg.portal.enable
options.note: Whether to enable XDG desktop integration.

options.title: xdg.portal.config
options.note:
Sets which portal backend should be used to provide the implementation
for the requested interface. For details check portals.conf(5).
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of (string or ((list of string) or string) convertible to it)
options.example: { common = { default = [ "gtk" ]; }; pantheon = { default = [ "pantheon" "gtk" ]; "org.freedesktop.impl.portal.Secret" = [ "gnome-keyring" ]; }; x-cinnamon = { default = [ "xapp" "gtk" ]; }; }

options.title: xdg.portal.configPackages
options.note:
List of packages that provide XDG desktop portal configuration, usually in
the form of share/xdg-desktop-portal/$desktop-portals.conf.

options.title: xdg.portal.extraPortals
options.note:
List of additional portals that should be passed to the
xdg-desktop-portal.service, via the XDG_DESKTOP_PORTAL_DIR
variable.

options.title: xdg.portal.xdgOpenUsePortal
options.note:
Sets environment variable NIXOS_XDG_OPEN_USE_PORTAL to 1
This will make xdg-open use the portal to open programs, which resolves bugs involving
programs opening inside FHS envs or with unexpected env vars set from wrappers.
See #160923 for more info.

options.title: xdg.stateHome
options.note: Absolute path to directory holding application states.

options.title: xdg.systemDirs.config
options.note:
Directory names to add to XDG_CONFIG_DIRS
in the user session.

options.title: xdg.systemDirs.data
options.note:
Directory names to add to XDG_DATA_DIRS
in the user session.

options.title: xdg.userDirs.enable
options.note: Whether to manage $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/user-dirs.dirs.

options.title: xdg.userDirs.createDirectories
options.note: Whether to enable automatic creation of the XDG user directories.

options.title: xdg.userDirs.desktop
options.note: The Desktop directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.documents
options.note: The Documents directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.download
options.note: The Downloads directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.extraConfig
options.note: Other user directories.
options.type: attribute set of (string or path convertible to it)
options.example: { XDG_MISC_DIR = "${config.home.homeDirectory}/Misc"; }

options.title: xdg.userDirs.music
options.note: The Music directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.pictures
options.note: The Pictures directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.publicShare
options.note: The Public share directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.templates
options.note: The Templates directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xdg.userDirs.videos
options.note: The Videos directory.
options.type: null or (string or path convertible to it)

options.title: xfconf.settings
options.note: Settings to write to the Xfconf configuration system.
options.example: { xfce4-session = { "startup/ssh-agent/enabled" = false; "general/LockCommand" = "${pkgs.lightdm}/bin/dm-tool lock"; }; xfce4-desktop = { "backdrop/screen0/monitorLVDS-1/workspace0/last-image" = "${pkgs.nixos-artwork.wallpapers.stripes-logo.gnomeFilePath}"; }; }

options.title: xresources.extraConfig
options.note:
Additional X server resources contents.
If this and all other xresources options are
null, then this feature is disabled and no
~/.Xresources link is produced.
options.example: builtins.readFile ( pkgs.fetchFromGitHub { owner = "solarized"; repo = "xresources"; rev = "025ceddbddf55f2eb4ab40b05889148aab9699fc"; sha256 = "0lxv37gmh38y9d3l8nbnsm1mskcv10g3i83j0kac0a2qmypv1k9f"; } + "/Xresources.dark" )

options.title: xresources.path
options.note: Path where Home Manager should link the .Xresources file.

options.title: xresources.properties
options.note:
X server resources that should be set.
Booleans are formatted as “true” or “false” respectively.
List elements are recursively formatted as a string and joined by commas.
All other values are directly formatted using builtins.toString.
Note, that 2-dimensional lists are not supported and specifying one will throw an exception.
If this and all other xresources options are
null, then this feature is disabled and no
~/.Xresources link is produced.
options.type: null or (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or string)))
options.example: { "Emacs*toolBar" = 0; "XTerm*faceName" = "dejavu sans mono"; "XTerm*charClass" = [ "37:48" "45-47:48" "58:48" "64:48" "126:48" ]; }

options.title: xsession.enable
options.note: Whether to enable X Session.

options.title: xsession.initExtra
options.note: Extra shell commands to run during initialization.

options.title: xsession.numlock.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Num Lock.

options.title: xsession.pointerCursor.package
options.note: Alias of home.pointerCursor.package.

options.title: xsession.pointerCursor.defaultCursor
options.note: Alias of home.pointerCursor.x11.defaultCursor.

options.title: xsession.pointerCursor.name
options.note: Alias of home.pointerCursor.name.

options.title: xsession.pointerCursor.size
options.note: Alias of home.pointerCursor.size.

options.title: xsession.preferStatusNotifierItems
options.note:
Whether tray applets should prefer using the Status Notifier
Items (SNI) protocol, commonly called App Indicators. Note,
not all tray applets or status bars support SNI.

options.title: xsession.profileExtra
options.note: Extra shell commands to run before session start.

options.title: xsession.profilePath
options.note:
Path, relative to HOME, where Home Manager
should write the X profile script.

options.title: xsession.scriptPath
options.note:
Path, relative to HOME, where Home Manager
should write the X session script.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Awesome window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.package
options.note: Package to use for running the Awesome WM.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.luaModules
options.note:
List of lua packages available for being
used in the Awesome configuration.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.awesome.noArgb
options.note:
Disable client transparency support, which can be greatly
detrimental to performance in some setups

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.enable
options.note: Whether to enable bspwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.package
options.note: The bspwm package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.alwaysResetDesktops
options.note:
If set to true, desktops configured in monitors will be reset
every time the config is run.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfig
options.note: Additional shell commands to be run at the end of the config file.
options.example: '' bspc subscribe all > ~/bspc-report.log & ''

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.extraConfigEarly
options.note: Like extraConfig, except commands are run at the start of the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.monitors
options.note: Specifies the names of desktops to create on each monitor.
options.type: attribute set of list of string
options.example: { HDMI-0 = [ "web" "terminal" "III" "IV" ]; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules
options.note: Rule configuration. The keys of the attribute set are the targets of the rules.
options.type: attribute set of (attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))
options.example: { "Gimp" = { desktop = "^8"; state = "floating"; follow = true; }; "Kupfer.py" = { focus = true; }; "Screenkey" = { manage = false; }; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.border
options.note: Whether the node should have border.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.center
options.note: Whether the node will be put in the center, in floating mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.desktop
options.note: The desktop where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.focus
options.note: Whether the node should gain focus on creation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.follow
options.note: Whether focus should follow the node when it is moved.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.hidden
options.note: Whether the node should occupy any space.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.layer
options.note: The layer where a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.locked
options.note:
Whether the node should ignore node --close
messages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.manage
options.note:
Whether the window should be managed by bspwm. If false, the window
will be ignored by bspwm entirely. This is useful for overlay apps,
e.g. screenshot tools.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.marked
options.note: Whether the node will be marked for deferred actions.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.monitor
options.note: The monitor where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.node
options.note: The node where the rule should be applied.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.private
options.note: Whether the node should stay in the same tiling position and size.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.rectangle
options.note: The node’s geometry, in the format WxH+X+Y.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitDir
options.note: The direction where the container is going to be split.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.splitRatio
options.note:
The ratio between the new window and the previous existing window in
the desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.state
options.note: The state in which a new window should spawn.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.rules.<name>.sticky
options.note: Whether the node should stay on the focused desktop.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.settings
options.note: General settings given to bspc config.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string or list of (boolean or signed integer or floating point number or string))
options.example: { border_width = 2; gapless_monocle = true; split_ratio = 0.52; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.bspwm.startupPrograms
options.note: Programs to be executed during startup.
options.example: [ "numlockx on" "tilda" ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.command
options.note: Command to use to start the window manager.
options.example: let xmonad = pkgs.xmonad-with-packages.override { packages = self: [ self.xmonad-contrib self.taffybar ]; }; in "${xmonad}/bin/xmonad";

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Fluxbox window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.package
options.note: The fluxbox package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.apps
options.note:
Apps configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/apps. Look at the
fluxbox(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.extraCommandLineArgs
options.note:
Extra command line arguments to pass to fluxbox.
Look at the
fluxbox(1) manpage for details.
options.example: [ "-log" "/tmp/fluxbox.log" ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.init
options.note:
Init configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/init. Look at the
fluxbox(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.keys
options.note:
Keyboard shortcuts configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/keys. Look at the
fluxbox-keys(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.menu
options.note:
Menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/menu. Look at the
fluxbox-menu(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.slitlist
options.note:
Slitlist configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/slitlist. Look at the
fluxbox(1) manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.fluxbox.windowmenu
options.note:
Window menu configuration for Fluxbox, written to
~/.fluxbox/windowmenu. Look at the
fluxbox-menu(1)
manpage for details.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.enable
options.note: Whether to enable herbstluftwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.package
options.note:
Package providing the herbstluftwm and
herbstclient commands.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.extraConfig
options.note:
Extra configuration lines to add verbatim to
$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/herbstluftwm/autostart.
options.example: '' herbstclient set_layout max herbstclient detect_monitors ''

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.keybinds
options.note: Herbstluftwm keybinds.
options.example: { Mod4-o = "split right"; Mod4-u = "split bottom"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.mousebinds
options.note: Herbstluftwm mousebinds.
options.example: { Mod4-B1 = "move"; Mod4-B3 = "resize"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.rules
options.note: Herbstluftwm rules.
options.example: [ "windowtype~'_NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_(DIALOG|UTILITY|SPLASH)' focus=on pseudotile=on" "windowtype~'_NET_WM_WINDOW_TYPE_(NOTIFICATION|DOCK|DESKTOP)' manage=off" ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.settings
options.note: Herbstluftwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { gapless_grid = false; window_border_width = 1; window_border_active_color = "#FF0000"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.herbstluftwm.tags
options.note: Tags to create on startup.
options.example: [ "work" "browser" "music" "gaming" ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.enable
options.note: Whether to enable i3 window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.package
options.note: The i3 package to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config
options.note: i3 configuration options.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns applications to workspaces based
on criteria.
options.type: attribute set of list of attribute set of (string or boolean)
options.example: { "1: web" = [{ class = "^Firefox$"; }]; "0: extra" = [{ class = "^Firefox$"; window_role = "About"; }]; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars
options.note: i3 bars settings blocks. Set to empty list to remove bars completely.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors
options.note:
Bar color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, fields and RGB color hex-codes as values.
See default values for the reference.
Note that ‘background’, ‘status’, and ‘separator’ parameters take a single RGB value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.activeWorkspace
options.note: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace is active.
options.example: { background = "#5f676a"; border = "#333333"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.background
options.note: Background color of the bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.bindingMode
options.note: Border, background and text color for the binding mode indicator
options.example: { background = "#900000"; border = "#2f343a"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedBackground
options.note: Background color of the bar on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedSeparator
options.note: Text color to be used for the separator on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedStatusline
options.note: Text color to be used for the statusline on the currently focused monitor output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.focusedWorkspace
options.note: Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace has focus.
options.example: { background = "#285577"; border = "#4c7899"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.inactiveWorkspace
options.note:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace does not
have focus and is not active.
options.example: { background = "#222222"; border = "#333333"; text = "#888888"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.separator
options.note: Text color to be used for the separator.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.statusline
options.note: Text color to be used for the statusline.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.colors.urgentWorkspace
options.note:
Border, background and text color for a workspace button when the workspace contains
a window with the urgency hint set.
options.example: { background = "#900000"; border = "#2f343a"; text = "#ffffff"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.command
options.note: Command that will be used to start a bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines for this bar.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.fonts
options.note: Font configuration for this bar.
options.example: { names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ]; style = "Bold Semi-Condensed"; size = 11.0; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.hiddenState
options.note: The default bar mode when ‘bar.mode’ == ‘hide’.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.id
options.note:
Specifies the bar ID for the configured bar instance.
If this option is missing, the ID is set to bar-x, where x corresponds
to the position of the embedding bar block in the config file.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.mode
options.note: Bar visibility mode.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.position
options.note: The edge of the screen i3bar should show up.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.statusCommand
options.note: Command that will be used to get status lines.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayOutput
options.note: Where to output tray.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.trayPadding
options.note:
Sets the pixel padding of the system tray.
This padding will surround the tray on all sides and between each item.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceButtons
options.note: Whether workspace buttons should be shown or not.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.bars.*.workspaceNumbers
options.note: Whether workspace numbers should be displayed within the workspace buttons.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors
options.note:
Color settings. All color classes can be specified using submodules
with ‘border’, ‘background’, ‘text’, ‘indicator’ and ‘childBorder’ fields
and RGB color hex-codes as values. See default values for the reference.
Note that ‘i3.config.colors.background’ parameter takes a single RGB value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.background
options.note:
Background color of the window. Only applications which do not cover
the whole area expose the color.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focused
options.note: A window which currently has the focus.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.focusedInactive
options.note:
A window which is the focused one of its container,
but it does not have the focus at the moment.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.placeholder
options.note:
Background and text color are used to draw placeholder window
contents (when restoring layouts). Border and indicator are ignored.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.unfocused
options.note: A window which is not focused.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.colors.urgent
options.note: A window which has its urgency hint activated.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.defaultWorkspace
options.note:
The default workspace to show when i3 is launched.
This must to correspond to the value of the keybinding of the default workspace.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating
options.note: Floating window settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.border
options.note: Floating windows border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.criteria
options.note: List of criteria for windows that should be opened in a floating mode.
options.type: list of attribute set of (string or boolean)
options.example: [ { title = "Steam - Update News"; } { class = "Pavucontrol"; } ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.modifier
options.note: Modifier key or keys that can be used to drag floating windows.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.floating.titlebar
options.note: Whether to show floating window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus
options.note: Focus related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.followMouse
options.note: Whether focus should follow the mouse.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.forceWrapping
options.note: Whether to force focus wrapping in tabbed or stacked containers.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.mouseWarping
options.note:
Whether mouse cursor should be warped to the center of the window when switching focus
to a window on a different output.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.newWindow
options.note: This option modifies focus behavior on new window activation.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.focus.wrapping
options.note: Whether the window focus commands automatically wrap around the edge of containers.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.fonts
options.note: Font configuration for window titles, nagbar…
options.example: { names = [ "DejaVu Sans Mono" "FontAwesome5Free" ]; style = "Bold Semi-Condensed"; size = 11.0; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps
options.note: Gaps related settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.bottom
options.note: Bottom gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.horizontal
options.note: Horizontal gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.inner
options.note: Inner gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.left
options.note: Left gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.outer
options.note: Outer gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.right
options.note: Right gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartBorders
options.note:
This option controls whether to disable container borders on
workspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.smartGaps
options.note:
This option controls whether to disable all gaps (outer and inner)
on workspace with a single container.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.top
options.note: Top gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.gaps.vertical
options.note: Vertical gaps value.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keybindings
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns a key press to an action using a key symbol.
See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.example: let modifier = config.xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modifier; in lib.mkOptionDefault { "${modifier}+Return" = "exec i3-sensible-terminal"; "${modifier}+Shift+q" = "kill"; "${modifier}+d" = "exec ${pkgs.dmenu}/bin/dmenu_run"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.keycodebindings
options.note:
An attribute set that assigns keypress to an action using key code.
See https://i3wm.org/docs/userguide.html#keybindings.
options.example: { "214" = "exec /bin/script.sh"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.menu
options.note: Default launcher to use.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modes
options.note:
An attribute set that defines binding modes and keybindings
inside them
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of string

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.modifier
options.note: Modifier key that is used for all default keybindings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup
options.note: Commands that should be executed at startup.
options.example: [ { command = "systemctl --user restart polybar"; always = true; notification = false; } { command = "dropbox start"; notification = false; } { command = "firefox"; } ];

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.always
options.note: Whether to run command on each i3 restart.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.command
options.note: Command that will be executed on startup.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.notification
options.note:
Whether to enable startup-notification support for the command.
See --no-startup-id option description in the i3 user guide.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.startup.*.workspace
options.note:
Launch application on a particular workspace. DEPRECATED:
Use xsession.windowManager.i3.config.assigns
instead. See https://github.com/nix-community/home-manager/issues/265.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.terminal
options.note: Default terminal to run.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window
options.note: Window titlebar and border settings.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.border
options.note: Window border width.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands
options.note:
List of commands that should be executed on specific windows.
See for_window i3wm option documentation.
options.example: [ { command = "border pixel 1"; criteria = { class = "XTerm"; }; } ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.command
options.note: i3wm command to execute.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.commands.*.criteria
options.note: Criteria of the windows on which command should be executed.
options.example: { title = "x200: ~/work"; floating = true; };

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.hideEdgeBorders
options.note: Hide window borders adjacent to the screen edges.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.window.titlebar
options.note: Whether to show window titlebars.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceAutoBackAndForth
options.note:
Assume you are on workspace “1: www” and switch to “2: IM” using
mod+2 because somebody sent you a message. You don’t need to remember
where you came from now, you can just press $mod+2 again to switch
back to “1: www”.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceLayout
options.note:
The mode in which new containers on workspace level will
start.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign
options.note: Assign workspaces to outputs.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.output
options.note: Name(s) of the output(s) from    i3-msg -t get_outputs .

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.config.workspaceOutputAssign.*.workspace
options.note: Name of the workspace to assign.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.i3.extraConfig
options.note: Extra configuration lines to add to ~/.config/i3/config.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.enable
options.note: Whether to enable Spectrwm window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.package
options.note: Package providing the spectrwm command.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.bindings
options.note: Spectrwm keybindings.
options.example: { term = "Mod+Return"; restart = "Mod+Shift+r"; quit = "Mod+Shift+q"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.programs
options.note: Spectrwm programs variables.
options.example: { term = "alacritty"; search = "dmenu -ip -p 'Window name/id:'; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.quirks
options.note: Spectrwm quicks (custom window rules).
options.example: { Matplotlib = "FLOAT"; Pavucontrol = "FLOAT"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.settings
options.note: Spectrwm settings.
options.type: attribute set of (boolean or signed integer or string)
options.example: { modkey = "Mod4"; workspace_limit = 5; focus_mode = "manual"; focus_close = "next"; }

options.title: xsession.windowManager.spectrwm.unbindings
options.note: List of keybindings to disable from default Spectrwm configuration.
options.example: [ "MOD+e" "MOD+f" "MOD+m" "MOD+s" "MOD+u" "MOD+t" ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enable
options.note: Whether to enable xmonad window manager.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.enableContribAndExtras
options.note: Enable xmonad-{contrib,extras} in xmonad.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.config
options.note:
The configuration file to be used for xmonad. This must be
an absolute path or null in which case
~/.xmonad/xmonad.hs will not be managed
by Home Manager.
options.example: pkgs.writeText "xmonad.hs" '' import XMonad main = xmonad defaultConfig { terminal = "urxvt" , modMask = mod4Mask , borderWidth = 3 } ''

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.extraPackages
options.note:
Extra packages available to GHC when rebuilding xmonad. The
value must be a function which receives the attribute set
defined in haskellPackages as the sole
argument.
options.example: haskellPackages: [ haskellPackages.xmonad-contrib haskellPackages.monad-logger ]

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.haskellPackages
options.note:
The haskellPackages used to build xmonad
and other packages. This can be used to change the GHC
version used to build xmonad and the packages listed in
extraPackages.

options.title: xsession.windowManager.xmonad.libFiles
options.note:
Additional files that will be saved in
~/.xmonad/lib/ and included in the configuration
build. The keys are the file names while the values are paths to the
contents of the files.
options.example: { "Tools.hs" = pkgs.writeText "Tools.hs" '' module Tools where screenshot = "scrot" ''; }
